results.description:
CHECK BACK SOON FOR NEW DATE!

Admission: Round Trip Ticket is $26

http://www.nysec.org/sites/default/files/styles/medium/public/images/hike_1.jpg?itok=BY3s1ouS

Join us on a hike to
Mt. Taurus in historic Cold Spring, NY.

This 5-hour hike will take us to a summit over the Hudson River. You will be rewarded with stunning views of the river and, on a clear day, Manhattan.  We will take a scenic train ride to the town of Cold Spring.  The town, set on the east bank of Hudson, has many antique stores, nice coffee shops, several restaurants, and a lovely small park.  This town is worth a day's visit even if you do not hike! 

The ride on Metro North Hudson line takes an hour and twenty minutes and offers spectacular views of the river.  We will meet at the information booth at Grand Central at 8:30am.  If you arrive after that time, find us on the train that leaves at 8:44am (Hudson Line).  The round trip ticket is $26. Please buy your own tickets.  Bring a water bottle, light lunch and/or snack for the trail, and a few dollars for a coffee stop at a local cafe.  Wear hiking or sturdy walking shoes (there are some steep parts on decent), and dress in layers for the hike.  Rain cancels

results.description:
Qi Gong is a part of traditional Chinese medicine that views and treats the body, mind and the environment as a whole. Qi Gong practices include slow body movements, meditation, and special breathing techniques. Qi Gong students can experience deep relaxation, concentration and a peaceful, clear mind. In addition, Qi Gong practices help to clear energy blockages and improve blood circulation in the body. In this class, students will learn Qi Gong exercises to increase flexibility, improve balance, reduce stress, increase concentration, and rejuvenate the mind, body, spirit and more!

The cost for attending eight Saturday classes is $65 for Non-Greenburgh residents, and $54 for Greenburgh residents.

Details:

1 game (7 v 7) : Two halves of 30 minutes each with a break in between

-Please bring a fun and chill attitude. Absolutely no rough playing, slide-tackling or berating others; You’ll be asked to leave.

-Turf, AG cleats, or sneakers - no wet ground monster spikes.

-$4.00 goes for maintaining the website, equipment, and organization.

Rules:

This is a chill game so please bring a chill attitude; no meatheads or a$$holes. Organizers have the final say (i.e. if a ball is out of bounds we call it).
It’s a small pitch so no corners kicks; just throwins.

Directions:

How to get to Brooklyn Bridge Park PIER 2 Sports Field:

To get past the BQE, you must enter Brooklyn Bridge Park on foot either fromm the south (at Joralemon St. & Furman St.) or the north (at Old Fulton St. & Furman St.) Pier 2 is roughly halfway between these two entrances. We play on the artificial grass field at the far end of the pier, behind the basketball courts & roller rink.

Google these coordinates:[masked], [masked]

Brooklyn Bridge Park is accessible by several subway lines (A/C, 2/3, 4/5, F, R) and bus routes (B25, B63)

Cancellation: We'll play rain or shine. We'll only cancel if there are fewer than 10 people going, or if there's lightning in the area.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

Hey guys, I just wanted to make this video to invite you guys to come with me and my partner as we find out next investment property. 

This is an opportunity to get hands on training as we drive to different properties that we are considering to purchase. We will begin the day by viewing properties, taking notes on repairs and keeping our eyes open for other possible properties in the area. Then we will get back to the office to run numbers and determine what our offers will be, then we will submit an offer on the properties we feel make sense for our next Fix and Flip project.

You want to learn on the field? This is your opportunity to do so. RSVP and you'll receive confirmation. Look forward to seeing you there.

Приглашаем познакомиться и пройтись по необычному скальному рельефу и посмотреть великолепные виды Mohonk Preserve. Нас ждут прогулка между скалами и короткий пешеходный маршрут.


Парковка маленькая.

Join us for challenging Rock Scrambling  and short hike at Mohonk Preserve. We will explore crevices, towering rock walls and breakdown of the "Lost City" and Bonticou Crag.

Total distance: 5-6 miles

Mohonk preserve fee:


* $12 for hikers

Map: Shawangunk Trails #104

http://parks.ny.gov/parks/attachments/SamPointAreaMinnewaskaStateParkTrailMap.pdf

Parking: 

First Point:

807 Clove Rd Gardiner, NY

Second Point:

Spring Farm Parking

Upper 27 Knolls Rd.

High falls NY 12440

GPS:[masked],[masked]

Coxing is the Preserve’s smallest parking lot and fills VERY early on peak weekends. On summer and fall weekends, arrive early and consider carpooling to ensure a parking space.

Take the New Paltz exit 18 off of the NYS Thruway. Go 7 miles west (through New Paltz) on Route 299 to the end: make right on Route 44-55. The Preserve Visitor Center will be 1/2 mile on your right. Go 1.5 miles past the Visitor Center, turn right onto Clove Road, and then bear right at fork. After 1 mile, turn left into parking area.

It is recommended to have:

- Hiking boots

- long sleeve shirt 

- Long pants 

- Water

- Helmet (optional)

- Gloves 

- Head Light

------------------------------------

If you join us for hiking (or any other event), understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation

that may happen at a planned event. It is your responsibility to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on this trip signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.

Please, review safety information

results.description:
We'll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery for a run on the Old Croton Aqueduct. Afterward, whoever is interested can head to the Red Barn Bakery for breakfast. This is a good run for new runners because it is out and back - no set distance to cover but you will need to wear a watch. Feel free to turnaround at any point or walk/run at your own pace. 

Details about the Saturday run

Route: We’ll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St.) in Irvington and jog VERY casually together to the Old Croton Aqueduct trail. (If you are unfamiliar with the area and would prefer to walk rather than run to the trail, click here to see the trail on a map.) From there we’ll head south toward Dobbs Ferry. There is no set distance. Everyone will walk or run at their own pace for 25 minutes, and then turn around and come back. Please wear a watch so that you know when to turn around.

Water/Bag Storage: There are very few water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.

Location: In front of Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St, Irvington, NY 10533). Free parking is available on weekends in the MetroNorth lot next door.

</a>  <a href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/1452433901730637/">Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs:

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.

results.description:
RSVP's begin on Thursday, March 24th at 9:00pm.  $10.00 covers a private guided visit to Edgar Allan Poe Cottage of the Bronx Historic Society and a visit to the historic Woodlawn Cemetery (guided by Hank), a National Landmark (see overview below).

This should be quite a day -- all about the role of The Bronx in New York City history and traversing some of the more obscure areas of the North-Central Bronx.  Note this is an early morning experience as we have a special opportunity to visit a house built in the year 1812 that was the Bronx home of famous author Edgar Allan Poe, his wife Virginia and his mother-in-law.  This  city-owned cottage, is where Poe wrote the poems “Annabel Lee”and “The Bells” and the short story “The Cask of Amontillado.

We'll have a private guide there from 9am - 10am and the center is being specially opened for our group.  We'll also stroll along the most unique streets in the City - Mosholu Parkway, and after exploring the Norwood neighborhood we'll make our way to the historic Woodlawn Cemetery. I may suggest bringing a picnic lunch - weather permitting.  Snacks and water to hold you over - strongly recommended.  A good 5 miles walking in total. 

We'll visit the Woodlawn Cemetery,  the final resting place of some of America's most special and accomplished people (including many NY natives): Duke Ellington, Elizabeth Cady Stanton, Robert Moses, RH Macy, Miles Davis, FW Woolworth, Gertrude Vanderbilt Whitney, Leonard Bernstein, Herman Melville, and George M. Cohan - to name just a few. 


Woodlawn Cemetery which contains 1,300+ architectural monuments is an outdoor museum : with its collection of mausolea and monuments, set on 400 beautifully landscaped acres, stand as individual works of art to be interpreted and shared. Discover beautifully carved stonework, and historical narratives significant to both our borough, city, region, and nation.
results.how_to_find_us: Take the D train or #4 train Kingsbridge Road in The Bronx. Poe Park is right outside the D station.  Take the train  4 to Kingsbridge Road in The Bronx. Walk east to Grand Concourse. The cottage is located across the boulevard, on the right.
results.name: Norwood, Woodlawn Cemetery and a Visit to Poe Cottage

results.description:
Hello Friends,


At the end of every quarter, as a way of tracking the passage of time and underscoring the meaning of change in our lives, Heights Meditation members come together, go outside, walk around, look up and look down, and meditate. During the 45 minutes or so that we're underway, we walk in silence, slowly, and pay attention to life. Sometimes we stop and sit and close our eyes. Other times we walk in silence and let the fact that we're alive (and conscious of it) sink in. 


That's no small thing, to let consciousness observe and take good care of itself. Another term for it is: waking up!


You have to ask yourself: when was the last time that you took the time to slow down and look and savor--actually look and savor--the world manifesting around us? Sometimes when you answer that question honestly, you will say: I haven't really done that since I was a child.


If you've ever observed Heights Meditation members walking through our Washington Heights neighborhood on one of our silent meditative walks, you'll have seen a group of people picking their way across the city landscape, stopping occasionally to sit in front of a river or an empty playground or a wall of yellow bricks. You'll have heard the gently jangling cow bell, the only sound we make as we move across a piece of northern Manhattan. The gentle jangles call us continually back to the present, to the now! now! now!  that is the heart of the meditator's work.


This Saturday, April 9th, we will hold the annual Spring Walk followed by a get together in a private apartment. This is a wonderful opportunity to catch up with each other after our recent retreat upstate and to welcome spring and new meditators into our midst! 


Here's the details. Please RSVP if you intend to participate in the walk and/or the get together which will follow the walk. If you'd like to make a contribution to the get together (food or drink), please also let us know.


Annual Silent Meditation Walk

Saturday, April 9th at 9:00 AM sharp 

(Meditators: please note time change, this walking meditation replaces the usual 8:00 AM sitt)

Meeting place: Cornerstone Center, West 189th Street and Bennett Avenue(A train to 181st Street or 1 train to 190th)

Social Hour: 10:00 am - 11:00 am (Location TBD).

We look forward to seeing old friends and new friends on this occasion. Please bring along a friend if you like!

Thank you and see you Saturday!

results.description:
Mayer will be taking the 9:51 a.m. train from Grand Central to White Plains, arriving White Plains 10:27, then taking the 11:00 Westchester County Bee Line bus #12 to King Street and Sherwood Road along Route 120A in Purchase, NY. The bus takes MetroCards, fare is $2.75. Return from the hike will be via bus #12 from the Westchester County Airport back to the White Plains train station, arriving back in White Plains between 4:00 and 4:30.


Here is a link to the MetroNorth Harlem line weekend schedule: Harlem Line

(Note that Mayer originally told me the 9:47 train but the new MetroNorth schedule has changed the train to 9:51.)

Here is a link to the bus #12 schedule: Bus #12

Moderate pace, about 6 miles, 4 hours.  Visit a rushing river in a hemlock gorge.  Maybe there will also be white snow, yellow sun, and a blue sky.  Bring lunch and extra pair socks; no smoking. Joint hike with Outdoor Club and NY Hiking Club.

MEET: 9:25AM Grand Central, Information Booth upper level.  Fare round trip $21 (senior $13).

Leader: Mayer Weisen call[masked] before 10:30 pm for any other information. Joint walk with Outdoor Club.


Contact hike leader directly if you have questions about the hike.

Free for Shorewalkers members who have paid the $20 annual membership fee, $3 for non-members. Non-members please pay the hike leader at the beginning of the hike or visit www.shorewalkers.org to join.

results.description:
Would you like to get your hands on the most powerful tablet known to man? How about winning one to take home with you? Yes! This is real. Please attend this once in a lifetime event sponsored by Google®  

Project Tango technology gives a mobile device the ability to navigate the physical world similar to how we do as humans. Project Tango brings a new kind of spatial perception to the
Android device platform by adding advanced computer vision, image processing, and special vision sensors. 

To put it bluntly You'll forever regret it if you miss this - and don't be late - because that may mean you'll miss out. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k43xJs3Roqg

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qe10ExwzCqk

Schedule: 

9:30am-11am Unity® Boot Camp

11am-1p Tango Essentials and Lunch

1p-4p Tango Development - Your team will only be loaned a Tango Device if present for Unity® Boot Camp & Tango Essentials

4pm Prizes, Publishing and Partying


The journey to staten island (and the makerspace) by ferry is  free and highly recommended, especially in the magical warm weather. Some members are carpooling, fantastic! Use the comments if you'd like to meet up - take the journey together and document your journey, we would probably feature it. 
 Ample parking is available! All are welcome! You may be upset if you miss this one.

Come and experience unique and authentic Yang style Tai Chi taught by Master Yao Wah Chan. Master Yao was a student of Pang-Na Chang, a third generation Yang style master. Come walk "with a doc"  every Saturday Morning  9:30am.  These meetups will have at least one  physician and a number of healthcare professionals joining you on your walk.   Same time / Same location through the month of June. 

Dr. Michael Ombrellino, Board Certified Vascular Surgeon will provide you  with some helpful tips on how to lead a healthy lifestyle and promote good vascular health.

Walk at your own pace, and as you will see someone will be walking with you! These are simply fun moments and make for a great opportunity to meet and chat with others on your walk.

Once around the pond is approximately 2 miles and takes on average 35-50 minutes to complete.  

All the best,

K

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
The Institute for Architectural Research, Inc. is offering a two-part workshop on the art and geometry of interior sketching. The General Society of Mechanics and Tradesmen (20 West 44th Street) will be our lab in which we will learn the basics of interior perspective, orthographic projection, and line weights. The course is open to all levels of drawing experience.

Session 1 (April 9): basic technical drawing skills for analyzing interior space.


There is no requirement for sketchbooks, or pencils; please be prepared with your own material. However, if you would like to buy a sketchbook, the Institute for Architectural Research offers a sketching kit, which includes a unique Institute & ASID sketchbook; pencils, erasers, and sketch & wash pencil. Kits will be hand delivered at the start of the workshop.
results.how_to_find_us: at the front lobby
results.name: The Art & Geometry of Interior Visualization - Session 1

results.description:
SACRED POWER PLAY
A TANTRIC PATH OF DOMINATION AND SUBMISSION  with Dr. Kristina Kincaid

It is easy to overlook your resistance to giving and receiving pleasure and love in your everyday life, but magnified by the exaggerated play of domination and submission these constraints will become strikingly apparent.

Where don’t you trust your partner? What pleasures are you fearful of expressing or experiencing? Are there parts of yourself or your partner that you don’t fully love and accept? Do you trust your own ability to bring your partner into the depths of their open heart and surrender?

Consciously confronting your resistance, you can learn to allow the depth of love to penetrate you. Then, you and your partner will be able to freely surrender to the fullness of your love and pleasure. With humor and tenderness, we will use the practice of domination and submission to explore your fears and to expand your ability to experience more pleasure and love.

IN THIS WORKSHOP YOU WILL LEARN:

– how to understand and accept your dark attractions to get what you really desire,
– how “being a lover” is a commitment to the act of generosity and transcending the self,
– how to identify areas of emotional trauma versus ones with a strong erotic charge,
– how to magnify desire and polarity,
– to navigate the razor’s edge between domination and submission and mutuality,
– to access the ability to stand in your full power and surrender your power as a tool for your liberation and empowerment,
– how the dynamics of domination and submission play out in in your daily life,
– how to move through the abuse of the sexual to sexual integrity.

Note: This workshop is for both couples and singles. It does not include nudity or explicit sexual touch. All genders and sexual preferences welcome.


Admission: $270 before Mar 26th, $295 after

For tickets click here!

Led by Dr. Kristina Kincaid

Assisted by Tara Urszula Pietrzykowska

</a>

When you register or attend, please make a point to tell the facilitator that you heard about this event from the Pleasure Without Borders Meetup


Dr. Kincaid is the Director of The Institute of Integral Evolutionary Tantra, New York City. Kristina is on faculty at The Institute of Core Energetics and holds an M.A. in Energy Medicine and a Doctorate in Theology from Holos University. She is also a graduate of the Institute of Core Energetics and Barbara Brennan School of Healing. Her journey has taken her into deep explorations and healing around sexuality. She has a healing practice in NYC.

Keep in touch:

<a href="http://integralevolutionarytantra.com/">http://integralevolutionarytantra.com/

http://www.meetup.com/integral-evolutionary-tantra/
results.name: Sacred Power Play: A Tantric Path of Domination And Submission

results.description:
Hello my fellow Queers!

I'm so thrilled that it seems like quite a few of us were waiting for something like this. For our inaugural meeting, I'd like for us to multi-task. Breakfast or coffee, either way I'd like to use the afternoon to discuss what we want from this Meetup/Organization and just get to know each other. A few of you Dears have already messaged me offering to help organize or lead. If you are interested in playing a particularly active role amongst us Dears, please continue to let me know and we will discuss roles in this group come Saturday, April 9.

Here's the fine print:

If you plan to attend, you absolutely must RSVP. If we are a group greater than 5 we can make reservations, if we are greater than 10 we can get a room, so I absolutely have to know what our numbers will be.

As the event nears, I'll update this page with whether or not we'll be in a private room, and ways to know who to look for. A bit of this information will, of course, depend on our numbers, so please pretty please RSVP.

Why Cool Beans?

Given the fact that our numbers grew on their own, I wanted to be able to accommodate as many of us as possible for this first meeting. Cool Beans offers the most flexibility for this purpose, though for future meetups we can certainly explore other venues.

results.description: Yes folks, it's that time of year again, flower season! And what better way to kick off than with the Cherry Blossom Festival in Branch Brook Park. Saturday's festival begins with a bike race, but we will be enjoying the foliage. I don't know if you know this, but the park has the largest collection of cherry blossoms in the nation, even larger than the one in D.C. They're already beginning to bloom, which means there isn't much time to catch them. Saturday should be a great day for pictures, and I hope to see you all there. I will be just outside the Cherry Blossom Welcome Center, located in the center of the park.
results.name: Cherry Blossom Festival

results.description:
The 23-mile Bronx River winds down through southern Westchester County and the Bronx creating a peaceful corridor of green.


The park itself is a 718 acre park with baseball fields, playgrounds, woodlands, waterfalls, the NY Botanical Garden and the Bronx Zoo. Bronx River Park, is a linear park that can be explored in sections and actually extends from 231st Street to the south Bronx where it empties in the Long Island Sound near Hunts Point.

Between Gun Hill Road and Allerton Ave/ Mosholu Parkway the park straddles both sides of the river. It provides photographic interest along its trails. Come on out and explore this under recognized area of the NYC Park system.


Disclaimer: Participation in these events requires that you assume all risks associated with these activities, and that the Organizers, Co-Organizers and Event Hosts are in no way liable for any loss or injury as a result of your participation. In other words, you are attending these events at your own risk!!

P.S. Remember to format your cards, charge your batteries and come with your enthusiasm to make new friends!

results.description:
STILL LIFE TABLE TOP PHOTOGRAPHY

  A HANDS-ON EXPERIENCE

  Presentation by Aaron Pepis

Still lifes have intrigued artists since the beginning of recorded time. From ancient Egypt, where they adorned the walls of tombs to the Renaissance, which introduced the genre into the cultural mainstream. The still life presents unique challenges such as technical lighting skills combined with composition and design to bring an image to life.

Please bring an assortment of what you may be interested in photographing. Fruits, vegetables and flowers are sure-fire options but you should also try to include some more exotic alternatives. We will have some stock items available for you to use as well as lights and backgrounds.

Our instructor will be assisting each group and answer questions while you work on your table tops setups.

 When all sets are complete and images have been taken, each group will be asked to explain how they created their set up and the class will have a chance to ask questions.

What you’ll learn:

·  How to photograph art objects, food items, jewelry, a bouquet of flowers, etc. or other small items that will fit on a table top.

·  How to light objects to create an artful set up.

·  Hands on, the workshop participants will split into small groups where we will design and create their own still life photographs. 

Our instructor, Aaron Pepis will:

·  Discus and demonstrate techniques for building a still-life photograph.

·  Discuss and demonstrate how to light the subject in preparation for the final step of taking a picture.

·  Explore sources and inspiration for, finding object, selecting surfaces and building sets while paying close attention to prop positioning and color theory.

·  Focus in on lighting the set up to ensure that we maximize the emotional impact of our set up


Who should attend?

Intermediate, advanced and expert photographers

NOTE: The images shown here have been post processed. That is, they've been edited in Photoshop after capture. AIP will be announcing a follow up workshop designed to instruct participants as to how to further enhance their images.

Our presenter, Aaron Pepis

After working for numerous studios in New York City, I opened my own photography studio in Rockland County, New York.  I was fortunate to have been able to utilize what I was taught in school and working alongside master craftsmen for ten years. In addition to having the distinction of being an internationally recognized portrait, wedding and commercial photographer, I am also known to be a caring and gifted teacher. I have lectured throughout the country to professional groups on many aspects of photography. I’ve lectured a record twelve times at Imaging USA, the International Professional Photographers Convention and at the Wedding and Portrait Photographers convention seven times. I also have served as an instructor at the Mid Atlantic Regional School of Professional Photography in Cape May, New Jersey and The Triangle School of Professional Photography in Pittsburgh Pennsylvania.  I have retired as a PP of A judge and have judged at international conventions as well as many regional and state conventions throughout the USA.  I am a PPA Approved Photographic Instructor and have earned the Photographic Craftsman and Master of Photography Degrees.  I have earned the distinction of being a PPA Certified Professional Photographer and have had numerous photographs in the PPA traveling loan collection. I won the Kodak Gallery Award for photographic excellence. I am an active member of the Professional Photographers of America, the Professional Photographers Society of New York State and have served on the Board of Governors of the American Society of Photographers. I serve as photography and Photoshop consultant to several large corporations and to several United States government agencies.
results.name: Still Life Table Top Photography - A hands on experience

results.description:
Classes are led by experts, many with thousands of hours of experience and deep knowledge and skill. In addition, there are often people training to become instructors who are happy to offer individual guidance.

Classes are tailored to the needs of the attendees. A starter session will be given if there are newcomers. New techniques and insights are always available for regulars. Advanced techniques may also be explored.

Classes begin with a brief announcement and introduction followed by 30-40 minutes of instruction and practice. Typically, classes are no more than an hour. Not long, considering the benefits can last a life time.

PLEASE BRING BOTH A BLUE T-SHIRT & A WHITE T-SHIRT.                                                                                                                                                                                 Started by a group of soccer fanatics who love to play the Beautiful Game and wanted to create a meetup for individuals of all levels. 

Our Mission: Play safe, get your workout on & HAVE FUN!!

The Lowdown: 

1. Play safe,  games are 7v7 including goalie, NO slide tackles, excessive aggression will NOT be tolerated (the precinct is across the street...LOL!!).  

2. Cleats are permitted, and Sneakers or Turf Shoes are acceptable as well. We play for an hour with a break in the middle. If no volunteered goal keeper, players will rotate the position. We play with corner kicks and throw-ins. Also, everyone should bring a Blue T-Shirt AND a White T-Shirt.

3. Pitch Location: Between Baxter & Mulberry St.with additional entrance on Worth & Bayard St. 

4. Nearest train stations: Brooklyn Bridge (4, 5 & 6), Canal Street (A, B, C, Q, R, N & 6), Chambers Street (J and Z). Citibike station is available right next to the field on Worth Street. 

5. HAVE FUN!

See you Downtown!

BY USING THIS WEBSITE, YOU AGREE TO THESE TERMS AND CONDITIONS.

I certify that I am 18 years of age or older and that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in DOWNTOWN PICKUP SOCCER activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore I, individually, hereby release and discharge, DOWNTOWN PICKUP SOCCER Organizers and Co-organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of DOWNTOWN PICKUP SOCCER programs or activities. 

DOWNTOWN PICKUP SOCCER Organizer and its Co-Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul
results.name: Soccer Saturday -@west 134th Street Field - 10:45am

results.description:
http://www.ponycountdown.com/

Trapped at home and unable to watch the new episode with couple of other Bronies?

I plan on allowing Bronies that are unable to attend the Weekly Screening provided by Alex Davidson or just out of State or just want someone to Talk to right after the New Episode is over, to be able to Discuss it through Text/Voice Communication.

How does this work?

We will use Discord, our Official Communication Program, to Connect with fellow Members! Then Altogether watch any available stream provided by other fans, that's screening the New Episode!
[Discord Info Link: http://www.meetup.com/Bronies-NYC/messages/boards/thread/49406195 ]

In Discord, I encourage you using the "#spoilerific-episode-discussion" Text Channel to avoid spoilers for others, not everyone is able to see it right away.

During the Meetup, folks we'll be watching on their TV but we can use Streams if unavailable!

BronyState:
[ http://www.bronystate.net/ ]
MLP-Episodes.tk:
[ http://mlp-episodes.tk/livestream.html ]
The Brony Network: (Member Voted Best!)
[ http://www.ustream.tv/channel/the-brony-network ]
(I don't know any other good streaming sites, comment below if you know any!)


Please note any Screening Meetups have a strict no spoilers rule. So if you've seen anything related to the New Episode, keep it to your self! There are plenty of Bronies who try to steer clear of spoilers or anything hinting out the New Episode so they can enjoy the full experience!

Also note Meetups like these usually end when the crowd dims out sadly, so Discuss what you can/want, make new friends and see you at the next Online Stream on Discord!

[Time is set when the MLP Episodes are airing, but Discord is continuous!]

...
Sounds so similar to "We'll Make Our Marks" :O

results.description:
Beginner Bhangra sessions are for you

- if you want to learn how to groove at a club/party

- if you are all for letting loose at a wedding

- if you are Indian and still can't do the "Chaffa" (don't worry, we'll show you how;)

- if you are not Indian and want to join the latest dance trend

- if you want to have a blast while learning an awesome dance skill

- if you just want to learn the basics for the love of Bhangra

The class begins with a warm up, followed by basic step-by-step instruction of different Bhangra steps each week, and finally choreography training to put those moves to the beat!

No previous dance experience is necessary - just bring in your smile! Our Instructors are professional, friendly, and open minded. So come on in and let swag emerge!

Wear comfortable clothes and shoes.

The drop-in price is $20 and can be paid here on meetup, or head over to our website www.nycbhangra.com/nycbhangra/signup for other options to pay.

Checkout our other Learn & Sweat BHANGRA classes too!
results.name: BEGINNER BHANGRA

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6Eq5zNQPuFw

This Season we are playing The Beatles!

We have done Classic Rock, The Rolling Stones, Reggae, Motown, Summer Songs, Fleetwood Mac, Funk and Christmas ensembles, The Beatles is certainly due in our selection!

Acoustic guitars, bass and ukeleles welcome. If electric bring a portable amp:)


This ensemble welcomes ALL LEVELS, so pick your part and let's play! 

To join:

• RSVP before you attend the session.

• Choose your guitar part from TAB>MORE>FILES download/print and bring it to practice to follow. (check by 12/30) 

• Bring acoustic guitar or electric with a portable amp. 

• Have an amazing time!

Practice days are:

Every Saturday 12-2pm starting January 9th til April 23rd, the day before the performance, 16 practice sessions.

Season Pass

You can purchase the Season Pass (16 sessions at discount + $30 show fee) for $380  (you save $50 on practice sessions)

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=MWF56937BM6Q8


Show Day is Sunday, May 1st at 2pm

The show will be at Arlene's Grocery in the East Village April 24th at 1pm(soundcheck) and doors at 2pm. Arlene's is an awesome show venue with professional stage, sound and lights, everyone will be miked or amplified. If you are coming to rehearsal with a portable amp you should also bring it to the venue.

We will have a drummer and a singer TBA.

There will be tickets for this show, they can be purchase before hand at $5 or at the door for $10.

There is a show fee of $30 for each ensemble member that will go toward venue, sound engineer and hired musicians costs.

Arlene's Grocery is strictly 21+ and no children will be allowed at the show even if they are accompanied by the parent, I'm sorry:( :(

There are two bars on site and lots of food spots and great restaurants in the area for before or after the show.

All you need is love and some Beatles!

Check out our website at http://edelage.wix.com/edge

results.description:
This week Dr Jeff Jones will discuss the role that spinors play in Quantum Field Theory. We'll go over the difference between the 2-component spinors used in non-relativistic quantum mechanics and the 4-component Dirac spinors used in QFT. The way in which these can be represented by the so-called "gamma matrices" which form a Clifford Algebra. The plane-wave solutions to the Dirac equation. And finally, why the cancellation of particle and antiparticle fermion propagators necessary to preserve causality requires that the creation and annihilation operators for fermions anti-commute rather than commute. (The last point is a follow up to the previous lecture a month ago on the "spin statistics theorem" and will serve as part 2 of this topic.)
DIRECTIONS:

From NYC by car: take the Holland Tunnel; after tunnel at 2nd traffic light turn left into Marin Blvrd; 1st traffic light turn left into 6th street/Thomas Gangemi Dr; 3rd traffic light turn right into Washington Blvrd; 2nd traffic light turn left into 2nd street; the Portofino is the 1st building on the right. Total distance from the tunnel ~1 mile.

From NYC by PATH train: take the PATH train to Hoboken/Journal Square from 6th Ave and 9, 14, 23 or 32 street; get of at Newport/Pavonia (2nd stop in NJ). Train ride just under 20 minutes. Cross the small park in front of the station, go left on Washington Blvrd about 0.2 miles; left into 2nd street; the Portofino is the 1st building on the right.

Tell the concierge you are going to the quantum theory meeting in the 5th floor community room.

Light refreshments will be served. If you are considering brunch, there are plenty of excellent restaurants nearby.

Any questions: call me on[masked]-2004.

Cheers,

Moshe Rozenblit
results.name: Spinors And Fermions in Quantum Field Theory

results.description:
Calling all poets! Jersey City Writers is now offering a weekly poetry workshop. 

This workshop will start by critiquing 2-3 poems, one by each person signed up ahead of time. The workshop will end, if time permits, with one 10 minute writing prompt (an idea to incorporate into a poem written on the spot).  Poets who sign up to be workshopped must email Sarah poem by 10am Friday so she can print copies for the group. To sign up for a workshop in advance, please contact Sarah Jewell at [masked]. 

While workshopping poems, we will “mind our P’s and Q’s” by Praising first what works in a poem, and then Questioning what might be improved. This helps to keep the feedback positive and constructive. If you are new to critiquing poetry, please see these guidelines:
http://triadwriters.org/inspiration/guidelines-critique-of-poem/
results.name: Jersey Plums: A Weekly Poetry Workshop

results.description:
Last week we began a series on what Buddhist teachings call the Three Poisons - Delusion and Ignorance, Hatred and Greed. These three mind states create most of the suffering and dissatisfaction in our lives. Along with discussing each of those states we will be spending alternate weeks on the paired, but contrasting mind states that are free from suffering and dissatisfaction. This week, following up on our discussion of Delusion and Ignorance, we will turn our attention to the contrasting mind state of Wisdom.

We most often think of Wisdom as our accumulated learned, factual knowledge and our experience brought to bear on living. In our consideration of Wisdom's relationship to Ignorance and Delusion, however, Buddhist teachings focus on some distinct elements of "the truth of the way things are" that are fundamental to freeing ourselves from suffering and dissatisfaction.

Among those primary elements of Wisdom from the teachings is (1) having a deep, personal understanding that suffering is part of life, that its causes are known and that there can be an end to it, (2) seeing that nothing exists separately or in isolation but is rather a cumulative result of many causes and conditions, and (3) knowing that nothing, beyond awareness itself, is fixed and stable and unchangeable.

It is important to highlight that there is also a transformative process in Wisdom. When working with these negative and positive states, the final realization of freedom requires a transformation from the "thinking about"  the teachings, inherited beliefs, and simple intellectual facts into a real, deep level of personal insight that arises from direct, lived experience with the states.

I hope you'll share your Saturday morning with us.

Class Structure:  

Each class begins with a very brief guided meditation of gathering and quieting followed by a topical teaching and an expanded guided mindfulness meditation. There is time for discussion and Q&A.  Please note that while there is benefit in participating in regular sittings and practice, you do not have to attend every class to find value. 

Fee by donation: Suggested starting donation is $10 and your generosity is greatly appreciated.  No one is ever turned away for lack of funds.  The donation box is on the sign-in table.
results.name: Wheel of Life - Wisdom

results.description:
"Edgar Degas:  A Strange New Beauty" includes 120 monotypes and 60 related artworks that show Degas at his most modern, capturing the spirit of urban life; depicting the body in new and daring ways; liberating mark-making from tradition; and boldly engaging the possibilities of abstraction.   Monotypes are made by composing in ink — with brush, rag, finger, fingernail, stick, just about anything — on a blank plate that is then layered with a damp sheet of paper and run through a printing press to make a unique image.


Let's start by meeting at Starbucks, to introduce ourselves over coffee. 

Then we'll go over to MOMA, to see the show.  I'm hoping we can more or less synchronize our viewing pace, so that we can see--and share--and comment on--this exhibit. 

Note that this exhibit features some very different types of work vs. the usual ballerina pastels.  Here are some sample images:

Degas is best known as a painter and chronicler of the ballet, yet his work as a printmaker reveals the true extent of his restless experimentation.  Captivated by the monotype’s potential, he immersed himself in the technique with enormous enthusiasm, taking the medium to radical ends. He expanded the possibilities of drawing, created surfaces with a heightened sense of tactility, and invented new means for new subjects, from dancers in motion to the radiance of electric light, from women in intimate settings to meteorological effects in nature.


The monotype also sparked a host of experiments for Degas, who often used the medium as a starting point from which an image could be reworked and revised. This process of repetition and transformation, mirroring and reversal, allowed Degas to extend his approach to the study of form. The profound impact of his work with monotype can be seen in his variations in different mediums of key motifs, revealing a new kind of artwork that was less about progress or completion than endless innovation.


----------


Attendees are responsible for paying for any purchases from Starbucks, and for the special $5 guest rate to enter MOMA on my membership pass.  That's right, you will save $20 vs. the normal $25 admission price! 

If something comes up and you can't attend, please change your RSVP status as soon as possible.  Given the small size of this meetup group, no-show's would be a big loss.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet inside Starbucks at 1290 Sixth Ave, entrance on 52nd St, between 5th & 6th Ave.  I will display a red Meetup sign.
results.name: Connect by Seeing the Degas Monotype Exhibit at MOMA

results.description:
Join Reiki North East-trained Reiki Master Teacher Jeff Carpenter for a lecture and book signing for his recent book, Discovering Intention: A Sensitive’s Guide to the Engineering Mind at the Montclair Metaphysical Center!

Jeff will present experiences and events during the beginning of his spiritual journey from the technical point of view of an aerospace engineer (yes, he actually IS a rocket scientist!) and a global IT communications director. With his perspectives on energy sensitivity, he will also share several of his experiences as a paranormal investigator, providing examples of evidence collected in a variety of reportedly haunted locations.

Author: Jeffrey P. Carpenter

Owner and Reiki Master Teacher Investigation Team Lead

Dimensions Reiki LLC© Sister Paranormal Investigators (SPI) East

http://dimensionsreiki.com

http://www.facebook.com/sisterparanormalinvestigators

http://www.facebook.com/dimensionsreiki

Book Description:

Have you ever seen something in a person's past, something you could not have ever known on your own? Have you had some type of contact with some unseen paranormal phenomenon? Is déjà vu a common occurrence for you? These are just a few events that you yourself may have experienced unwittingly, yet you can train yourself to connect to these energies on demand. This book is intended to take you through the first 18 months of the author's journey into the incredible realm of energy sensitivity. It serves as an account of the amazing insights, visions, and events that he has experienced, first with his exploration of Reiki and then with his steps into developing mediumship.

Many scientific theories around light, matter, and energy support the notions of reading and manipulating the energy fields around people as well as connecting to the energy of Spirit. The author also describes the repeatable procedures he has created for testing his sensitivity, strengthening the credibility of the phenomena. The book proposes that there are several relationships between science and these esoteric practices through the law of energy conservation. Evaluating the incredible experiences and events through the logical eyes of a technical engineer, the author openly wrestles with some of the challenges he faced with accepting the reality of these phenomena in the face of the evidence received.

While the book is not meant to be an instructional manual to provide training in these fields, it does include some of the basic techniques the author has learned in his own training and subsequent practices. Anyone can embark on this journey of detecting and interacting with various types of metaphysical energy. The journey of spiritual evolution awaits; maybe it's time for you to test your potential.

Jeff will be on hand afterward to sign a copy of his book if you are interested in picking one up after the talk. This event is especially for those of you out there who are "scientific" in nature and would like some insight into how your intuition can be proven by science.

Jeff trained at the Center and was certified as a Reiki Master. (www.reikinortheast.com)

He has since sat for Unfoldment into Mediumship and is actively sitting for his mediumship development at the school. (www.montclairpsychicschool.com)

results.description:
Self mastery is key to having the most fulfilling and harmonious life possible. One of the most important relationships each of us will ever have is the one we have with ourself as this affects all that we are, do and have the potential to become. 

Self knowledge is a key component of this ongoing process; and growing and nurturing this relationship with self requires ongoing work – work that is at once exciting, invigorating, fulfilling and more. 

One very significant area of success in life is figuring out our true life purpose and, as a result, assuming the role of co-creator in the universe. Matthew Fox describes this as doing the Great Work. In this workshop we will explore the self - our beliefs, values - who we are, what we want from life and what we want to contribute to the world. 

This workshop is designed and facilitated by Human and Organization Development Specialist and Certified Life Coach, Soror Patricia Downes who will take participants on a transformative journey. 

The workshop will include questionnaires, mini lectures, individual and group exercises, meditations and large group discussions.
results.name: Self - Mastery and Life Achievement

Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Hi all, 

I'll be leading an Introduction to Meditation workshop at Align Brooklyn (5th Avenue & 16th Street in Brooklyn--www.alignbrooklyn.com) on April 9th from 12-1pm.  

Jess

******

New to meditation? Not sure what all the hype is about? Not sure how to start? Join us for an Introduction to Meditation Workshop.

Do you live in a crazy world where deadlines, to-dos and obligations fill your days? Take an hour to learn how to slow down and find some calm in your internal world. Studies have shown that practicing meditation changes the brain-- increasing productivity, bringing about greater physical and mental health, reducing stress/anxiety and modulating pain.

While there are varying meditation techniques, this hour-long workshop will focus on the breath, sound and mantra meditation. The first 15 minutes will be a little about meditation and the brain/getting comfortable to sit, followed by 30 minutes of guided meditation using the breath, sound and mantra meditation techniques with periods of silence to practice the techniques. The remainder of the time will be available for comments and questions. You will walk away with techniques that can be integrated into the busiest of schedules.   Suggested $10 donation.
results.name: Introduction to Meditation Workshop

If you love Bhangra music and you’re looking for a fun, unique way to keep fit, join us to sweat it out while partying to the beats.

results.description:
Open to all sailors!  Visit here to sign up - http://www.meetup.com/Greater-New-York-Sailing-Group/events/229643661/?rv=co1

This is a group out of NY that is hosting this event.  Meet some fellow sailors!  It was a very well attended event last year. 


"Come to our biggest Meetup event where you get to connect with over 100 other sailors . Free signup for a "Discover Sailing" intro sail by ASA certified instructors.

Always wanted to sail, but don't know how to get started?  Think joining a yacht club is beyond your means? We are the largest NY sailing group and have been helping get people on the water since 2006.

Are you interested in either cruising or racing? Looking for crew or a skipper?

Everyone that wanted to sail last summer had many offers no matter what their skill level.

Need someone to help get your boat ready? Helping with spring prep is a great way to learn and make new connections.

City Island Yacht Club... a picturesque, waterfront, private club has allowed me to open it's doors for a limited number of Meetups to non members. This is our first big event of the season - where you get to connect with many skippers and crew on a face to face basis. Everyone gets to work the room, table by table, to talk to skippers and exchange numbers for racing, cruising.

We will also have tables with speakers talking about boat repair, chartering in the Caribbean, ASA certification, soda blasting paint prep, classes for sail and powerboaters, J/24 racing, EBYRA racing, other local sailing organizations, Singles Under Sail, and other adventure groups.

How about having a boat to sail this summer for much less that you would think, and little more than taking a sailing class. The Club Boat program is the most cost efficient and flexible program in the area. We have four boats in our fleet and yacht club membership is included. Members will be on hand to answer questions.

We attract people with all levels of experience from the curious to circumnavigators. Many have caught their first sail through this event, many are now cruising or on race teams... and a number have found their "sailmate". Two marriages that I know of. The restaurant and galley will be available.

 SK Caterers, owners of BistroSK, the only Zagat and Michelin rated French restaurant in the Bronx will be serving a moderately priced, limited lunch menu.

. We can only accommodate 120 people (last year was filled) so I am opening it to my members first. I will then have it posted on other sailing sites and in print. Single groups with an adventure theme from the greater New York area have also been invited. A waiting list will be updated weekly."
results.name: Come to the largest sailing Meet & Greet in the New York area!

results.description:
Bollywood Funk NYC wants to show everyone that we are Dilwale at heart. So this Naach Xpress Class we are doing the song "Manma emotion jaage" from the movie Diwale. This is going to a fun routine which you don't want to miss out on. 

What is Naach Xpress? NAACH XPRESS is high-energy, fitness fueled dance class to Bollywood beats. It's one big dance PARTY! Students sweat it out to the best of Bollywood Funk NYC's signature dance moves. With a mix of jazz, hip hop, contemporary, and other well known dance techniques, we bring to you our fast track class to sweating it out with some style. Make some friends and dance the night away in this amazing class! There are no worries, come to class tension free and get your weekly dose of fitness and cardio! Each class will focus on ONE hot and popular Bollywood dance song. With a new song featured every week. ALL levels are welcome! Not a dancer? DON'T YOU WORRY! This class is for all, anyone can do it! 


Here is a class snip-it:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=70UcFvuNy1g

For further details and pricing for the class, please visit our website

www.bollywoodfunknyc.com

Looking forward to seeing you all there!!

results.description:
This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe. 


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP AT LEAST MIDNIGHT THE DAY BEFORE THE GAME!

• RSVPs close by 10:30AM


No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP at least 2 hours before the game will be red carded after the second offense which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:


2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Brooklyn Soccer Club activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Brooklyn Soccer Club Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Brooklyn Soccer Club Programs or activities.

results.description:
TO RSVP YOU MUST REGISTER ON EVENTBRITE AS WELL!

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/learn-to-code-nyc-workshop-javascript-201-tickets-24368482788?aff=meetup

Goal: Get more familiar with JavaScript.

Whether you want to write your own programs in JavaScript or just want to communicate better with engineers, this class will get you started! This is part 2 of our 2 part free JavaScript workshop series, JS101 and JS201. Taking our JS101 workshop before attending JS201 is recommended, but you're more than welcome to come if you have very basic experience with JavaScript.

Prerequisites:

• JavaScript: Fundamentals: Syntax, Types, Variables, Keywords and Functions I

You'll leave knowing:

• JavaScript Fundamentals: Conditional Statements, Arrays, Loops and Functions II

Meet your instructor: 

Tyler Lambe was a professional developer across all platforms for over 6 years, before he made the transition into teaching full-stack web development. Having crafted full-fledged software engineers who previously had no experience, his passion lies in helping people accelerate their lives through education.

Note: Students will need to bring their own laptops! Windows, Mac or Linux will do it! Our preferred web browser is Google Chrome.
results.name: Learn to Code Workshop: JavaScript 201

results.description:
Join us for "Build Your Own Pizzas" at Noon! 

We provide the dough and a variety of fresh toppings... you provide the fun! Come and assemble your own personal pizza, and we'll help you bake it in an outdoor 900-degree wood-fired brick oven. 

This event is free and open to the public, courtesy of The Old Stone House and Brick Oven Brooklyn. 

All ages are welcome! Join us at the blue tables inside the fence at the Old Stone House, in the middle of Washington Park, next to J.J. Byrne Playground. 

If you enjoy this event, please do consider donating $5 (or more if you can) to the Old Stone House to help pay for firewood. Or, contribute to the oven rebuilding project fundraiser on Indiegogo (https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/rebuild-the-oven-at-the-old-stone-house) and get some great perks!
results.how_to_find_us: Join us at the blue tables inside the fence at the Old Stone House, in the middle of Washington Park, next to J.J. Byrne Playground.
results.name: Build Your Own Pizzas at Noon at the Old Stone House

results.description:
I am a therapist, divorce mediator, and adjunct professor at NYU with a specialization in eating disorders. I am interested in helping to facilitate a monthly meet-up group to discuss experiences, treatment options, and helpful ideas in dealing with eating disorders of all types. I have years of experience treating bulimia, binge eating, anorexia, and issues of body image, with excellent results.


In addition to seeing patients individually for eating disorders (among other issues), I'm currently forming an ongoing, weekly therapy group for persons with eating disorders who are looking for something more ongoing and intensive. I work on a sliding fee scale, so I will do what I can to make it work for you. My approach is a combination of psychodynamic, cognitive-behavioral, and Buddhist principles, with a healthy dose of compassion and understanding!

Our meetups are held in Union Square, near 12th Street and University Place.

Please give me a call or email me if you think you might be interested in attending the meet-ups or in learning more about individual or group therapy. Space is somewhat limited, so if you are interested, it's best to call or email me right away.


Thank you!


Judie Stein, Ph.D., L.M.S.W.
Director
Stein Mediation & Family Center


(212)[masked]
[masked]

www.steinmediation.com
results.name: Eating Disorders NYC Meetup Monthly Meetup

results.description:
Our next Meetup is Saturday, April 9th! We look forward to seeing you there! We'll be starting at noon at the Codesters office, 900 Broadway, Suite 903. Our topic for this month is: CS Content Instruction for Teachers. If you're looking to learn something new and develop/practice your Python skills, join us for this meetup! It's a great time to talk coding and coding instruction with other teachers.

Codesters Meetup events support our teacher community in implementing coding instruction. Our Meetups are a great place for teachers to learn together, share best practices, ask each other questions, and explore new ideas. We look forward to seeing you in April!

If you've never been to a Codesters Meetup or used Codesters, this is a great place to start! Will will have a breakout for an introduction to our platform.  

And.....lunch is included!

results.description:
Wanna be in the cast of GODSPELL? 

AfterWork Theater, NYC's first and only recreational theater program, is open for enrollment into the cast of our Spring production of GODSPELL, written by Stephen Schwartz (Wicked, Pippin). No audition required! This is our SIXTEENTH fully-staged production open to absolutely anyone with the desire to rehearse and perform in a show. 

Rehearse one to two times per week depending on your availability. We have put together a brilliant creative team. We have got a great theater in downtown Manhattan. Now all we need is you.

Tuition operates on a scale system.

Rehearsals start April 9th. Go to http://afterworktheater.com/godspell to sign up now!

results.description:
Westies and Scotties (and their humans) march up 6th Avenue from 45th Street to Central Park.

• Pawty at Ballfields Cafe in Central Park immediately after. 

This is so, so, so much fun!!

For those who haven’t marched before, or want to be reminded of what to do: The Parade starts at 2.00pm at West 45th Street and marches up 6th Avenue to 55th Street. Line-up is at 1:00pm  and will be on the side streets near 6th Avenue and West 45th street. About a week before the Parade, the Line of March will be released which will give the position of each unit in the parade and exactly where they are to line up. 

Registration for the 2016 Annual New York Tartan Day Parade is now closed.
The Line of March will be posted after April 6th. We look forward to seeing you on the Avenue on Saturday, April 9th. -- If you didn't register, JUST SHOW UP.  


The 18th Annual New York Tartan Day Parade


Saturday April 9th, 2016

Gather from 12.30 pm joining in the celebration of Scottish heritage and pride.

• 44th and Sixth Avenue (Not sure if this is the exact location, but it will be very close.  Stay tuned for an update.)

• Judging of dogs 1.30pm

• Parade steps off at 2pm 

Register at nyctartanweek.org  Questions call[masked] - Camilla

or email [masked]


-- You must be at the stepping off point by 2 pm to march in the parade.

From their website:


New York Tartan Day Parade.  We invite you to march in the 18th Annual New York Tartan Day Parade on Saturday, April 9th, by completing the form below. Or, if you prefer, watch and cheer us on as the New York Tartan Day Parade moves up 6th Avenue. 

There is NO charge to march or to attend the Parade. 

For those who haven’t marched before, or want to be reminded of what to do: The Parade starts at 2.00pm at West 45th Street and marches up 6th Avenue to 55th Street. Line-up is at 1:00pm and will be on the side streets near 6th Avenue and West 45th street. About a week before the Parade, the Line of March will be released which will give the position of each unit in the parade and exactly where they are to line up. 

Registration for Tartan Day Parade 2016 is now OPEN.  (Note -- an RSVP on Meetup is not the same as registering.)

CLICK HERE TO REGISTER
results.name: Tartan Day Parade

results.description:
Winter is over, spring is here, so come out and join us for a day-long event that celebrates the unique Celtic and old-bar culture of New York!

We'll start the day with drinks and lunch (or if you prefer, brunch) at McGee's on W. 55th. Yes, the now world-famous "How I Met Your Mother" bar. Tourist-trap notwithstanding, it's a friendly, homey pub with good food and drink. McGee's has been at this location since at least the late '80s, though the bar (below) has a much older look and feel.

From there, we'll walk a couple blocks down to 6th Avenue to take in the Tartan Day Parade, an annual celebration of Scottish culture and heritage, complete with pipe bands, Shetlanders, the Scottie and Westie Tartan Dog Pack, dancers, kilts and plaid, lots of plaid. That steps off at 2 p.m., up 6th Avenue and doesn't typically last much more than 45 minutes. 

Once the parade's over, we'll hit some classic Old--and old-themed--New York bars in this neighborhood. The list includes:

Tanner Smith's, 204 W. 55th. A modern cocktail bar with an early 20th-century theme.

The Irish Pub, 837 7th Ave. A no-frills upper Theater District fixture since 1939. 

Rosie O'Grady's, 800 7th Ave. A classic Irish pub/steak&seafood joint since 1973. 

Gallagher's Steakhouse, 228 W. 52nd. Opened in 1927 in the middle of Prohibition, but that never stopped them from serving booze. The bar has recently been restored to its original detail.

So wear your drinking shoes and come prepared to work on your Irish tans. Kilts are completely optional.

results.description:
Acoustic Guitar for Beginners 101
Four 90-Minute Sessions Held on 4 consecutive Saturdays.
FEBRUARY-MARCH - [APRIL 9, 16, 23, 30 -- 12:30pm]


WHO CAN ATTEND:
Beginning guitar students who have no prior knowledge of how to play guitar, or people who can play, but are unfamiliar with how to read and play from written notes.  NOTE:  Session #1 is MANDATORY for participation in the Series.


WHAT YOU WILL LEARN:
Learn to READ and PLAY NOTES, CHORDS and PLAY SONGS you know and love.  And what you learn is applicable to playing Rock, Blues, Folk, Country, Jazz, Classical or any other type of music the student is interested in playing.

MONTHLY, FOUR-WEEK CYCLES:
In this workshop, a specific set of concepts will be covered over a period of 4-week.  Each monthly, 4-week period will be closed to people who did not attend the 1st session of the month.  This allow the group to continue to progress through the lesson material and avoid the need to review all that came before each time a new person joins the group. There will be three to four monthly, 4-week cycles before the first cycle is repeated


WHAT TO BRING:
• Bring your own guitar for these lessons
• Also bring a three-ring binder and a pencil

COST:  The cost of this session is $15.00, which must be paid when you RSVP. 


IMPORTANT NOTE: If there are 5 or less people registered for this meetup, we will not meet at Ripley Grier Studios.  We will instead meet at the Sony Public Atrium, 550 Madison Avenue (Between 55th and 56th Street on Madison).  Watch for an email confirming where we will meet.
results.name: Acoustic Guitar for Beginners 101/B -- March (#4 of 4)

results.description:
Winter is over, spring is here, so come out and join us for a day-long event that celebrates the unique Celtic and old-bar culture of New York!

We'll start the day with drinks and lunch (or if you prefer, brunch) at McGee's on W. 55th. Yes, the now world-famous "How I Met Your Mother" bar. Tourist-trap notwithstanding, it's a friendly, homey pub with good food and drink. McGee's has been at this location since at least the late '80s, though the bar (below) has a much older look and feel.

From there, we'll walk a couple blocks down to 6th Avenue to take in the Tartan Day Parade, an annual celebration of Scottish culture and heritage, complete with pipe bands, Shetlanders, the Scottie and Westie Tartan Dog Pack, dancers, kilts and plaid, lots of plaid. That steps off at 2 p.m., up 6th Avenue and doesn't typically last much more than 45 minutes. 

Once the parade's over, we'll hit some classic Old--and old-themed--Irish New York bars in this neighborhood. The list includes:

Tanner Smith's, 204 W. 55th. A modern cocktail bar with an early 20th-century theme.

The Irish Pub, 837 7th Ave. A no-frills upper Theater District fixture since 1939. 

Rosie O'Grady's, 800 7th Ave. A classic Irish pub/steak&seafood joint since 1973. 

Gallagher's Steakhouse, 228 W. 52nd. Opened in 1927 in the middle of Prohibition, but that never stopped them from serving booze. The bar has recently been restored to its original detail.

So wear your drinking shoes and come prepared to work on your Irish tans. Kilts are completely optional. This will be a joint meetup with my Old New York Bars group.
results.name: Tartan Day Parade and Irish/Old New York Pubs and Bars

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Bwk7wFdC76Y

Also, this other link is a great resource for much of Duchamp's work and legacy that is referenced in the interview.

http://www.dadart.com/dadaism/dada/035a-duchamp-cage.html

To those new to the group a donation of $2 or 3 is collected at the meetup to defray the cost of maintaining this website. Thank you for your consideration.
