results.description:
Meet to share and discuss SF and fantasy writing, books, films, TV shows, the writing process, the publishing industry, etc. with other SF and fantasy writers (both published and unpublished).  We usually have a long and lively discussion, followed by critiques of stories or chapters (if any) that members brought along.  We don't always have stories to critique, but we usually enjoy having hours worth of discussion, so let us know near the beginning of the Meetup if you brought something to have critiqued so we don't use up all our time talking -- time flies when you're having fun!

Further details or topics for this Meetup may be announced later.

As usual, you can bring a chapter or short story for the group to critique, but it's by no means necessary.  If you do bring your MS, try to bring enough paper copies for everyone attending to have one, and if you want us to write comments or corrections on it, then please double-space it.  We usually ask the author to read it aloud (unless you're shy), which is very helpful, because you'd be surprised how often you don't catch your own mistakes until you read your manuscript aloud for the first time! 

For the manuscript (MS) critiques, length is not set in stone, but suggested length is 1500 words, maximum length 3000 words. In pages (Times 12 point font), 1500 words is just under five pages double spaced, or about three pages single-spaced (but you should always double-space to allow room for people to write comments or corrections!)  Don't worry if your MS is longer than 1500 words, you can still bring it, but please keep it under 3,000 words.

For more guidelines on critiques, see http://www.meetup.com/The-Woodbridge-Science-Fiction-Fantasy-Writers-Meetup/about/
results.name: Share and discuss writing with other SF and fantasy writers

results.description:
"Thrive As An Artist”, a Financial Literacy Workshop for Artists, will serve as a three-part event for Local Emerging Artists. Attendees will be able to participate in an Open Mic where they will have the opportunity to perform their original material, and then stay to participate in a Financial Literacy Workshop hosted by David Sharpe author of “The Thriving Artist: Saving and Investing for Performers, Artists, and the Stage & Film Industries”. This workshop will discuss the financial needs and concerns of freelance artists and attendees will learn how to plan, save and budget for their dreams. 

RSVP is required to attend: https://financiallitopenmic.eventbrite.com

*****
FREE & ALL AGES
RSVP required to Attend.
Dates: 4/9 & 4/23.
Open Mic Signup @ 12:30pm
Performances begin: 1:00pm
Workshop begins: 2:00pm

Where: Capital One 360 Café - 968 3rd Avenue
Manhattan, New York 10022
*****
Coffee and snacks will be provided.
*****
Performance slots are limited so if you are looking to participate in the Open Mic we STRONGLY suggest you arrive early to guarantee your performance slot as this Open Mic will be first come first serve. To create a PG environment all material must be clean and radio friendly. There is limited space for this workshop, so RSVP's are required.
*****
Backline Provided: Yamaha PA, Three Shure Mics, Alesis QS7 Keyboard & a Roland Jazz Guitar Amp.
*****
Directions By Subway: Take the 4,5,6,N,Q,R to 59th St & Lexington. The Cafe is located on the corner of E 58th & 3rd Avenue.

results.description:
This event has a bit of a different theme and a bit of alliteration! Can you sing songs released by popular Japanese record label avex? Check their YouTube page and see if there's anything you know!

意外に勉強になるこのイベントは一味違います！avex所属のアーティストの曲、一緒に歌たいませんか？公式YouTubeページに参考して知っている曲を探してみましょう！

http://www.karaokeduet.com/index.php?itemid=32


Group Rules

1) This is a Japanese-English karaoke group, which means you must sing at least one or two songs in Japanese.

2) Please RSVP or make sure it is okay with the organizer first before coming. This is due to room-size limitations. The organizers reserve the right to deny entry to anyone who shows up without notice.

3) Please bring ID with you to prove that you are over 21 years of age.

4) Please go clockwise and one by one when selecting songs to sing so that everyone has an equal opportunity. This also makes it easy to tell if your song is skipped (in which case you may choose two songs on your next turn). Please try to locate your song choice before getting the remote to keep it moving along (https://www.clubdam.com/app/search/searchKeywordKaraoke.html). As soon as you enter your song, please pass the remote directly to the next person, and let them know it is their turn.

5) If you leave an early, please give your payment to the organizer, who will take care of the bill at the end. Please bring cash with you to make splitting the bill and tipping easier.

6) If you are a no-show, you are subject to removal from the group. It is understandable if something comes up and you cannot make it, but when this happens, please either email the organizer or change your status on the event page to "not attending".
results.how_to_find_us: The room is reserved under "Gabriel"!/予約は「ガブリエル」で入っています！
results.name: avex April

group.name: New York J-Karaoke Group: Sing in Japanese and English!

results.description:
Many members have been asking for our Saturday Figure Drawing Session.

Join us for three hours of figure drawing in the heart of The Flatiron District.

This session is open to sketchers of all levels.


What makes our sessions different? 

• We work in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.) 

• Every hour we take a break to look each others drawings (if you choose to put yours out.) This is a nonjudgmental and very valuable part of the session. 

• This is a three hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.   

• We start with 5 minute poses and work up to 20 minute poses by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 

• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels.  

• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

Our amazing space!

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon
results.how_to_find_us: We meet in Studio #505
results.name: Saturday - Live Figure Drawing - Flatiron District

results.description: Eberron is a world where magic is technology, in which air ships, lightning rails, elemental galleons, and living constructs exist side by side with swords, armor, and sorcery. It is a world recovering from a continent wide civil war, where the five nations struggled with each other for the crown of Galifar. The Last War ended with the annihilation of an entire country by a mysterious magical cataclysm. While open war has ended, a shadow war among spies, nobles, dragonmarked houses, cults, and monsters has risen in its place. Join the adventure. Current players are level 4 and include a Warforged Fighter, Shifter Ranger, Tiefling Warlock, and Halfling Bard. Pre-made characters are available for drop-ins. $10 at the door of the Brooklyn Strat to sit in.
results.name: D&D 5E Eberron Campaign

results.description:
We fence foil predominantly, but if you fence epee or saber, let me know and I'll bring mine.  It also helps if you leave a comment if you're going to the meetup and you'd like to fence epee or saber.


We will be charging $15 per meeting to cover the cost of renting the studio.  There is a significant discount for purchasing the entire semester which includes 14 2 hour classes.


We will do our best to provide instruction appropriate for each individuals skill level. 

We have some equipment to lend, but if you would like to borrow, please contact me at least 24 hours before the meetup, and let me know if you are left handed.


The entrance to Battery Dance is at 380 Broadway near White St. near a sign that says "Empire Apparel"  ( https://maps.google.com/maps?q=380+broadway&hl=en&ll=40.718209,-74.002908&spn=0.006034,0.012703&sll=40.718109,-74.002904&layer=c&cbp=13,90.98,,1,-3.47&cbll=40.718122,-74.00297... ) Ring the bell for the 5th floor and we'll buzz you up.

Beginners are welcome. Experienced fencers welcome. Everybody's welcome!

- Mike
results.how_to_find_us: Ring the bell for Battery Dance and we'll buzz you up.
results.name: Saturday Fencing 1pm Battery Dance

results.description:
Join me for the 14th annual Orchid Show at the NY Botanical Garden. A visit to the botanic garden is a great way to celebrate the arrival of spring! Attendees are encouraged to bring lunch and/or a snack as there is so much to see and areas for picnicking. If anyone wants to meet prior to the event, I'll be hitting Arthur Ave for my own lunch and welcome the company. There is also a cafe on the grounds of the garden. In order to see the orchid exhibit, attendees need to buy an all garden pass at nybg.org. Right now AAA of New York is offering a discount code for passes - SAVE 20% ON ALL-GARDEN PASS TICKETS. USE CODE 9210 ONLINE AT NYBG.ORG

For more info, visit NYBG's page or post a comment with your question.
http://www.nybg.org/tos16m/index.php

The Botanical Garden has a Metro North stop on the Harlem line and a parking garage nearby.
results.name: Orchidelerium: The Orchid Show at NY Botanical Garden

results.description:
A brewery in the Bronx??! Yes, it does exist. Gun Hill Brewery has been building a quiet following for a few years now. Being a Bronx native I am happy to have something as ubiquitous as beer to call our own. Coming up to the most neglected borough in NYC will get you a tour of this magnificent brewery and a chance to marinate in their tap tasting room where we will get glugging samples of some of the best beers that Gun Hill Brewery has to offer. All of their brews are handcrafted and they do some amazing experiments to create the flavors that we will be imbibing on.

Their flavor profiles sound amazing (as you will see below) and you are able to take growlers home with you containing the flavors of your choosing. Prepare to be happily inebriated in The BX. This will be just one reason for you to come back to the BX if you are not a native. The second reason is as follows...


West Indian/Caribbean fare is dominant out here in the North East Bronx. The Roti, borrowed from Indian culture and modified slightly to accommodate Caribbean tastes is a food that I have grown up with all my life. When you say the word roti in my family you know it's a meal in of itself that you are talking about and not a simple piece of bread to accompany an entree. The Caribbean roti is an entree all on its own that one can nom'd on for two - three separate meals pending on the greed factor.


What you are looking at is basically a huge delicious curried meat or veggie wrap-like sandwich with the bread being an Indian Roti flat bread rolled and packed with the food of your choosing. Feroza's (Weird name for the culture) is a BX institution that has been around for many years.


I remember spending Saturday's with my dad going to this place as a child. The flavors, sit still fresh in my mind from decades ago so I can't wait to share this with you all in kind. Frank has had Roti before but not this one. So we will see if this one tops his expectations and understanding of this fantastic slow cooked fast food.


I will be a day of fun, exploration and inebriation giving you sub Haarlemites (yes I am using the original Dutch spelling) a reason outside of The Bronx Zoo and Yankee Stadium to come up to and discover what things really look and taste like up here.
results.how_to_find_us: We will be meeting at Gun Hill Brewing first to indulge in some great Bronx brews. We will then take a 10 minute stumble to get some delicious West Indian Roti to fill our inerbriated bellies. Roti
results.name: Local Beer & Roti Up North (Tha Bronx Ya'll!!)

This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe and is free for those who attended both training sessions with him the same day, $4 for all others.


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP AT LEAST 2 HOURS BEFORE THE GAME!

• Update your RSVP by 11:30AM

• RSVPs close by 12 NOON

• No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP at least 2 hours before the game will be red carded after the second offense, which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Williamsburg Soccer Training activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Williamsburg Soccer Training Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Williamsburg Soccer Training programs or activities.

Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 2.00pm and finishes at 2.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

Testimonials:

"Instead of the 'knowledge gained', I find it appropriate to give a 5 star to 'raising my vibrations' during the meditation.... the energy of the group was Amazing and ZINGING! Thanks... " - S

Also, I have in the past trained in yoga and meditation but not practiced for a number of years - I felt all the beauty of it flowing connecting through my source once again aaaahhh bliss." - A.S.

results.description:
Join the members of NYC Debate for a "mock" debate between the two of the most compelling candidates from each major political parties, plus a leading third-party candidate from the Libertarian Party.

FORMAT:

• At least three volunteer debate participants needed on each side. 


• As part of the "mock" debate format, each debate participants will play the role of Candidate Trump, Candidate Sanders, or Candidate Johnson.


• The spirit of the debate will be centered on a genuine intellectual and oratorical reenactment under a hypothetical General Election Year match-up between these three candidates.

• The debate will be in a "townhall" format, allowing the meetup attendees, as the "townhall audience" members, to directly ask questions to any of the candidates.

TOPICS -- there will be three debate rounds, one for each of the topics below:

Round I:  Domestic agenda: the underlying governing principles (e.g., "the role of the government"), cabinet appointments and Supreme Court nominations, immigration, energy, and "social" programs, etc.


Round II:  Economic and trade policies; budget priorities, and proposed tax plans.

Round III: Foreign policy / international relations.


We'll also need support volunteers for timekeeping and factchecking.

After the debate, be sure to stick around for the post-debate party! 

----------------------------------------------------

ALL ATTENDEES WITH A CONFIRMED "YES" RSVP WILL RECEIVE A DIRECT MESSAGE ON FRIDAY, APRIL 8TH WITH ADDITIONAL EVENT DETAILS, INCLUDING THE ADDRESS OF THE VENUE.
results.name: Presidential Mock Debate: Donald Trump vs. Bernie Sanders vs. Gary Johnson

results.description:
Hey y'all. This month we're reading The Long Way to the Small Angry Planet. 

Follow a motley crew on an exciting journey through space—and one adventurous young explorer who discovers the meaning of family in the far reaches of the universe—in this light-hearted debut space opera from a rising sci-fi star.

Rosemary Harper doesn’t expect much when she joins the crew of the aging Wayfarer. While the patched-up ship has seen better days, it offers her a bed, a chance to explore the far-off corners of the galaxy, and most importantly, some distance from her past. An introspective young woman who learned early to keep to herself, she’s never met anyone remotely like the ship’s diverse crew, including Sissix, the exotic reptilian pilot, chatty engineers Kizzy and Jenks who keep the ship running, and Ashby, their noble captain.

Life aboard the Wayfarer is chaotic and crazy—exactly what Rosemary wants. It’s also about to get extremely dangerous when the crew is offered the job of a lifetime. Tunneling wormholes through space to a distant planet is definitely lucrative and will keep them comfortable for years. But risking her life wasn’t part of the plan. In the far reaches of deep space, the tiny Wayfarer crew will confront a host of unexpected mishaps and thrilling adventures that force them to depend on each other. To survive, Rosemary’s got to learn how to rely on this assortment of oddballs—an experience that will lead her on an amazing journey. 

New members welcome! Come hang out and talk story. We'll also be voting on the next book.
results.how_to_find_us: We're the nerds in the back.
results.name: Book Club: The Long Way to the Small Angry Planet

Our typical agenda: - We orient new visitors and then chat a bit, as by sharing what's new or good in our lives. - Then we chant and meditate together, together with the beautiful sounds of a gong - And finally we share thoughts and questions, learning something new sometimes, generally supporting each other best we can at all times.

Note that we meet every Wednesday, 7:30 to 9 pm, and every Saturday, 2 to 3:30 pm on Midchester Ave. -- except for the first Saturday of the month, when we meet elsewhere and begin our meeting at 5 pm, followed by an informal potluck social starting about 7 pm.

(When you plan on staying for the potluck, see the log-in information posted at our monthly potluck page. That helps us get healthy, balanced meals.)

By the way, the meetup page may show only a few members planning to attend a particular meeting. That's because many people attend regularly and don't bother to RSVP for each meeting.  We never have only a few members at a meeting. Twenty members more usually attend each meeting.

Call Merrill or Mataji anytime you have questions:[masked]-5334.

results.description:
This Event: 

The aim of this weekly event is to offer a place where Python developers and learners can come and ask questions or give help. 

Individuals of all programming skill levels are welcome. 

It is suggested that you bring your own laptop. If you don't have access to a laptop and want to attend, please let Paul Logston know and he will see about getting you a laptop for the day.

This event is free. 

This event is not a tutorial. Tutorials hosted by Learn Python NYC are labeled as tutorials.

Resources:

Here are some learning resources and free text editor / IDE suggestions.

https://github.com/logston/NYCPythonSOH/blob/master/resources.rst 

Detailed Directions to us:

As you enter the building located at 568 Broadway, New York, NY 10012 you will need to provide ID and your destination (Fueled Collective, 11th Floor) to the front desk. They will provide you with a sticker badge. Take one of the elevators (located to the right of the front desk) to the 11th floor. We will be in the Deerbrook conference room.
results.how_to_find_us: Show ID at front desk, come up to 11th floor, we are in the Deerbrook conference room!
results.name: Saturday Python Study Group

results.description:
Location: 11th floor, Deerbrook conference room

The purpose of the event is to provide a common space to work on, help, and be helped by fellow coders on any topic or technology that is Javascript related. It will take place concurrently with the Saturday NYC Python Study Group in an adjacent area, and there will be ample opportunity for cross pollination between the two groups. **Note that ID is required at the door when checking in for the event with security**

More info about the Python study group: 
http://www.meetup.com/learn-python-nyc/events/mksjflytfblc
results.how_to_find_us: Sign in with security with a photo ID and take the elevator to the 11th floor. Walk through the large bronze door to the Deerbrook conference room.
results.name: Study Group: Work on individual projects and help each other code

results.description:
REGISTER:  thespiritofmoney.eventbrite.com 


Are you tired of riding the rollercoaster of your money flow?

Do you find yourself fearful that you don't have enough money?

Or maybe you have money but aren't spending in fear of running out?

Are you wondering where you will find the money to pay for future rent, bills, or other necessities?

Do you work the principles of abundance, or The Secret or The Law of Attraction, but to no avail?

Are you doubting whether you can make as much money in your own business as in your job?


You've come to the right place.  Join Christine Clifton for an afternoon conversation exploring The Spirit of Money - and its impact on you and your life.  

You intuitively know that it shouldn't feel this hard to deal with money. You may have solid money management habits - or you may just go with the flow with money.  Either way, it's feeling heavy and burdensome.

Your birthright is infinite abundance. So why aren't you seeing it?  Why aren't the tools you're using, working?

Christine has been there before, at the top and the bottom of that roller coaster - and every point in between.  During this facilitated conversation, she will share her experiences and help you become aware of new or shifted perspectives that could grow you to your next level of abundance.


We'll use some of the following during the afternoon together:

* Open sharing and guidance through money BS (belief systems)

* Access Consciousnesses Clearing Statement, to dissolve blocks and limiting beliefs

* The Work - by Byron Katie, to navigate thoughts

* The Abundance Book - by John Randolph Price, for new awareness

* The Law of Divine Compensation - by Marianne Williamson, for new awareness

* Exploring lightness, heaviness - and laughter!

DRESS:  very casually comfortable, dress in layers

BRING:  water, dry snacks, journal, pen

PARTICIPANTS:  limited to 20 amazing souls

INVESTMENT:  Three ticket options:

Pay it forward sponsorship ticket - $40 - 5 available Single ticket - $25 - 10 available

Scholarship ticket application - $10 - 5 available

REGISTER:  thespiritofmoney.eventbrite.com 

I'll see you there!

warmly,

Christine Clifton

www.MindfulBusinessMatters.com
results.how_to_find_us: In the Library
results.name: Thrive: The Spirit of Money

results.description:
Why just paint when you can Tipsy Paint? That's what we thought too! So put a brush in one hand and a drink in the other (doesn't have to be alcohol) and join us for a unique, colorful way to spend the night out and make new friends!

Tipsy Painting is a step-by-step, group-oriented painting instruction, which is designed to simultaneously entertain and enlighten our members. A professional artist guides you through a featured painting that is yours to keep and proudly display at the end of the night. And don’t worry — no experience is necessary. 

PREPAY ONLY. MUST BUY IN ADVANCE (Space is limited).

*GET TICKET HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/painting/dates/Apr-09-2016_at_0230PM

*$35-$45, price goes up as the event date gets closer. This event will sell out, especially for women. Tickets not sold at the door.  

What's included: 

• 2+ hour course lead by an expert artist to teach you the art of mixing colors, blending and painting techniques. 

• 12x16 pre-sketched canvas, acrylic paint (water based), and all painting supplies (brushes, aprons, easels) supplied

• Drink & Food Specials (1 drink min, can be non-alcoholic)  

 • Great Music At Right Volume For Mingling 

• Free Raffle & Prizes 

*Get Tickets At This Link (no door sales) -  https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/painting/dates/Apr-09-2016_at_0230PM

*This event sells out quickly so don't wait to get your ticket!

This event is being co-organized by several other groups. The # of RSVP's here are not reflective of actual attendance. Based on presales, at least 25 members will be attending! 

Can I still attend If I don't know how to paint? Yes, there's no experience necessary. 

Can I come alone? Yes, about 80% come on their own. 

Is this age/ethnic/age specific? No, this event is not meant to be age/ethnic specific or gender balanced. All are welcome, 21+. 

How do I attend? RSVP w/ group and purchase ticket here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/painting/dates/Apr-09-2016_at_0230PM

This will be the picture we'll be painting -
results.how_to_find_us: 2nd Fl.
results.name: Painting Social (Learn To Paint & Make Friends!)

results.description:
PLEASE NOTE THIS IS A CASH ONLY ESTABLISHMENT!!

The Place: Voted NYC’s No. 1 steakhouse for the 32nd year in a row, this 1887-vintage Williamsburg chop shop remains a “long-standing Brooklyn tradition” thanks to its “sublime” steaks and “outstanding” sides; “no-nonsense” service and “German-beer-hall” decor ratchet up its “throwback” allure, but make sure to “bring plenty of cash” (it doesn’t take plastic) and, above all, “never mention the words ‘well done.’” [Zagat.com]

http://peterluger.com/brooklyn-menu/


Note: I will not attend this event. The reservation is under my name, Fay Kambos.

Recommendation: Order the USDA Prime Beef Steak, and Luger's Sizzling Bacon. The Luger Burger is highly reviewed too. Do not order the Chopped Steak Luncheon Special, nor the Creamed Spinach. 

RSVPs: Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event.

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better, but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come. 

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I will let you know if a spot becomes available. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist, it lets me know which kind of restaurants are popular so that I may schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.
results.name: Peter Luger Steak House - One Michelin Star

results.description:
You are invited to join the next meetup.Our meditation meetups are conducted by Dhammakaya meditation instructors, and practitioners who have committed their lives by ordaining to teach meditation and Dhamma(reality of life). They are eager to teach their technique and wisdom on meditation methods, benefits and knowledge gained from meditation, and our true purpose. Every session will be inspiring and will help encourage one to meditate. Though many of us are aware that meditation can help with stress, there is still so much more to learn from the benefits of meditating. We constantly need to be reminded and encouraged to meditate, otherwise it is easy to forget how meditating can be beneficial to our overall well being.

Class Schedule

3:10 Relaxation Exercise

3:30 Guided Meditation / Q&A / Group Discussion

4:30 End of the session

We hope to see you
results.name: Weekly Meditation

results.description:
This is a class in technique although, when you've conquered a song technically, then I will coach musicality and performance. Class size is limited. Fee is $20/per. You may audit the class once (without participating) for $10. Let me know when you sign up if that's your intention.

   People at the front desk are helpful and friendly and the Cafe on the floor has great coffee and cookies, sandwiches, <a>pizza</a>, etc.

   I've been asked to post this:

Dear Members:  This is the first you have heard from me. I am Mr. Harrington's agent/rep. Mr. Harrington teaches privately coaching established actors and singers. For years his private rate has been $120/hr for this service. He started teaching through Meetup earlier this year and has as his goal to bring professional level instruction to the public at a rate that leaves no one behind. This demands tight scheduling of both his time and the room rental with Ripley-Grier Studios.For these reasons, I will be insisting to him that "no shows" be dropped from the group. The policy is this: If you RSVP you better show up. If you cancel you better do this by 4:00 pm the previous day.A word to the wise...Michael T. Harvey
results.how_to_find_us: Check the electronic billboard opposite the elevators on floor 16.

Hello everyone! Last week was super fun and I'm very excited to roll right into this one. Sorry for the late posting on this meetup, it's been a bit busy, hehe. Don't worry though we're doing the screening as planned.
For this one we'll be in room 608, same room as last week.

Once again we'll be screening Rick and Morty before going to last week's episode, then we'll watch the new one. If we have the time maybe we could watch two R&M episodes. We'll see how it goes.

I'm looking forward to seeing you all this weekend!

results.description:
Amazingly enough, the season is just about over! And it's been a pretty wild ride. What a way to end the season against the trash of the league. But the Flyers at this moment are 7-2-1 over the past 10, sit 4 points behind us and have a game in hand. 

The Pens have a seriously tough run to end the season, and now without Geno, it's even tougher. So this season COULD (once again) come down to the final pivotal game. Just this time, it's not against the Sabres.

Either way, come down and day-drink with your fellow Pens fans - we will either be celebrating the start of the playoffs, holding our breath the entire game for a victory, or licking our wounds from the season (Thanks, ex-HCMJ).
results.name: Penguins Flyers - season on the line edition?

results.description:
I want to start up an acoustic jam on the second Saturday of every month.  We'll start the jam at The Studio but as the weather gets better we may move it outside.  I'm going to post the Reckoning set list as a framework but we can go into Garcia/Grisman, Old and in the Way, Jerry band, GD, Johnny Cash, Woody Guthrie, Bill Monroe, other stuff, etc.

Unlike the electric contingent of Working Man's Dead, this jam is looking to go HUGE.  Our goal is to convince at least one bar/ restaurant manager in NYC to pay us in Bloody Mary's to play the brunch hour on a Sunday.

I can switch back and forth from rhythm guitar, hack-banjo, singing and percussion.  We have a mandolin lined up but every other seat is open.


01. Dire Wolf
02. The Race Is On
03. It Must Have Been The Roses
04. Dark Hollow
05. China Doll
06. Been All Around This World
07. Monkey And The Engineer
08. Jack-A-Roe
09. Deep Elem Blues
10. Cassidy
11. To Lay Me Down
12. Rosalie McFall
13. On The Road Again
14. Bird Song
15. Ripple
results.name: I Reckon(ing) we should play some acoustic music

results.description:
At a family BBQ In 2010, 6 Teens from 2 separate families drowned to death in Louisiana's Red river. There were numerous people standing just feet away, not a single one could swim. The family's comment "None of us could swim, they were yelling, 'Help me, help me. Somebody please help me.' It was nothing I could do but watch them drown, one by one."

That same summer in NYC 7 people drowned to death 4 Adults, 3 children, all of minority descent and all too young.

• 70 Percent of African American Kids & Teens can't swim. (CDC 12')

• If a parent can't swim, there is only a 13% chance that a child in the household will swim. 

• Men are 4 times more likely to drown than women.

• The biggest reason black people give for not learning was hydrophobia "A fear of drowning". I'll let the irrationality of that one sink in.

 Be the change, be the example. Let's burn the Black people don't swim banner!

Argue with the facts all you want it doesn't change them! "I personally hate being a statistic and don't give 2 shits why people including myself can't do something. Just do it I tell myself everything else will fall into place" How about we end the cycle #NotaStatistic #BlackSwim

Black People Love Outdoors & Adventure aka me has been haggling for months and I've secured us all an amazing deal. Here's the scoop! 

5 Package of sessions @ $22 per (1 hr) lesson = $110


Session 1 (Beginner Class & Intermediate Class) - (Pay by Debit or Credit using Venmo to [masked] very easy!)

Saturdays @ 3pm. ST BART'S SWIMMING POOL

• 3/19/16; 3/26/16 (No Lesson); 4/2/16; 4/9/16; 4/16/16; 4/23/16

• Sign up now limited spots!

• Great private instructors, Nice & Heated 84 deg pool, changing rooms, close to trains. (Session 2 will progress members)

In 4 short months we have a Surfing Challenge; Kayaking; White water rafting; Swimming/ Beaching, Paddle boarding; Water skiing and an Open water survival techniques class, heck we'll be finding Nemo too. So Get your life!

Spot not confirmed until payment is received.

Note: As an amazing courtesy to our group you will have the chance to make up missed classes. (Please do not abuse this!) 

Let's get wet ;-) ~ Sorry couldn't help myself..blame the Race & Sex comedy show last week.

Recap NYC swim lesson prices: 1. JCC $296 members (~9 Classes), $376 Non-members

2. Nyc Pools Membership cost $75 for 6 months/ $150/ yr. Learn to swim is a lottery System currently session already started and has a very long wait-list.

3. Flushing Meadows Pool Qns - Lottery wait list is 6-8 months long.

4. Vanderbilt YMCA Manh- $140 members (1X/wk for 8 wks), $230 Non-members (1X/wk for 8 wks) Or $235 members (2X/wk for 8 wks), $405 Non-members (2X/wk for 8 wks). Other YMCS's may have different pricing but this gives you an idea. 

5. 92St Y Manh- Lessons ~$315 (Call for more details)
results.name: I won't drown Swim Challenge - Sold out

results.description:
A look back at the origins of today's Japanese popular music through a 1955 musical film entitled So Young, So Bright- in Japanese with English subtitles- at Japan Society. Optionally, and before the film, there is a complimentary curator lecture about the history of Japanese film from silent movies to modern film, and its relation to popular music including American genres.

Afterwards, mingle with fellow members and engage in cultural conversations over Japanese meal and drinks at Ootoya restaurant (west 40's).

Tickets for film $12, starts at 4:30pm and runs 90 minutes

Meet at 4pm at Japan Society entrance for film.

Will leave for walk over to Ootoya restaurant at 6pm to reach by 6:30pm-  http://ootoya.us/menu/

If you would like to hear the 3pm curator lecture (complimentary with film ticket purchase only), you can meet us at 2:30pm at Japan Society.

To attend, please send request email to me at [masked]
results.name: Japanese Film and Cuisine

results.description:
Bruce Lee's Enter The Dragon will be screening as part of the Old School Kung Fu Fest.

You've probably seen it before, but hey, it's a classic and it'll be on the big screen in 35mm!

The legendary martial arts film that cemented Bruce Lee as an international icon, Enter the Dragon is a punch-drunk ride through exploitation heaven that shaped the pattern for the thousands of martial arts movies that followed in its wake. Bruce goes undercover for British intelligence to fight in an underground tournament where the world’s best martial artists compete in a deadly battle to earn a job with Mr. Han, played by longtime Hong Kong star Shih Kien.

For tix (reserved seating) and info visit: http://metrograph.com/film/film/129/enter-the-dragon

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tB-QGOChuQc
results.how_to_find_us: In lobby. Otherwise, I am in Row J, seats 9 or 10. Afterwards, chow at Spicy Village on Forsythe Street.

results.description:
This is an open house and introduction to Teaneck Meditation. This introduction gives hope for those seeking happiness, peace, and truth. At Teaneck Meditation we use a very simple, yet direct way of cleansing and freeing the mind. This meditation is a customized guided one-on-one practice through self-reflection. Give your mind and heart a break from the chaos of everyday life! Deeply examine and empty your self to find absolute peace and freedom! If you are interested in becoming a member of our meditation center we will offer a special discounted price for meetup members only! 

We are located at 475 Cedar Lane Teaneck, NJ 07666. Our meditation center is located next to Veggie Heaven. Metered parking is in the front, and additional free parking is located in the back of the shopping strip. This introduction will last about an hour to an hour and a half. If you have many plans for the day please say this before the meetup starts so we can accomodate you properly. 

**If you are not able to attend this event, but have an interest in Teaneck Meditation you can call our center to have a personal introduction today! Teaneck Meditation is a non-profit organization and is tax deductible. A $10 donation is appreciated for the introduction. 

* 


475 Cedar Lane Teaneck, NJ 07666 
[masked] 
newjerseymeditation.org
results.name: Teaneck Meditation Introduction

At Palisades Park Meditation we use a very simple, yet direct way of cleansing and freeing the mind to recover one's original nature. This meditation is a customized guided one-on-one practice through self-reflection. Give your mind and heart a break from the chaos of everyday life! Deeply examine and empty your self to find absolute peace and freedom! **If you are not able to attend this event, but have an interest in Palisades Park Meditation, you can call our center to have a personal introduction today! results.description:
Greetings Fellow Tennis Players!

It's time to play!!! 

Aces to Deuces is the Tennis league for those who enjoy friendly tennis competition .

The league operates as follows; once registered you will receive a roster of whom you're scheduled to play within the 8 week regular spring schedule. The roster will include each members contact information so that you can determine a time and place to play that is suitable for each of you. If a place can not be determined a default midpoint location will be provided. 


 The league consist of 5 divisions; 


 Beginners ( Ranking[masked]) -Green group


 Women's Intermediate (Ranking[masked]) -Yellow group

Men's Intermediate (Ranking[masked]) -Yellow group # 2

Mixed Doubles (Combined Ranking of[masked])- Orange group

Advanced (Ranking[masked])-Red group


There will be a total of 5-7 members per division.

The Winner of each Division will receive a Trophy !!

The Spring season is <a>from </a><a>May 14th to June 25th</a><a>.</a> 

Spring Registration is <a>from April</a><a>1st to May 14t</a><a>h</a>

The cost per participant is 50$. 

To Register go tohttp://acestodeuces.teamopolis.com, Select Division tab on the lower right hand side of Page.

results.description:
It's that time again to celebrate all the hard work and awesome effort HVH has given to the Catskills this past year. Dust off those bowties and kitten heels and come along to the Catskill 3500 Club Annual dinner to cheer your fellow hikers as they receive their new member certificates for both the regular 3500s and the Winter 3500s!!

This event is open to Members, Aspirants, and their guests.

The cost is $40 per person and you have a meal choice of Prime Rib, Chicken Française or Mixed Veggie Lasagna.

Dinner registration form and cocktail hour/meal details are on page 8 of the latest Catskill Canister newsletter, available here:

http://www.catskill-3500-club.org/canister/currentcanister.pdf

*You must mail in a check by March 21st*

BASIC INFORMATION:

Estimated distance: A few hundred feet from the back parking lot, plus the distance for however many trips to the restroom and/or bar you make

Estimated elevation gain: Approximately 50 feet from the back parking lot.

Cocktail/social "hour" (hors d'oeuvres, cash bar) is from 3:30 - 5:00

Dinner starts at 5:15

Everyone can go, but if you happen to have become a 35er or Winter 35er between the date of last year's annual dinner and this year's annual dinner, your name will be read out and you will be called to walk up to the podium to get your certificate in front of everyone so put on those sassy pants!

After the dinner last year, we headed over to nearby Keegan Ales for more drinks, dancing, and laughs!

So many certificates!!

Note that we can opt to sit together at a single table (or at a group of more than one table if enough of us go). You certainly don't have to sit at our HVH table, but if you don't, there's no point in you RSVPing for this event, so even if you plan on going to this dinner please don't RSVP to this event if you're not going to sit with us.


Last year Keith got the names of everyone who was definitely going, and who wanted to sit together, and arranged for that to happen with the 3500 Club. I will do the same this year.

Everyone who signs up for this will be automatically added to the "waiting" list, and you will not be added to the "attending" list (and I will not be telling the 3500 Club that you will be sitting with us) until you send in your registration form and fee for the dinner to the 3500 Club and then tell me that you have done so and that you want to sit with us. Got it? You're on the waiting list for this HVH event, and won't be added to the "attending" list (or to our table) until you register for the dinner with the 3500 Club and tell me that you've done so - I won't be chasing people down this year.

** Please note that the registration deadline for the dinner is March 21, 2015. Please also note that I will also be telling the 3500 Club who will be sitting at the HVH table(s) by March 21, 2015 so you need to have registered and paid the fee to attend the dinner - and let me know - before then. **


<a href="http://www.catskill-3500-club.org/resources/news/2014AnnualDinner.pdf"></a>

results.description:
Let's explore the Met together every other Saturday with as little pressure as possible.

Go in the 81st entrance (not up the big stairs), and head straight back to the Uris Center for Education. We'll be at the set of benches in the middle on the left inside the room. At 4:15pm we will split up.

We'll decide who will go see what with whom, wander galleries, and meet at the north entrance to the Balcony Bar at 5:30pm for cocktails, mocktails, and small plates to chat. We'll get tables at 5:40pm.

Everyone is responsible for their own admission and tab. I recommend you bring cash for your tab to make settling the check easier.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at the set of benches in the middle on the left inside the Center For Education room, which is straight ahead when you get past coat check. At 4:15pm we will split up. Then meet up at the north entrance to the Balcony Bar at 5:30.

results.description:
Looking to transition soon from meetup so follow and join our facebook page for updates on the group, art relating to the theme, and more at https://www.facebook.com/groups/ImaginativeIllustratorsNYC/ 

Today we will be focused and immersive in a specific theme we will work on together as a group.

Fungi here, fungi there, fungi everywhere, its a fungi festival! Today we will have fun and chill out drawing fungi of all sorts. The sky's the limit today at what crazy designs you can incorporate fungi into and what fungi can inspire. So come out and draw some fungi with a group of fun guys!.... 

The meetup will be split into three parts: First a half hour of warm-up drawing followed by a break of conceptual discussion, then after an hour and a half drawing your chosen idea and design, lastly we'll discuss each others fully developed drawings and ideas as a group.

So don't forget to bring your supplies and sketchbook as this meetup is going to be drawing focused! Also feel free to bring any reference material that will help out with the theme in addition to what will be provided.

You can find me at the tables on the second floor of the Cranberry Cafe.

I hope to see you there and having fun participating in this new style of meetup and exercising, challenging, or developing your drawing and conceptual skills with other imaginative artists throughout NYC. Any skill level and any style is welcomed!
results.name: Lets Draw Together! Theme: Fungi Festival!

results.description:
Hi all,


We had a beautiful Drum Circle in March at Casa de Dragón in Inwood. The date for our next Earth Drum Circle will be Saturday, April 9th. We would love to see you there! Please RSVP to this MeetUp invite so that we can get a head count of who to expect. You can also reach us via E-mail at [masked].

Also, YouTube video and taken by Andrea and .WAV & M4A Audio Files of the March circle can be seen via these links:

YouTube Video
(1.) https://youtu.be/PUOSXLbLqdc
(2.) https://youtu.be/zkbm-CpepXY
(3.) https://youtu.be/S0oFQgeTNt8
(4.) https://youtu.be/Bkm21syUoMY
(5.) https://youtu.be/OIvxtR0F2lA

.WAV Files
http://alturl.com/q2xxw

.M4A Files
http://alturl.com/f38bb


DRAGON

P. S. If need to contact me the day of this event you can reach me at: H: (212)[masked] or Cell: (917) 597-5801.

When: Saturday, Saturday, March 12th at 4:30 p.m.

Where: Casa de Dragón, 5057 Broadway, Apt. #2, Inwood, NY.

What to Bring: Yourself (feel free to bring friends along), your drum (if drumming), and any other percussion or other instruments (adds to the mix). BTW, If you do not have a drum but want to drum come on up, I have plenty of extra drums here!

Food and Drink for Potluck: Please try to bring some food and or drink to share as we are tying to make the Drum Circles more of a potluck to sustain our drumming energies!!!

Public Transportation to Inwood

The #1 Train:
Take the #1 train to the 215th Street Station. (Don't miss your stop, the next one is in the Bronx) If you get on the train in the fourth car from the front it will put you right at the exit doors when you get off the train. Once down the stairs I am 1 block West of the train station. Just walk from 10th Avenue (where the train stops) to Broadway. (Away from the Department of Sanitation.) Cross to the far side of Broadway and I am the first building on the right. (Just North of the Deli - Between 215th and 216th Streets)

The A Train:
Take the A train to the 207th Street station. Make sure you get on the train at front two cars which will let you exit at 211th Street and Broadway. Walk 4 blocks North on Broadway to 215th Street on the West side of the street. I am the first building just past 215th Street. (Just North of the Deli - Between 215th and 216th Streets)

Download a current Subway Map PDF from the MTA.

results.description:
A Conversation About Happiness

Alternating Hosts: George, Priyo, & Michael Y

</a> CitiCorp Atrium Lower Level
153 E 53rd street (Between Lexington and 3rd ave)

Look for our red Meetup Sign.

Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! The theory behind these events comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group. It's important that our events be fun! So with that in mind, let's get serious about ramping up our enjoyment of life!

(photo of atrium and location of meetup table)

(photo of atrium entrance at the corner of 53rd and Lex.)


At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps (see photo) leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

<a href="http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.335.9655&rep=rep1&type=pdf">Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages
results.how_to_find_us: At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.
results.name: A Conversation About Happiness @ Citicorp at 53rd and Lex. Host: Priyo

results.description:
The new format lives on: 50/50 Co-Ed Games. We'll open up 12 spots for men and 12 spots for women. And each team will have at least 2 women playing on the court at all times.

Sign up here if you're a dude.

Other than that, the idea will be basically the same:

We rent out the gym from 5:00-8:00pm. 

Please arrive at least 5-10 minutes early as the sooner everyone arrives, the sooner we can begin playing. Note that all games stop at 7:45pm as we have to be out of the gym by 8:00pm. (If you get there late, please only ring the bell once. It is very loud! And it takes us a few minutes to get downstairs.) The gym is on the 10th fl. & has adjoining bathrooms, lockers, and water fountains.

We'll hit up McSwiggans (393 2nd Avenue @ 23rd St) later! 

Don't forget:

* You must be no more than 5'8" to play!

* You must RSVP on the site in order to attend!

* You will be asked to sign a waiver for 2014 as we're not a litigious group. 

If you have any problems with the prepay, just shoot one of the organizers an email.

Here are the basic rules we follow for games:

1. Play by ones and twos to 11 - win by one point.

2. Make it - take it.

3. Backcourt if the ball hits the rim or backboard. Air balls are fair game to put right back up.

4. Jump balls/disputed calls will be determined by a three pointer since the laws of basketball physics are very clear that "the ball never lies."

5. Walls, half-court line, and ceiling are out of bounds.  

6. Subs will enter the game no later than 6 points in (once one of the teams reaches 6 points). The sub will start the following game. Teams will regulate themselves but let's make sure everyone plays.

See you on the court! B-)

***NOTE***

In an effort for us to reduce overcrowding and to maintain a more accurate estimate of how many people to expect, please sign up online if you intend to play. There is a waiting list if all spots have been taken. We ask that you please just do not show up unannounced as you will kindly be asked to turned away. 

Also feel free to bring your own basketball for shoot-around. And don't forget to clip your nails prior to game day. We tried playing with Edward Scissorhands once - it didn't turn out so well.


*****NEW*****

Share your Spotify playlists and tracks with us and we'll play them during gametime!

Send an email to [masked]

And please submit good tunes otherwise we'll be Basketball for the Musically Challenged...

results.description:
Hello Beautiful!


You are invited to join a sacred circle for an evening of meditation, sharing, support, and setting intentions for the next moon cycle.  This new moon will be in fiery Aries; a sign full of energy and courage.  As the first sign of the zodiac, Aries represents new beginnings, leadership, and initiating action.  In this circle we will be reflecting upon the winter season and exploring what creations and aspects of ourselves that we want to bring forth for the spring.  Allow yourself to be supported in a sacred circle of women and held in the energies of the Divine Feminine as you tap into your internal fire to ignite your longings into action.  Women of all ages and spiritual beliefs are welcome.


**Space is limited so you must email me at [masked] to reserve your spot in the circle**


When: Saturday April 9th, 5pm-630pm 

Location: Reflections Yoga Center, 227 E 24th St, New York, NY 10010

Exchange: $20 cash or through venmo app (@stephanie-jaggers)

Bring: Journal and your favorite pen

Optional: personal item to put on altar (will be returned)

**If you've attended this circle before, you will notice that I raised the exchange fee to $20.  This is to ensure that the space rental fee is covered


For more info visit 

http://www.stephaniejaggers.net/womens-circles/

Hope to see you there!

Much Love,

Stephanie

results.description:
Have you paid for your ticket on the EventBrite site at http://bit.ly/1oKWavf?

Your registration here does not get you entrance into the event until you pay through EventBrite 

** NOTE: This includes a ticket to the last game of the season and a $10 meal voucher. So its a meetup/hockey game all in one :) **

Behind the Scenes: The Technology, Social Marketing & Operations of the only major professional sports team to embrace the NJ name

Technology – From senior technology executives and engineers, possibly including the President and CTO, on how the NJ Devils use technology in their everyday operations, how technology has changed professional sports organizations over the last 20 years and innovations planned for the future

Social Media, Marketing & Communications – How do the Devils communicate with fans, sponsors and the community? How have they harnessed current technology to increase attendance and involvement? How do they interact with fans during the game day experience?

Game Day Operations & Scoreboard – What goes into hosting up to 20,000 people on game day? How does staff (security, vendors, executives) communicate and ensure a quality experience for fans? What systems and logistics go into the scoreboard, PA and arena mounted displays during a game?

Ice Surface Maintenance – How do they switch from hockey to concerts and how fast? How is the symbols and ads painted on the surface? How do they melt and bring back the ice surface?

Hosting at The Prudential Center in Newark NJ

SATURDAY, APRIL 9, 2016 at 5:00 PM

Our group will enter at the VIP EAST entrance and will be directed or escorted to the private meetup space from there

$45 for the entire event includes:

·  Meetup featuring a panel discussion of NJ Devils executives which may include the President, CTO, Chief Engineer of the Prudential Center and other technology and marketing staff. Cash bar available

·  Enjoy Fan Appreciation Night at the last game of the season vs Toronto Maple Leafs. Puck drops at 7:00pm. Fireworks outside the arena about a half hour after the game.

·  Price of ticket includes a $10 meal voucher!!!

·  Depending on size of group, after game activities may include: Group photo on the game ice or using NHL hockey sticks to shoot pucks into a net from the blue line.

RSVP NOW! First 100 attendees save 15%:http://bit.ly/1oKWavf

Dharma Drink Friends,

Looking very forward to attending the BGR Benefit Concert.  But I also want to enjoy some good food with fellow Dharma friends before the wonderful cause.

Come join us for an early dinner together at Two Boots East Village before going to concert.  In case you are vegan/vegetarian like myself, Two Boots is friendly for us too.  I believe this is "the original" Two Boots and it's very ornately decorated.  BTW Zagat gives it a 19 for food

After dinner, we'll stroll to the BGR Benefit Concert!

Eddie

results.description:
Ok, Demolition is at 5:20, Hardcore Harry is at 5:15 and The Boss is at 5:00.

So, they are all around the same time , so it makes it easy to meet right after.

With 20 people, I'm thinking Outback can take us. They do not take reservations, but last time they gave us two tables when I called ahead.

Demolition, starring Jake Gyllenhall and Naomi Watts is opening on 4/8. Billed as comedy/drama and Jake is getting rave reviews already.

The Boss, a comedy with Melissa McCarthy,  is opening on the 8th as well. 

Let me know which you'd prefer. And still need dinner places. Judy suggested Outback since we have a big group and they accommodated us well once before. 

I'm open!

Hey guys, we haven't had a meetup since Feb. so it's about time. I'll post again once I know what movies are playing. Dinner places are welcome! I had to put a time in, but that will change.
results.name: See either Demolition, Hardcore Harry or The Boss and dinner Outback

results.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LiNPAjT5EJ4

This is one of the most powerful ways to grow your photography business! Coming together with a mastermind group of motivated like-minded photographers will help you achieve your photography goals. It will also put you in the right mindset to succeed. Everyone in the mastermind group is unique in skill, experience, and connections. By interacting and sharing your challenges, it’s almost certain someone in the mastermind will have a solution for you, and you may also be able to offer a solution, connection or tactic to help another in the group.

What Will You Get From Attending This Meeting?

• Answers and ideas, which come from brainstorming with the group

• Learn from others, which will give you added confidence that you've made the right decisions and are taking the right actions to achieve your goals

• Accountability and real progress in your business and personal life

• An instant and valuable support network

• A sense of shared endeavor - there are others out there!

• Design things to be the way you want them to be, not as you've been told they "should" be

• A positive boost to your everyday mental state

Each member will get a minimum of 10 minutes to share their business challenges and receive feedback and suggestions from the group. Come prepared with questions or challenges you are currently experiencing with your business. The more prepared you are, the more you will get out of the meeting! 

Please Note: Each meeting is limited to only 8 people to make sure that everyone gets the most out of the meeting.
results.name: Photography Mastermind Meeting - Grow Your Business (Space Is Limited)

results.description:
Special Workshop in Manhattan!! Big Apple 4-week Practice Series!! 


Let's master Big Apple, one of the most popular and historical line dances! The very original performance by Whitey's Lindy Hoppers in the movie called Keep Punching can be seen here: 

https://youtu.be/OfgKMfexdPQ

At Lindy Hop dance events, when a certain song is played, dancers often times form a circle and start dancing the Big Apple. Here is the clip of gigantic Big Apple at Lindy Focus, one of the biggest New Year's Lindy Hop event. 

https://youtu.be/ZGueAPUIZEw

We are going to meet 4 Saturdays in April (April 9, 16, 23, 30 ) from 5:30 to 6:30pm and drill this routine to a performance level!! Students may choose to perform at You Should Be Dancing Studio's Spring Bash party on April 30th!! All levels and drop ins are welcome!! Let me know if you have any questions!!

Please register at http://youshouldbedancing.nyc/…/big-apple-4-week-drop-seri…/ 
Or call the studio at (212)[masked] 
You Should Be Dancing Dance Center 
412 8th Ave, 4th floor, NYC

Pricing:$25 per class or $80 for all 4 weeks

results.description:
The campaign to bring offshore wind power to New York is picking up speed and the wind is at our backs! 

Join PCM-NY and other members of the WinWind Coalition on SaturdayApril 9th to tell Mayor de Blasio to make an Earth Day commitment to bringing offshorewind power to New York City.

On April 9th, the media will be hosting their annual Inner Circle Show, where de Blasio and the press trade spoofs in song and dance. This year’s theme is “Shamilton”. We’ll be putting on a show of our own outside, sporting Hamilton costumes and holding wind turbines, maybe even breakin out some Dylan (“the answer my friends, is blowin in the wind…”) We need you there with us to ensure the Mayor and the media know that New Yorkers are looking for an ambitious offshore wind commitment from the City on Earth Day.

Come out and bring friends—it’s time for a renewable energy revolution in New York. It’s time to #WinWind for NY!
results.name: Call on the Mayor to commit to Offshore Wind!

results.description:
http://tinyurl.com/winwindNY-April9

Hi Climate Champions!

The campaign to bring offshore wind power to New York
is picking up speed and the wind is at our backs!
In February, more than 150 of us came out to the steps of
City Hall to call on Mayor Bill de Blasio to make offshore
wind a key part of his climate agenda. The very next day, on
WNYC radio, the Mayor spoke about the importance of
developing offshore wind for the Big Apple. Now it’s time
to build on our momentum and keep him accountable.

Join us on Saturday, April 9th to tell Mayor de Blasio to
make an Earth Day commitment to bringing offshore wind
power to New York City.

Saturday, April 9th
5:30pm
Hilton Midtown Hotel,[masked]th Ave. at 54th

results.description:
During weekly meetings on Saturday evenings in the East Village of New York City, Atmanivedana das (Atma) and Subhangada devi dasi (Subhie) teach how to hear and chant sanskrit names for God in kirtan and teach a systematic study the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Kirtan meditation consists of hearing and chanting sanksrit names for God to the accompaniment of melodious and rhythmic music in order to invoke God's divine mercy and presence.  Bhagavad-gita As It Is is studied according to the ancient, yet unbroken, chain of teachers, as taught originally by Krishna and eventually Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu, Rupa Goswami, and more recently A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness.   

Our focus is a systematic and thematic, but not difficult to understand, study of the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Everyone will read verses together from the Bhagavad-gita, copies of which will be provided for attendees to reference during the meetup.  Atma and Subhie will together explain the Bhagavad-gita verses according to the ancient tradition that they have studied and lived by for almost fifty-five years, combined.  We will learn about various fascinating topics, such as karma, reincarnation, the soul, the material energy, the Supreme Soul, time, and the relationship between the soul, the material energy, and the Supreme Soul.

Hard cover copies of the beautiful Bhagavad-gita As It Is with the original 700 sanskrit verses, translations, and elaborate purports by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, will be available for any member who might choose to take one home for a suggested donation of $10.

This meetup is intended for everyone who is interested without discrimination and regardless of one's familiarity with the subject matter.  Please come and relish this most wonderful discussion and kirtan, celebrating the glories of bhakti yoga, i.e., devotional service to God, who is known according to the Bhagavad-gita by the name Krishna.

Here is the general schedule of our meetups: we begin the evening with a kirtan that lasts about half an hour -- until about 6:00 p.m.  Then, we have a class on Bhagavad-gita As It Is, which lasts for about an hour and a half.  In the class, we will go through verses of the Gita in order, continuing from where the last class left off, with questions pertaining to those verses being encouraged throughout the class.  By about 7:30, the last kirtan begins; it lasts for about 30 minutes.  A sumptuous and nutritious vegetarian dinner is served after that.

Admission to each meetup is free.  Donations for the meetup's expenses are welcome, but not at all required!

Atma is an initiated priest who since 1990 has been studying, teaching, and living according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita as taught and followed by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. After living in a monastic setting for eight years, Atma resumed his undergraduate education at Brown University, where he hosted weekly programs that focused on kirtan and Bhagavad-gita.  He then enrolled at the University of Chicago Law School from which he graduated in 2004 and from which he received a merit scholarship.  Atma practices law in courts throughout the country, with his office in Long Island, and his concentration in securities and derivative litigation.  His primary goal is to imbibe in his own life the devotional teachings of the Bhagavad-gita and to share the same with others as a humble offering to God.

Subhie has been living her life according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita since 1991 and is also an initiated priest.  Subhie lived in a monastic setting until 2005.   From 1991 to 2005, Subhie taught Bhagavad-gita in Croatia, Serbia, Greece, Germany, and United Kingdom.  Subhie spent several years studying Vedic knowledge in India, primarily in the holy town, Vrindavana.  After 2005, Subhie resumed her undergraduate education in religion at the University of London -- and then locally at Queens College, after she moved to New York and married Atma.  Subhie completed her Master's degree in teaching at Queens College and is a school teacher.
results.how_to_find_us: The meeting is at 26 2nd Avenue, between 1st St. and 2nd St. You can take the F train and get off at the 2nd Ave. stop (and use the 2nd Ave. exit at that station).
results.name: Bhagavad-gita Class & Kirtan @ 5:30 p.m. on Saturdays at 26 2nd Avenue, NY, NY

If you're one of the many single professionals in the city who would like to meet some great people to date, you'll probably want to come to our most popular theme of speed mingling for "Single Professionals 30s & 40s".   

This just means you'd like to meet a variety of singles like yourself, and you'd rather not have to endure the randomness and uncertainty that comes with going to a bar.  At our single professionals events we tend to get the highest attendance numbers, so there is someone for everyone!

Get ready for a night of high-energy mixing and mingling. You'll have between 30-40 dates each lasting 2.5 - 3 minutes. This is a great way to meet as many people as possible in one night!

This just means you'd like to meet a variety of singles like yourself, and you'd rather not have to endure the randomness and uncertainty that comes with going to a bar.  At our single professionals events we tend to get the highest attendance numbers, so there is someone for everyone!

Get ready for a night of high-energy mixing and mingling. You'll have between 30-40 dates each lasting 2.5 - 3 minutes. This is a great way to meet as many people as possible in one night! 

EACH TICKET ALSO INCLUDES A FREE DRINK!

*Prepay Only. NO Tickets Sold At Door. Must buy in advance. 

*Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/speed3045/dates/Apr-09-2016_at_0600PM

$29 w/ discount code "5" at checkout (first 5 tickets)

results.description:
Speed Dating seats sell out quickly - Preregister via Paypal today to ensure your seat is reserved by visiting  

</a><a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=LWZGN3X2EER9E">https://littlegaybook.com/events/lesbian-speed-datingnetworking-2/ 

How would you like to go on 30+ micro dates in one night? Oh, the possibilities! Spend your evening with me while I guide you through each round of dates.  

</a>

Join Melissa and meet some of NYC & NJ’s most eligible single women for speed dating and networking! Would you rather make friends instead? Come join the fun – there is no pressure. Make romantic, friendship, and even business connections. You can speed-date, speed-friend, or speed network!  

$20 if you preregister for a speed dating seat or 
$25 to sign up at the door (both includes entrance to our singles mixer)

and we provide you with everything you need including pen, clip board, score card and optional questions! 

ATTENTION: Speed Dating rounds start at 7pm SHARP! Arrive no later than 6:30 to receive your materials. 

$7.00 Specialty Cocktails Specials! 
$7.00 Beer!! 
$25.00 Hookah!!! 
Yummy Tapas Menu!!!! 

It’s okay if you’re feeling nervous about speed dating because I will guide you from start to finish and give you all the tools you need to succeed! 

<a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=LWZGN3X2EER9E">

Preregister now by clicking here!!

*This is not just a speed dating event - This is a singles mixer too!!*

$5.00 cover to attend mixer only 
6pm - 10pm

Don't want to speed date but still want to have fun? Join us at our singles mixer where we will drop our inhibitions and go out on a limb for love! While the women are speed dating, you can mingle with one another and see what all the speed dating fuss is about! I will be there to help break the ice and make introductions. You never know who you'll meet! Once speed dating rounds are done, we ALL GET TO PARTY TOGETHER and dance the night away! 

If you're nervous about attending a singles event, don't be! Fearless women from all spectrum of the rainbow attend my events and make fun, quality connections - Why Not You?! 

Let's dance the evening away and make lasting connections at this beautiful space tailored for a grown and sexy FUN time! 

**Free admission to our After-Party at the Legendary Henrietta Hudson!!!! What?! Password will be provided** 

How it works: 

• Rounds will last approximately 3-5 minutes depending upon the number of participants. 
• Scorecards and assigned numbers will be handed out to all speed dating participants. In addition, suggested questions  will be provided to help the tongue-tied and we encourage you to ask your own! Be creative with your questions and more importantly HAVE FUN! 
• At the end of the event submit your scorecards to Melissa. She solely will review scorecards. 100% private & confidential! Client privacy is of top concern. When two singles indicate the same level of interest toward each other (2nd date, friendship, business), we will provide each with the other’s contact information via email.

and Voila! 

This event is being cross-promoted over several meetup groups and all over Facebook. The RSVP represented here is NOT indicative of actual participation!
results.name: Lesbian Singles Mixer & Speed Dating Event

results.description:
APRIL WILD WOMAN MOON CIRCLE
with Meredith Edwards

Theme in ARIES:
ACTIVATING THE WISE WARRIOR 

The Spring season invites us to rise forth and charge forward in the sun. This month, we'll tune in to the pioneering fire of Aries to activate the wise warrior within us all. 


SATURDAY, APRIL 9TH
6:00 - 8:00 PM
Awakening NY
605 Manhattan Ave, Greenpoint, BK

$20 | Bring a journal & pen

In circle, we gather together to be seen, heard, and witnessed by ourselves and one another. Tuning inward, we create sacred space with goddess cards, guided meditation, creative visualization, sharing, (chocolate), and an intention setting ritual to connect deeper to ourselves, our desires, and our community of women.

This circle is a part of The WILD Woman Project, open to the public, and a safe space for all who identify as women.

Register: http://www.meredithedwards.com/event/march-circles

results.description:
**Meetup-platsen är bestämd. Om du inte fått någon e-post från mig med platsdetaljer, vänligen hör av dig genom att klicka på det lilla kuvertet till vänster.** 

Den här månaden träffas vi på en restaurang eller krog med bra läge på Manhattan eller Brooklyn. När meetup-platsen är bestämd kommer du att få e-post med platsdetaljer.


Om du vill komma på vår Happy Hour så registrera dig gärna på väntelistan! Om du kan delta i samtal på svenska eller norska utan att prata på engelska, så är möjligheten väldigt stor att du kommer få en plats. (Vårt mål är inte prata engelska innan 8.30 pm.) 

Observera att de flesta i gruppen ar antingen svenskar eller norrman eller personer som talar svenska eller norska sa om du kommer for att fa tala danska, var beredd pa att det eventuellt inte ar sa manga danskar dar. 

Eftersom vi pratar svenska, norska och danska pa vara traffar antas bara medlemmar som har atminstone grundlaggande kunskaper i nagot av de skandinaviska spraken.

Vänligen OSA respektfullt. Vi är en verklig grupp av vänner och våra etikettsregler återspeglar detta. Om du inser att du inte kan komma, vilket är helt ok, så se till att du uppdaterar din OSA.
results.name: April Happy Hour

results.description:
Opia
130 East 57th (btw Lexington & 3rd)
Saturday, April 9th Live 3-piece jazz 8:00 – 11:30
6:45pm optional drinks, 7:45 pm dinner
$75 3-course dinner, gl wine, coffee, tax/tip

After you RSVP here, please go to the website to prepay, www.thesinglegourmet.net/event/opia/ ALL of our events are prepaid and we average 25-40 people. We do not take cash at the door as the restaurants need an accurate headcount and seating is assigned via tables and demographics. With such a large group, it is just the way restaurants will accept us. We are a membership only organization, but allow meetup members to attend some of our events to meet new faces. To see more of our events and to join, please go to www.thesinglegourmet.net Thank you for understanding.

Founded in 2001, by illustrious restaurateurs Frederick Lesort and Antoine Blech (Frederick's, Jour et Nuit, Lemon, and Matisse), Opia embodies the vivacity of its founders' native and present cities: the mysterious cool of New York and the à la mode sophistication of Paris. Upon 2 members’ recommendations, my wife and I, dined here recently and gave it 4 thumbs up. You will find that the accommodating and sumptuous ambiance makes for an unforgettable experience. Set inside the beautiful Renaissance Hotel, Opia screams opulence and elegance, and our 3-course meal incudes: beet salad, quinoa salad, salmon tartare, New York strip steak, sole amandine, roasted chicken, spinach and ricotta ravioli, chocolate molten lava cake, dulce de leche flan and a chocolate mousse. There will be a 3-piece live jazz band playing as well. This will be a fun and music filled Saturday night!

Dharma Drink Friends,

Come join us for a great cause, feed the hungry by attending a concert!  

Grammy-nominated pianist Fred Hersch, vocalist composer Becca Stevens, percussionist Rogério Boccato, and Colombian folkloric ensemble Cumbiamba eNeYé will headline the 5th annual Concert to Feed the Hungry.


Early Dinner: You are welcome to join us prior to concert at 5pm for an early dinner at TWO BOOTS nearby.  Then we come to the concert together!

Ticket Info: Regular Tickets: $25/$15 students w/ID
Early Bird Tickets: $20/$10 students w/ID (until March 9)
Sponsor Tickets: Purchase sponsor tickets that will go to NYC high school musical students! $15  (links below).


Buddhist Global Relief (BGR) was formed by American Buddhist scholar-monk, Ven. Bhikkhu Bodhi, and his students in 2007 to help the needy.

Eddie

results.description:
The Fourth Annual Concert to Feed the Hungry Jazz Benefit for Buddhist Global Relief:

Tickets are available here.


"Over the past three years, Buddhist Global Relief has held an annual Concert to Feed the Hungry, an event that brings together jazz musicians, jazz fans, and friends of BGR in an inspiring and uplifting evening. This year the concert will be held in connection with International Jazz Day and will cap a whole day of jazz-themed events by our partners Jazzmobile, The New Heritage Theatre Group, and The Interchurch Center located in Harlem, the heart of New York’s jazz scene and where the concert will be held.

Funds raised from the concert will go to support BGR’s projects, which give vital food aid to poor communities around the world, send disadvantaged, girls to school, and promote holistic food production at the grass-roots level in countries ranging from Cambodia to India to Ethiopia to Haiti to the USA.

BGR also seeks to raise awareness of global hunger and advocate for an international food system that exemplifies social justice and conduces to ecological sustainability."

To learn more, visit www.buddhistglobalrelief.org
results.name: Buddhist Global Relief Concert to Feed the Hungry
