results.description:
Take A Risk: SEX! is an experiential event where you take a risk to share and explore an aspect of your sexuality . 


When we experience ourselves as sexual beings, open to our full flow, pulsing with life energy through our body, we become more creative and feel more deeply connected to ourselves and to others. In this dynamic, interactive evening combining individual work with group process, you will learn techniques to liberate this energy and access more pleasure in your life. These techniques will be demonstrated through individual body readings with select participants who choose to take the risk of revealing a sexual issue and are willing to work through it in a supportive environment with expert guidance. 

Dr. Kincaid uses the teachings of Integral Evolutionary Tantra and the principles of Core Energetics to open up physical blocks and places where life energy doesn’t move. In Integral Evolutionary Tantric teachings and in Core Energetics -- a powerful body-based process -- sexual energy and life force energy are one and the same. Join us with body readings, deep truth, wild goodness, radical personal transformation and, if you dare, the evolution of your own personal enlightenment.

Note: This workshop is for both couples and singles. It does not include nudity or explicit sexual touch. All genders and sexual preferences welcome.

Led by Kristina Kincaid in conjunction with

The Institute of The Integral Evolutionary Tantra

Assisted by Tara Urszula Pietrzykowska

Admission: $20 

Tickets: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/take-a-risk-sex-with-dr-kristina-kincaid-tickets-22628846489

When you register or attend, please make a point to tell the facilitator that you heard about this event from the Pleasure Without Borders Meetup.


Dr. Kristina Kincaid is the Director of The Institute of Integral Evolutionary Tantra, New York City. Kristina is on faculty at The Institute of Core Energetics and holds an M.A. in Energy Medicine and a Doctorate in Theology from Holos University. She is also a graduate of the Institute of Core Energetics and Barbara Brennan School of Healing. Her journey has taken her into deep explorations and healing around sexuality. She has a healing practice in NYC.

Connect with us:

http://www.meetup.com/integral-evolutionary-tantra/

http://integralevolutionarytantra.com/
results.how_to_find_us: Between 6th and 7th Ave, 18th floor
results.name: Take A Risk: SEX! with Dr. Kristina Kincaid

results.description:
Start your Saturday night out right with Tabletop Game Night at the Brooklyn Strategist!  Starting at 8pm, we turn down the lights and reach for the top-shelf games.  Led by two of the most experienced Board Games Gurus in Brooklyn, we'll take you on a journey through the best modern board games around.  Whether you are merely curious about this rapidly expanding hobby or are a long time enthusiast tired of playing the same games with the same people, our experts will put your brain to work as you play through our extensive game library.  All levels of experience are welcome and encouraged to participate.

We play all genres of games, from intense strategy games to light, easy to pick up party games.


Past games include: 

Lords of Waterdeep, Concept, 7 Wonders, Pandemic, Citadels, Evolution, Bang!, Snake Oil, Acquire, Libertalia, Cuba.


Any attendees to the program will receive a special 10% discount on retail game sales!
results.name: Tabletop Game Night

results.description:
Our ongoing, intimate MUSIC NIGHT, featuring NYC's best indie musicians!!

This time around, we're at Chez Cusack (aka Sean's cozy apartment on the Upper East Side), complete with UPRIGHT PIANO.

_________________________
ACT 1: JACLYN SHAW


Jaclyn is a wonderful singer/songwriter, fresh off her national tour supporting the release of her latest album, Thread of Red!  Powerful vocals and guitar playing...


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ToTL_c5nD_g

Learn More: http://www.roomfulofsky.com/records/friends.html#jaclyn-shaw

_________________________
ACT 2: THE BLISS JOCKEYS


Long-time favorites The Bliss Jockeys will turn in a high-energy and dynamic acoustic set, playing new arrangements of many of their current tunes, as well as a couple old favorites.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mnvcloymXNk

Learn More: http://www.roomfulofsky.com/records/artists/the-bliss-jockeys.html

_________________________

This is going to be an intimate living-room type concert!!

_________________________
ABOUT CHEZ CUSACK:

We will be in a beautiful and spacious atmosphere: the uniquely welcoming Upper East Side abode of our very own member, Sean Cusack. Sean has lovingly created a special atmosphere which is comfortable, calm and accommodating! He's hosted countless large parties here  over the past decade, and his place comes complete with a working PIANO, a guitar, plenty of comfortable seating, flowing WINE, yummy snacks, a large TV and sound-system, and only 'mild' restrictions on the amount of noise we can make!

Sean will serve complimentary wine and refreshments throughout the evening.

_________________________
NOTES:

Tell the Front Desk you're there for Sean Cusack (#29C);

Take the LEFT elevator bank up to the 29th Floor.

(The event fee helps us cover the rental fee for the room.)

WE START ON TIME, PLEASE BE ON TIME.

_________________________
results.how_to_find_us: Tell the Front Desk you're there for Sean Cusack (#29C); Take the RIGHT elevator bank up to the 29th Floor.
results.name: MUSIC NIGHT @ CHEZ CUSACK - Jaclyn Shaw! The Bliss Jockeys!

results.description:
Quena Crain will be calling a cheery, funky program of contras accompanied by the Gaslight Tinkers!

Afrobeat, Caribbean, funk, and Latin grooves meet traditional Northern Fiddle in the future of the music of the past.


The Gaslight Tinkers are: 

Audrey Knuth, fiddle 

Dave Noonan, percussion 

Garrett Sawyer, bass 

Peter Siegel, mandolin, guitar, banjo

Come dance to a live caller and band with Country Dance New York.  We are an intergenerational, multiethnic, smoke and alcohol free, inclusive community with one thing in common:  we love to contra and English country dance! 

Contra dance is a high energy American folk dance accompanied by live string music and taught by a caller.  No partner or experience required.  All dances are taught in advance and the figures are easy to learn.

Please bring a pair of clean, soft soled shoes {no spike heels} to dance in, and a water bottle.  We ask that you not use strongly scented grooming products as the smell can become overwhelming on the dance floor when things start to heat up. 

Country Dance New York has been hosting contra dances most Saturdays, and English country dancing most Tuesdays, at Church of the Village for almost 70 years.   COV is located at 201 W. 13 St., on the northwest corner of 7th Avenue.  

Beginners' session on Saturdays {for contra} is from 7:30 to 8:00.  Dancing for all from 8:00 until 10:45.  Hang out with us at a local diner after the dance.

Beginner's session on Tuesdays {for ECD} is from 7:00 to 7:30.  Dancing for all from 7:30 to 10:30.

Cost:  $15 for general public; $12 members and for full time students with ID.  Be sure to tell the people at the door if this is your first time dancing with us.  They will give you a free pass to return as our guest!

To see what contra dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mM5vNzFxxBs 

To see what English country dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rB40AvJnMUY 

Join us on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/2449906414/

For a complete schedule of our upcoming season, and for more information, visit our website.

See you on the dance floor!
results.how_to_find_us: Take the ACE, 1,2,3, L or F train to 14th St. We are on the northwest corner of 13th Street and 7th Avenue. Street address is 201 W. 13th.
results.name: Contra Dance w/ Quena Crain and the Gaslight Tinkers!

CFT Deal! | Comedy with one of Canada's “Top Five Comedians"!
April 9, 2016, 8:00 pm


Regular Price: $25, CFT Member Price: $0.00 , Reservation Fee: $4.50

Reservation: has to be made on this website in order to obtain complimentary tickets; you can see all the reservations you have made at 

Your Profile

Carmen Lynch has been a semi-finalist on NBC's Last Comic Standing and performed several times for the troops in Iraq and Kuwait. She has also made two appearances on The Late Show with David Letterman. Carmen has also appeared on Comedy Central's Inside Amy Schumer & HBO Canada's Funny As Hell. 

Nathan Macintosh is an award winning comedian from Halifax Nova Scotia, who has already piled up a number of accomplishments including, taping his own “Comedy Now!” special for the Canadian Comedy Network/CTV, performing at the prestigious 2010 Just For Laughs Festival Homegrown Competition where he placed runner-up, and winning a 2009 "Canadian Comedy Award" for best newcomer. He has also been a semi-finalist in the Boston Comedy Festival. Most recently he was named one of the “Top Five Canadian Comedians being Observed” by the Comedy Network and one of five of the New Generation of Canadian Funny Men by Sharp Magazine.

Vincent James is a stand-up comedian, native New Yorker, and a lover. At least two of those things are true. My greatest life achievement is choreographing a dance sequence in my 8th grade performance of “Grease.” It’s usually the first thing he brings up when he meets someone. "I like to run around stage and yell into a microphone, which is the dream life for a guy who can’t sit still. If I’m able to make the audience laugh, even better. I would describe my comedic style as high-energy, physical, relatable and raw." 

Two drink minimum per person.
Alcoholic drinks start at $7; soft drinks and juices start at $5.
Pick up tickets no later than 15 min prior to show or they will be released
Ages 16 and over only, please.

This event takes place at:
Dark Horse Comedy Club 
17 Murray Street - between Church Street and Broadway | <a>See on a Map</a>

Two drink minimum per person. Pick up tickets no later than 15 min prior to show or they will be released

results.description:
IMPORTANT:  This is not a film screening, but rather a discussion with novelist Salman Rushdie (Midnight's Children) in which film clips will be shown.


In Short:

•The event is part of The Modern School of Film's IN:PICTURES series, wherein guests discuss three films that have most-impacted their work/life.

• Time and Location: Saturday, April 9, 8pm at the SVA Theater.

• We will gather at the SVA lobby at 7:45pm. Look for "Oriel" - I'll be wearing a name tag.


• After the event will continue to "The Park" - a beautiful bar/restaurant in Chelsea for drinks. 

• The Park: http://www.yelp.com/biz/the-park-new-york-2
Address:[masked]th Ave
New York, NY 10011 b/t 17th St & 18th St


•Tickets can be purchased via: www.modernschooloffilm.com
$5 off the "general admission" ticket tier with code: MSF

YOUR RSVP DOES NOT GUARANTEE YOUR TICKET.


Details:
The Modern School of Film supports the art of cinema with their critically-acclaimed In:Pictures series, “wherein legendary artists discuss three films that have most inspired their life and their work.” Along with New York City’s The School of Visual Arts, on Saturday, April 9 at 8pm, The Modern School of Film’s founder Robert Milazzo will host celebrated author Salman Rushdie.

"Our lives teach us who we are," writes the novelist, and since films have become an essential part of contemporary life, we can confirm that films themselves teach us much about ourselves. In this installment of In:Pictures, Salman Rushdie will discuss Satyajit Ray’s Pather Panchali, George Lucas’ Star Wars, and Wes Anderson’s The Grand Budapest Hotel.

In:Pictures will include clips of each film, along with an in-depth discourse with Salman Rushdie on how cinema has shaped both his work and the continued legacy of this master of genre, form, and modern storytelling.

Club 412's "Saturday Night Special" Dance Party

"Club 412" has three rooms of music, great sound, beautiful hard wood floors and a cash bar. The "Club" is known for it's friendly staff and patrons. Come out and join us and be welcomed into the "family"!

Our event will kick off at with the  8pm Pre-Party Dance Lesson in your choice of rooms: Hustle, Latin and Ballroom. Then the DJ's take over and "get our groove on" till 1am. It's really fun to roam from room to room to see what everybody's doing and enjoy the different music.

results.description: This is a dance studio in Manhattan that offers country line dancing for the LGBT community! Twice a month they have a big dance night that generally pulls in about 100 people. They start with a two-step lesson at 8p followed by a line-dancing lesson at 8:30. At 9p the floor opens for everyone and the dance party continues until 1a! They are very geared towards new learners! Cost is $15/person, alcohol is sold there as well. We can plan on meeting somewhere for dinner before the dancing as we get closer to the event! They do suggest cowboy boots or something with a hard rubber sole as sneakers can stick and make it harder for you to dance, but I don't know that they're banned outright. I'll contact the studio for more info and let you all know :) For more info, including the rules and etiquette, follow the link! http://www.bigappleranch.com/rules_etiquette.htm

Satsang in Indian philosophy means (1) the company of the "highest truth," (2) the company of a guru, or (3) company with an assembly of persons who listen to, talk about, and assimilate the truth. This typically involves listening to or reading scriptures, reflecting on, discussing and assimilating their meaning, meditating on the source of these words, and bringing their meaning into one’s daily life. Contemporary spiritual teachers in the West frequently come from the East but can come from any part of the world.

 

The idea of satsangam was first spread by ancient Rishis such as Vedavyasa and Valmiki who explained its value in numerous ways.

results.description:
Ethical Brew is proud to present Live In Concert:
The Kennedys
with Special Guests: The Lords of Liechtenstein

100% of the net proceeds of this performance will be donated to "The Bergen County Sanctuary Coalition"

Adults $20 Students $15 in advance, $25 at the door

For More Information & Tickets: www.ethicalbrew.org 

The Kennedys

Pete and Maura Kennedy are a contemporary folk duo who color their original songs with musical and lyrical references that point to the great music of the 1960s; The Beatles, The Byrds, Buddy Holly, and the Everly Brothers figure prominently in their songs, and in their choice of cover material. Based in Greenwich Village, the two celebrated, in 2015, their twentieth year as a married couple and and musical duo. Two decades on the road, both on their own and as members of Nanci Griffith's Blue Moon Orchestra, have led them to many venues, including Carnegie Hall, The Newport and Philadelphia Folk Festivals, and Royal Albert Hall in London. Prior to moving to New York City, they were based in Austin Texas, and Washington DC. In DC, they were Artists-in-Residence at The Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts, and were the recipients of twenty Wammy awards, including "Artists of the Year". In 1993, Pete was awarded a Grammy certificate for his participation as lead guitarist on Nanci Griffith's "Other Voices, Other Rooms". The Kennedy have released fifteen CDs, including three in 2015. 

https://youtu.be/p_JwY7YKJuc


Here's what folks are saying about The Kennedys ...

JIM FARBER IS FLOORED BY THE KENNEDYS...Maura Kennedy's voice rests wistfully on music that makes Burt Bacharach-style somber pop.
Jim Farber - New York Daily News

Byrdsy jangle and boy-girl harmonies...irresistible
Rolling Stone Magazine

The Kennedys are worthy of the title First Couple of American Folk and Americana.
Lee Zimmeraman - No Depression

Just in from one of the best gigs I have seen this year. The Kennedys were superb at The Loft tonight. Wonderful music and a great U2 cover in Wild Honey. Anyone who missed it missed a treat of a gig. Hope they come back again soon.
John O'Regan - Freelance Music Journalist/Broadcaster/Lecturer

For more about The Kennedys: kennedysmusic.com

The Lords of Liechtenstein

The Lords of Liechtenstein is a quirky New York-based folk music duo composed of two brothers -- Dan and Noah Rauchwerk. Their sound has been compared to Simon and Garfunkel and their antics have been compared to The Smothers Brothers, but their unique instrumentation and introspective lyrics put them in a category all their own. With Noah on ukulele/vocals and Dan on acoustic guitar/banjo/vocals, The Lords have gained acclaim for their tight harmonies, innovative songwriting, and exuberant stage show. Mark Miller of Urban H2O says "They are like the Everly Brothers with an attitude!"

The Lords of Liechtenstein have performed all over the East Coast, opening for the likes of such musical legends as Christine Lavin, Joe Crookston, Magpie, and Toby Walker. The Lords have also released three CDs in the last three years, including a concept album on African food crises - "Economics of an Empty Stomach" (2011), a quirky, multi-faceted LP entitled "Siberia" (2012) and their newest CD "Girlz (With A 'Z')" released in 2014.

In addition to their undisputed musical talent, the pair has earned a reputation for their fashion sensibility and are perhaps, solely responsible for the recent resurgence of the argyle sweater vest, spotted at every Lords performance and as well as in trendy circles throughout Brooklyn's "Hipsterland".

https://youtu.be/o4J-Ir6brSE

Here's the buzz on The Lords of Liechtenstein ...


"They are like The Everly Brothers with an attitude."
-Mark Miller, Artistic Director, Urban H2O

"Don't let the argyle sweater vests fool you, these two young men have something to say and sing about."
- Kathy Sands-Boehmer, Everything Sundry Music Blog

"They are to argyle sweater vests what Michael Jackson was to white gloves."
- Kevin Coughlin, MorristownGreen.com


For more about The Lords of Liechtenstein: www.thelordsofliechtenstein.com
results.name: Ethical Brew presents: The Kennedys with The Lords of Liechtenstein

results.description:
Written by Kathy D. Harrison, The Movement is a musical retelling of the Children’s Crusade of 1963, a civil rights event in which thousands of young children and teenagers marched against segregation in Birmingham, Alabama. The musical was originally written for the Diversity Youth Theater’s Untold Stories series. The eight-member cast have performed for the NAACP, WNYC, and the National Black Theatre Festival.

$10 Suggested Donation

Doors open at 7:30.

https://www.facebook.com/events/231963080483822/

results.description:
Ethical Brew is proud to present Live In Concert:
The Kennedys
with Special Guests: The Lords of Liechtenstein

100% of the net proceeds of this performance will be donated The Bergen County Sanctuary Coalition

Adults $20 Students $15 in advance, $25 at the door

For More Information & Tickets: www.ethicalbrew.org

The Kennedys

Pete and Maura Kennedy are a contemporary folk duo who color their original songs with musical and lyrical references that point to the great music of the 1960s; The Beatles, The Byrds, Buddy Holly, and the Everly Brothers figure prominently in their songs, and in their choice of cover material. Based in Greenwich Village, the two celebrated, in 2015, their twentieth year as a married couple and and musical duo. Two decades on the road, both on their own and as members of Nanci Griffith's Blue Moon Orchestra, have led them to many venues, including Carnegie Hall, The Newport and Philadelphia Folk Festivals, and Royal Albert Hall in London. Prior to moving to New York City, they were based in Austin Texas, and Washington DC. In DC, they were Artists-in-Residence at The Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts, and were the recipients of twenty Wammy awards, including "Artists of the Year". In 1993, Pete was awarded a Grammy certificate for his participation as lead guitarist on Nanci Griffith's "Other Voices, Other Rooms". The Kennedy have released fifteen CDs, including three in 2015.

https://youtu.be/p_JwY7YKJuc

Here's what folks are saying about The Kennedys ...

JIM FARBER IS FLOORED BY THE KENNEDYS...Maura Kennedy's voice rests wistfully on music that makes Burt Bacharach-style somber pop.
Jim Farber - New York Daily News

Byrdsy jangle and boy-girl harmonies...irresistible
Rolling Stone Magazine

The Kennedys are worthy of the title First Couple of American Folk and Americana.
Lee Zimmeraman - No Depression

Just in from one of the best gigs I have seen this year. The Kennedys were superb at The Loft tonight. Wonderful music and a great U2 cover in Wild Honey. Anyone who missed it missed a treat of a gig. Hope they come back again soon.
John O'Regan - Freelance Music Journalist/Broadcaster/Lecturer

For more about The Kennedys: kennedysmusic.com

The Lords of Liechtenstein

The Lords of Liechtenstein is a quirky New York-based folk music duo composed of two brothers -- Dan and Noah Rauchwerk. Their sound has been compared to Simon and Garfunkel and their antics have been compared to The Smothers Brothers, but their unique instrumentation and introspective lyrics put them in a category all their own. With Noah on ukulele/vocals and Dan on acoustic guitar/banjo/vocals, The Lords have gained acclaim for their tight harmonies, innovative songwriting, and exuberant stage show. Mark Miller of Urban H2O says "They are like the Everly Brothers with an attitude!"

The Lords of Liechtenstein have performed all over the East Coast, opening for the likes of such musical legends as Christine Lavin, Joe Crookston, Magpie, and Toby Walker. The Lords have also released three CDs in the last three years, including a concept album on African food crises - "Economics of an Empty Stomach" (2011), a quirky, multi-faceted LP entitled "Siberia" (2012) and their newest CD "Girlz (With A 'Z')" released in 2014.

In addition to their undisputed musical talent, the pair has earned a reputation for their fashion sensibility and are perhaps, solely responsible for the recent resurgence of the argyle sweater vest, spotted at every Lords performance and as well as in trendy circles throughout Brooklyn's "Hipsterland".

https://youtu.be/o4J-Ir6brSE

Here's the buzz on The Lords of Liechtenstein ...


"They are like The Everly Brothers with an attitude."
-Mark Miller, Artistic Director, Urban H2O

"Don't let the argyle sweater vests fool you, these two young men have something to say and sing about."
- Kathy Sands-Boehmer, Everything Sundry Music Blog

"They are to argyle sweater vests what Michael Jackson was to white gloves."
- Kevin Coughlin, MorristownGreen.com


For more about The Lords of Liechtenstein: www.thelordsofliechtenstein.com
results.name: Ethical Brew presents: The Kennedys with The Lords of Liechtenstein

results.description:
The "End of The Line" Comedy Show is the place to be every second Saturday of the month in Astoria!

End of The Line is back on Saturday, April 9th! We've got an awesome lineup of some of NYC's best comedians. Featuring standup from:

Patrick Holbert
Charlie Nadler (Laughing Devil Comedy Festival)
Jeff Simmermon (The Moth Radio Hour)
Caitlin Peluffo (Women In Comedy Festival)
Jack Slattery ("So There I Was..." Storytelling Show)
Michelle Slonim (comedycentral.com)
Rae Sanni ("LoudMouth!" Comedy Show)

*Lineup subject to change

Come out at 9, grab a drink and a seat, and we'll start the show right at 9:30pm. You can't beat a show of this quality for just 6 bucks in advance or $8 day of show! This show has been a great hang before and after as well, so we hope to see you out next Saturday night.

results.description:
You just got a bill from your Dr that isn't covered by insurance, Con-Ed somehow didn't get your payment last month, Bank of America is tacking on transaction fees when no transactions were made. Don't just sit there and take it.. There are 6 words that get results!

LET ME SPEAK TO YOUR MANAGER!!

Back by popular demand the "Let Me Speak To Your Manager" show is bringing you the best up and coming comics in NYC, all of whom have been featured on Comedy Central, MTV, Letterman, Fallon, Conan, etc..!

It all goes down at Stone Creek Bar and Grill in the back room.

Come down, enjoy some of the drinks from the fully stocked bar or some food off the awesome menu!

Seating is limited and by reservation only.  To Reserve a seat, RSVP through Eventbrite w. your best email and show your confirmation at the door. 

Eventbrite Link: http://bit.ly/1MOuHDT

Seating in the backroom starts at 930 and the show starts shortly after. 
Come early and hang out in the front room of the bar!

The show is free and has a 1 item minimum.

Come out and celebrate the weekend with some laughs!

DESI SATURDAYS

Presents

BOLLYWOOD BEATS

At New York City’s Mega Nightclub & Lounge
L E X I C O N
226 East 54th Street. NYC 

Special Guest : Featuring Delhi's Finest Dj Amit
Lexicon Resident : Dj Harsh
Dhol Percussions By : RAVI BINDRA

Dress Code: Fashion Forward & Chic
Strictly No T-shirts, No Boots, No sneakers. 
21 & Over - Proper ID Required For Admission

For RSVP : www.DesiSaturdays.com
For VIP Table Reservations : 908 - 425 - 1603

Desi Saturdays is one high society DesiParty. Wow factor everywhere. Beautiful people, beautiful venue, beautiful ambiance, and did we mention beautiful people? High energy, amazing music and a packed house are just some of the traits of what you would expect at this weekly desiparty.

This event is the talk of the town amongst young socialites. It's so exclusive it only takes place on Saturday Nights, and don't even try to dress down, because it is almost impossible to get in, but more importantly you would feel so out of place. So don your best, and you may just be lucky enough to party out on Saturdays Nights at Lexicon!!

Join us this weekend for our fun Saturday evening @ Hudson Terrace. This is a very popular party with an amazing crowd.

We will be on the first floor of the venue near the coat check area. 

Feel free to invite your family, friends and colleagues to join us at Hudson Terrace.

Gents reduced all night long- $20. Ladies free before midnight. Doorman's discretion after. (Mention Rory's List to the door person)

There will be a 1 hour open bar from 10- 11pm.

Feel free to come solo. You are guaranteed to meet a fun and diverse group of people.

This event normally attracts people in their 20's, 30's and 40's.

Please get there early to avoid the long lines.

Contact us if you have further questions.

Cheers,

Meetup Organizer,

Rory

BUY TICKETS HERE

Due to overwhelming demand, we are throwing another Soca/Latin/Caribbean party! We’re holding this one down at Stage 48, which is a venue that we know very well, to be incredible for our events, after numerous big parties there!

Your 3 DJ’s Will be Playing:
DJ 1 (Green): Salsa, Merengue, Bachata, Reggaeton
DJ 2 (Red): Top 40/Dance/Hip Hop
DJ 3 (Blue): Soca, Reggae, Dancehall

What the night includes:
Quiet Events Headphones
Glow in the Dark Gear
3 Live DJs battling for your attention

Special Notes:
This party is going on rain or shine.
Age Restriction: 21+

HOW IT WORKS
***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process*** When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJ with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ as you. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off and talk to that girl or guy. There’s no loud music that you have to talk over. Plus, there’s no ringing in your ears when you leave. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones as there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card if headphones don’t come back.

results.description:
This darkly witty anthology lacks the polished narratives that graced Cujo and Carrie but still manages to offer plenty of mordant delights for the Stephen King aficionado. The film's disjointed framing device of a homeless cat weaving its way through the three stories (reportedly altered for the worse by post-production tampering) doesn't hold things together the way it should but the individual tales have plenty to offer in the way of chills and sly humor: "Quitters, Inc." mixes some wry commentary on the self-help movement into its tale of a mysterious treatment center, "The Ledge" overcomes its pro-forma 'life-and-death bet' scenario with witty dialogue and colorful characterizations and the final untitled tale has plenty of fun playing with the audience's ideas about superstitions. The appeal of Cat's Eye is further enhanced by inspired acting: Drew Barrymore makes for a plucky, likable young heroine in the finale and Robert Hays and Kenneth McMillan infuse their roles in "The Ledge" with a palpable sense of emotional desperation that gives the tale added depth. However, the big scene-stealers in the acting department are James Woods and Alan King, whose solid comic timing and willingness to act on the tale's darker conceits make "Quitters, Inc." a blackly comedic winner. Director Lewis Teague adds plenty of visual wit to the tales (avid Stephen King fans should look for all the film's references to his other works) and keeps things rolling at a speedy, suspenseful clip that is in keeping with the overall playful tone of the stories. In the end, some viewers might be thrown off by the odd framing device and the accent on humor in Cat's Eye but horror fans who can overlook these quirks will be rewarded with an amusing blend of chills and laughs.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rqzTazrYx5M

results.description:
Distance: 15 miles.

Walk from Highlands, NJ into Sandy Hook and to Fort Hancock Historic District. Beautiful vistas of Highlands, NJ; Sea Bright, NJ; and Raritan Bay. Pass a 19th century life-saving station. View buildings in Fort Hancock from another era. See what a 19th century Army post looked like. No drop out points. Walk is linear; in and out.

Important: bring water and lunch. There is no place to buy lunch.

Take 8:00 a.m. Academy bus, Route 36 to Highlands, NJ, from Port Authority Bus Terminal, arrive Highlands, NJ at 9:23 a.m.

Meet at commuter statue no latter then 7:45 a.m. Fare: round trip: $34.00/$17:00 seniors 62 and over.  Rain cancels.

The r/t fare may be a little high, but the beauty of the scenery is worth it.

Leader: Bill Wrublewski [masked]


Contact hike leader directly if you have questions about the hike.

Free for Shorewalkers members who have paid the $20 annual membership fee, $3 for non-members. Non-members please pay the hike leader at the beginning of the hike or visit www.shorewalkers.org to join.
results.name: Sandy Hook and Fort Hancock

results.description:
Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on 173 West 108th street , The entrance gate is located on west 108th street and Manhattan ave.

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the field.

Paul.

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8, no subs. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP opens on Friday at 8:30am and closes at 9pm on Saturday evening.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you Un RSVP at late notice (after RSVP closes at 9pm Saturday) you will be benched from this group for the next two weeks.

- If you turn up late and the game has already started with 16 players, then you won't play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.

results.description:
RSVP required


What equipment is required?

A mask, snorkel, fins and a weight belt suitable for SCUBA* and dive boots. A wetsuit is optional and recommended. We have special pricing for our students. Let us know when you would like to come in to be fitted for your student equipment package. Most important is that you will get the "Right Gear, the Right Fit at the Right Price" *Note: Snorkeling equipment is not always suitable for SCUBA activities.

Please arrive on time, late arrivals are subject to rescheduling and fees.

If you have any questions please email or call the shop

New Students, If this is your first pool session, you must:
1. Complete the required academics before the pool session;

Online Students must complete Chapters 1 -6CD Rom students must complete Sections 1-5

2. Bring a bathing suit and a towel. There are lockers in the changing room so bring a lock if you like.

3. Drink plenty of water before class

4. Don't forget to print out and bring your skills checklist.

5. Print out a copy of the Hand Signals to review and bring with you.

results.description:
Time for another Palisades trail run! This run will start at the bus station, go over the bridge, up the Palisades Long Path and back.

I’ll be running at a 10-11 minute/mile pace and aiming for the Women's Federation Monument (23 miles round-trip from the bus station). Every pace and distance is welcome, but be prepared to run on your own if you can't find someone who matches yours. Other notable turn-around points include the State Line Cafe (25 miles round-trip), the Park Headquarters (19 miles round-trip), Alpine Lookout (16 miles round-trip), Greenbrook Sanctuary (13 miles round-trip), and the Rockefeller Lookout (10 miles round-trip).

Note that if you turn around before the Park Headquarters, you might be looking at up to 13 miles between water sources. Please make sure you plan your hydration accordingly!

If you would like to meet up with us on the New Jersey side, find us at the trail start just over the pedestrian bridge just before 9:00 am. Please indicate this in your RSVP. 

Here’s a map of the trail. The Long Path is marked “A” on the map and is marked with aqua blazes. Please familiarize yourself with the trail map before coming to the run.

Here's a list of landmarks along with their distance from the start on the NJ side.


I’ve also made a Google Map that shows the trail along with several points of interest, including restrooms and places to get water. This map is approximate - do not rely on it for navigation!

As always, please view the group's About page and make sure you understand your responsibilities as an event participant.

results.name: Palisades Long Path Trail Run

results.description:
This is PART 2 of an epic 3 part Urban hiking series! 

Cross all 17 bridges of Manhattan!  

2016 URBAN HIKING SERIES- Triple Crown Part 2 April 9th, 2016 

This hike is Part 2 of the three part URBAN HIKING SERIES Triple Crown. You can participate in as many as you like. For those hardy souls who finish all three, there will be a special reward.

URBAN HIKING SERIES 17 bridge hike Meet time:8:45A. M.. 

Start time: 9:00A.M. promptly 

Location:179th Street and Fort Washington Ave. adjacent to the Port Authority 

You can be normal any day, choose today to be epic... 

The URBAN HIKING SERIES brings back a favorite with the 17 bridge walk in which we will cross every bridge that accesses the island of Manhattan in a 30-32 mile trek that will also take us through parts of The Bronx, Queens and Brooklyn. Along the way, we will cross the mighty( the George Washington Bridge) and the mundane ( the 103 rd Street Foot Bridge) , through neighborhoods which many of us have never been to or even know exist. We will start on the NYC side of the GW(1) and cross back and forth before heading north up the west side along the Hudson River before crossing the Henry Hudson Bridge(2) and entering the Fieldston section of The Bronx. We will then criss cross the between the various neighborhoods in The Bronx and Manhattan as we make our way south across the remaining Harlem River Bridges(3-11). At the Triboro Bridge(12), we will head down into Randall's Island/Ward's Island. Since this is close to Riker's Island prison, I will try to time our arrival to coincide with visiting hours for those of you with friends and family incarcerated there. Just joking.

We will then cross the 103rd Street Foot Bridge(13) back into Manhattan and then proceed along the East River until the 59th Street Bridge.(14). After crossing into Queens, we will make our way across the Pulaski Bridge-doesn't count- into Brooklyn until we reach the Williamsburg Bridge(15) which will take us back into Manhattan. We will continue downtown until we reach the Manhattan Bridge(16) which we will take back to Brooklyn and then the Brooklyn Bridge (17) back into Manhattan. The estimated time of the hike is about 10-11 hours. There will be 2-3 minute water breaks about every hour and a lunch break at The Highbridge point in Upper Manhattan. We will arrange further breaks as needed as we continue along the second half of the hike. There are multiple bailouts along the way as the subway is never more than 5-7 blocks away.When we ran this in December, we had 40 enthusiastic participants who completed various portions of the route with a significant number finishing. Come with your legs, heart, and mental commitment you will be rewarded with a very fulfilling experience and the energy from the group will enable you to cover distances you didn't think were possible.look forward to seeing you all.
results.how_to_find_us: Stephen Miller
results.name: 2016 URBAN HIKING SERIES Triple Crown Part 2-Cross all 17 Bridges of Manhattan!

results.description:
Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on 173 West 108th street.
The entrance gate is located on west 108th street and Manhattan ave. Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Flag Football Game at Cunningham Park (196th St and Union Turnpike) in Queens. Come out and join us!

We have cones and flags so all you need is cleats if that is what you prefer. GAMES WILL ALWAYS BE PLAYED REGARDLESS OF THE WEATHER CONDITIONS i.e. rain, snow, cold, mud, ice, storm, hurricane, etc...we never cancel games due to weather...games are fun and competitive, all skill levels are welcome, please contact me if you have any questions.

NOTE: PLEASE RSVP "YES" ONLY IF YOU ARE GOING TO SHOW UP TO THE GAME.  YOU CAN CHANGE YOUR RSVP IF SOMETHING COMES UP (OR IF YOU DON'T WANT TO PLAY IF IT'S TOO COLD/IT'S RAINING/IT'S SNOWING) AND YOU CAN'T MAKE IT.  NO-SHOWS WILL BE REMOVE FROM THE GROUP.  IT IS IMPORTANT TO HAVE AN ACCURATE HEAD COUNT SO WE KNOW HOW MANY PEOPLE ARE REALLY COMING.

ere are some of the new changes we have made and a reminder of some of the guidelines we already have:

1) You can not add  guests to your RSVP.  Anyone is free to come and play IF AND ONLY IF you have a profile in meetup and have joined our group.  It's 100% FREE to join and it only takes about 2 minutes to sign up and RSVP.  There are also FREE mobile apps for iPhones and Android phones so you can RSVP easily on the go.  If any of your friends has been playing and wants to continue to play, ask them to go to http://www.meetup.com/Cunningham-Park-Football/ and sign up and RSVP individually.  YOU CAN NOT PLAY if you're not signed up and RSVPd.

2) The first 20 people that RSVP for the game, will play a 9-on-9 game with 1 sub.  Everyone on the waiting list will pick players and play against the winner of the game.  Games will be to 2 scores.  If a team gets 2 scores, with the score 2-1, the other team gets one (1) more possession to try to score and tie the game.  If the game is tied again, the game is now to 3 points and the same rule applies, once one of the teams gets score #3, the other team gets just one (1) more possession to try to tie the game.  If 20 or less players show up to the game, game can be played to whatever score everyone agrees to.

3) If you're one of the first 20 to RSVP, but you're late, the next person on the waiting list that's present on the field will take your place and play in the first game.

4) On a safety, ball stays at the goal line and the next down will be played.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and a safety occurs, the ball stays at the goal line and the 3rd down will be played.

5) On an OBVIOUS "Defensive Pass interference", the ball will stay at the line of scrimmage but you reset your plays and start at 1st down again.  For example: If a 3rd down play is ran and a DPI occurs, the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and a 1st down will be played, then 2nd, then 3rd...etc.

6) On an OBVIOUS "Offensive Pass interference", the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and the offensive time will lose a down.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and an OPI occurs, the offensive team will now be on a 4th down situation from the line of scrimmage.

7) As you might have noticed we have had very few injuries (knock on wood) throughout the years.  This is why we wanted to remind you of the following:

-Stiff arming, flag guarding and hand slapping are NOT ALLOWED.

-Blocks from the back are NOT allowed ad they're obviously dangerous and can cause injuries.

-VERY IMPORTANT: If you are the offensive player and have the ball in your hands, you MUST avoid contact and CAN NOT under any circumstances lower your shoulders and try to initiate contact with an defensive player.  This is flag football, if you're looking for a different type of game there are plenty of other places and leagues to play flag or full-contact football.

8) Donations:  I pay the monthly fee for hosting these meetups and never charge anyone.  All we asked for you is to drop at least $1 in the container we have set up for this, all the money is used for equipment, flags, cones, etc.  You can click on "Group Tools > Money" and see where all the money is going.  If we buy anything with that money we record the transaction and upload a picture of the receipt of whatever equipment we bought.  Next thing we want to get are end zone weighted pylons and we want to buy orange rope so we can mark the field faster and more accurately to avoid any arguments about where the first down is or what not.

IMPORTANT: WE ARE ALL ADULTS AND OBVIOUSLY CAN'T FORCE ANYONE TO DO ANYTHING.  WE NEED EVERYONE'S COOPERATION TO FOLLOW THESE SIMPLE GUIDELINES TO KEEP THE GAME FUN AND COMPETITIVE.  IF FOR ANY REASON YOU DISAGREE OR BELIEVE THAT THESE GUIDELINES DO NOT FIT YOUR STYLE OF PLAY OR WHAT YOU'RE LOOKING FOR ON A PICK-UP GAME, YOU'RE WELCOME TO PLAY WITH A DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUP OR IN ANY OTHER PICK-UP GAME...NO HARD FEELINGS.

If you have any suggestions, questions or concerns, please feel free to reach me at[masked] or [masked]

Regards,

Carlos

Welcome to Walk MS: Westchester 2016! We are excited to have you join us for this amazing event. Walk MS helps us team up with friends, loved ones and co-workers to change the world for everyone affected by MS. Together, we become a powerful force. And with every step we take, every dollar we raise…we’re that much closer. Together, we will end MS forever.

We are proud that Walk MS NY raises over $2 million every year, and thank you for being a part of that achievement! Your fundraising supports programs and services that help people affected by MS live their best lives.

Ending multiple sclerosis for good will take all of us. It’s why Walk MS matters so much. And it’s why you matter so much.

News & FAQs

Routes & Maps

Walk MS is a charity walk series that takes place in over 550 locations with more than 330,000 people participating annually. Walk MS brings together the passion and determination of anyone who wants to raise funds and give hope to more than 2.3 million people living with MS worldwide. We’ve been walking since 1988 and to date have raised more than $920 million to drive groundbreaking research, provide life-changing programs and guarantee a supportive community for those who need it most. When you participate in Walk MS, you help ensure no one ever has to be diagnosed again. Together, we become a powerful force. Together, we will end MS forever.

results.description:
I was asked by some to have another run, so I'm doing the original run that was planned as the trail sections were snowed over last time. 

While we won't be running the same route from last time, here are the happy folks from the previous run.

The run is about a 9.6 mile route through eastern Queens from Bayside LIRR station to New World Mall food court in Flushing - CASH ONLY (http://www.yelp.com/biz/new-world-mall-food-court-flushing). The food court opens at 10:30AM, so I am thinking at 9:17AM to coincide with the train arrival time (that is the 8:48AM LIRR train that departs Penn Station).

Here's the route that takes us through some of the Queens sections of the Queens-Brooklyn Greenway (a long continuous greenway from Coney Island to Fort Totten):
http://www.mapmyrun.com/routes/view/965449505

Turn by turn directions here:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-4Bf5XntSx_0y-QwgH_0U0qYZXV1vYDisLw_RuX91lw/edit


Note about this route for history buffs:
A section of the route is through Vanderbilt Motor Parkway which was the first 'highway' built for automobile traffic only. The Queens section has now been turned into a bike/run path.
http://www.nycgovparks.org/parks/cunningham-park/highlights/12916

The route also takes us right next to the supposed oldest tree in NYC, the Queens Giant.
http://www.nytimes.com/2009/10/08/nyregion/08tree.html?_r=0

Note about getting to the start area:
Easiest way to get to Bayside LIRR station from Manhattan is obviously taking the LIRR from Penn Station (or Woodside station if you are near there). It is on the Port Washington line (red), and tickets cost $4.25 from Penn Station with a City Ticket on weekends which you must buy at a kiosk prior to getting on the train on the day of travel. Buying any ticket on the train will set you back quite a bit… like $15. 

You can also take Q13 from Flushing. Q13 stops at Bayside LIRR station on Bell Blvd. The Q13 bus stop in Flushing is here.
https://www.google.com/maps/@40.7610093,-73.8272895,3a,75y,223.52h,85.78t/data=!3m6!1e1!3m4!1ssT2dvQLZgN639tTL0tQq4Q!2e0!7i13312!8i6656


The bus schedule says there is a 8:55AM bus that departs Flushing that gets to Bayside LIRR at 9:17AM... but buses aren't as reliable. This bus comes every 15 minutes.

We will meet at the parking lot of Chase Bank just south of the Bayside Station (the parking lot is in the back – you should be able to see Kelly’s taxi building and a post office from the parking lot).
https://www.google.com/maps/place/Chase+Bank/@40.7628788,-73.7715469,19.54z/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x0000000000000000:0x71ec2046c0323a16

Note about time:
The train is rather prompt barring any major issues. There are no suitable places nearby where we can gather inside. If you are early and want some coffee or treats, Martha's Country Bakery right on Bell Blvd is a good option.

Note about pace:
I was thinking somewhere around 8:30 to 9:00 pace. Please note that if you expect to be significantly faster or slower than this pace, you may have to fend for yourself.

Final note:
You can't really run in downtown Flushing. Too many people and cars, so be mindful there.

results.description:
Did you know that 1 out of 4 more pets would have survived if only ONE pet first aid technique was applied prior to receiving emergency care?


Learn how to handle any emergency with your pet calmly and confidently, from the longest teaching most experienced instructor in the tri-state area, in conjunction with Westchester At Home Veterinary Care and Meetup member Dr. Shannon James! 


From Bleeding to Choking to Poisoning - even insect bites, seizures, and CPR and soooo much more! Class is for pet owners as well as pet professionals including vettechs, groomers, trainers, pet sitters, volunteers & rescuers, dog walkers - really anyone who lays their hands on a pet in the course of a day!


Class is $85pp and all graduating students receive a 2yr certificate, emergency muzzle, full manual, and more! For pet pros, you can also be emailed an official logo that you may use on your website and any promotional materials, showing off that you are trained in Pet CPR & First Aid!


Class is a combination of lecture and lots of hand on skill practice. Don't put it off - I guarantee this class will make a difference in you and your pets lives - and is fun too, and essential if you are a pet professional!!!


Special thanks to the Westchester Brassmen for helping make this event possible. Partial proceeds will be donated to the scholarship fund. http://www.westchesterbrassmen.com/aboutus/scholarship-program
results.name: Learn Pet First Aid & CPR for Pet Professionals & Owners!

results.description:
This run starts at the "Wild Duck Pond" area of the Saddle River County Park in Ridgewood. We will start at the beginning of the mile markers which is near the exit, not near the entrance. There's parking close to the beginning of the path. If you cannot park in the lot nearest the beginning of the path, you'll need to reenter the park and park in the next closest lot. The driving area of the park is U-shaped so to get to the parking lot closest to the start of the run, you essentially drive around the "U" and approach the exit to the last lot on the right (by the dog park).


We will start at the "Wild Duck Pond Area" and will turn around at the 2 mile marker. If you'd like to run more or less, you are certainly welcome to do so as the mile markers make it simple to track your distance. If you wish to run at a slower pace, I am more than happy to run with you at your preferred pace. Nobody gets left in the dust. This is a fun run, not a competition.

If you RSVP "Yes", please do your best to be on time. With the cold weather, we will get rolling on time so that our runners don't get too cold waiting for others to show. 

If you have questions, comments, or doubts, feel free to email me.

results.description:
Meet Leader Pat Horsch, (cell[masked] morning of hike only)
at 9:30 AM Delaware Water Gap Dunnfield Creek/A.T. Parking Lot, see directions. Due to reduced parking available, recommend carpooling and/or arriving at least 15 minutes early in case you need to park in an alternate lot and walk over to the meeting place. Contact leader for more info. 

This hike is for the more adventurous hikers, not for beginners.  I will be limiting the group size, so please be courteous to others and do not RSVP unless you are serious about attending this hike.  We will start on a short segment on the AT, then turn off and hike along an old woods road that is seldom hiked for approx. 2 miles. Some areas are well defined and some not so much. There will be areas that are fairly overgrown, dress accordingly.  Terrain is somewhat rugged but moderate elevation changes. Explore old ruins and come out on Old Mine Road, where we will follow the road to the Farview Trail and return to the cars on marked trails. 7 miles total, 4 to 5 hours. Bring lunch, snacks, and plenty of water. Boots required, poles recommended. Steady rain cancels. 

Directions:
Take I-80 West towards PA. After Exit 4, watch for the brown sign on I-80 for "Dunnfield Creek and Appalachian Trail Parking 1 Mile". Exit at the Delaware Water Gap Info sign at mile marker 1 (shortly before Exit 1). We will meet at the second lot on the right for Dunnfield Creek / AT Parking, but you can park in the first lot and walk over if you wish.  The 2nd lot fills up sooner. If you miss the exit, take Exit 1, make a left under I-80, go past the info center and go back under the interstate towards I-80W. Turn left toward I-80W but exit at the parking lot on your right.  Additional parking is available in the info center on I-80 East and walk under I-80 to the meeting spot.
results.name: HIKE - Delaware Water Gap Nat'l Rec Area NJ

results.description:
Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on 173 West 108th street , The entrance gate is located on west 108th street and Manhattan ave.

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the field.

Paul.

results.description:
Join me on one of my favorite hikes in the Catskills

BRING SPIKES AND SNOWSHOES...

Catskill 3500 Series - Panther Mountain via Giant Ledge

Catskill 3500 Club

This peak must be climbed twice (at least once in winter) for membership in the Catskill 3500 Club. 


Total Mileage: 6.6 miles
Total Elevation Gain: 2000 feet
Estimated Hike Time:[masked] hours
Special Gear / Requirements Food/water as much as you feel is appropriate, first aid, insulating and waterproofing layers, trail conference map #142, camera

Meetup Times and Locations:
 March 5, Saturday, hike starts at noon.

_______________________________________________

Getting there: Take the New York State Thruway to exit 19: Kingston.  Keep right after the toll for Route 28 west.  Follow Route 28 almost 31 miles to Big Indian and turn left on County Road 47.  Take County Road 47 just over 7 miles and park on the right at the hairpin turn.

Route description: 6.6 miles distance, 2000 feet of total elevation gain.  We go up the yellow trail a short way to a junction at the ridge line.  Turn left and take the blue trail over Giant Ledge (big views!) and then slightly down before the final climb to Panther.  Back the way we came.

Panther is one of the four 3500'+ Catskill mountains that must be climbed twice (once in winter) to gain entrance to the Catskill 3500 Club.

The DEC Limits group sizes in the Slide Mountain Wilderness to 20.

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back.

See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

-----------------------------------------------------------

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.

Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

results.description:
Spring is finally here, and it's time to go play outside while waking up those muscles that have been dormant all winter.

Animus Primus™ is Latin for "primal animal" and is a series of simple yet powerful animal movements that activate the entire body. 

Basic body weight exercises - like rolling, rocking, and crawling - develop whole body strength and coordination. Dynamic animal movements like the leopard crawl and monkey gallop integrate the body, allowing you to move with more freedom, precision, and power.

The importance of being present and moving mindfully is emphasized over pushing hard and testing your boundaries. This allows the students to “own” the movements. "Owning the movement" is deeply satisfying, expands awareness, increases mobility, and prevents injuries.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cEwvo5VoAmw


Class Breakdown:

• Primal Activation (20 Minutes)- Rolling, Rocking, Basic Crawling, Marching, 

• Primal Movements (20 Minutes) - Advanced Crawling, Animal Movements, Get Up Variations, Jumping, Precision Jumps, Hanging, Carries, Deep Squats, Balance Exercises

• Primal Games (10 - 15 minutes) - using the skills we've developed in a more dynamic, creative, and chaotic environment.

• Cool Down (5 - Minutes) - Qigong and gentle breathing exercises.

Who's this for?

• anyone that has a "movement practice". In other words, don't come expecting to be lead every step of the way, but rather to be encourage to explore and play with the ideas/movements that are being offered. 

• anyone that wants to learn new ways of moving from someone who's been studying and practicing movement for 30 years.


• anyone that isn't afraid to get a little dirty/muddy/grassy.

• anyone that realizes that there is a lot more to health and fitness than working out as hard as you can. 


We'll be in this area of the park, if you're running late come find us either on the northern most part of the great lawn or near the Arthur Ross Pinetum.

Disclaimer: Participation in activities is strictly voluntary and group members assume all risks in connection with activities; per Meetup.com's Terms of Service Agreements, organizers and event leaders are released from any and all forms of liability related to events. Your RSVP (yes) means you agree to assume all liability.  You also agree to sign a waiver and, if you are under 18, you have an adult who can sign for you and will stay through the duration of the class.
results.how_to_find_us: Go to the North East Corner of 81st street, walk slightly north of the intersection and there is an entrance into the park. Walk 50 feet and you'll be in front of the benches outside of the "Diana Ross" playground.

results.description:
LEADER: Peter Reiner ([masked] or[masked]) 

RATING: B 5.5 B

Meet 10 AM at the parking area off Rt. 6 about 1 mile past the Long Mountain traffic circle. Travel on the Long Path, Anthony Wayne, 1779 and PG trails around Summer Hill. Severe inclement weather cancels. TC Northern Harriman map 119.

*   *   *   *   *   *

Our full hike schedule can be viewed on our website at hudsonhikers.org, and some hikes are also posted on our Facebook page.

After attending two hikes/events, please consider joining the North Jersey Ramapo Chapter of the Adirondack Mountain Club to support our outdoor recreation and conservation activities.  Membership comes with a variety of benefits including a 10% discount at Ramsey Outdoor; our annual holiday party and social; special events such as our traditional day-outing to the Mohonk Mountain House; a subscription to ADK’s bi-monthly magazine, Adirondac; and the opportunity to contribute to the preservation and extension of hiking lands and viewsheds in our region.

New hikers are strongly encouraged to select hikes appropriate to their capabilities. North Jersey Ramapo Chapter hikes are rated for pace (A, B or C), mileage, and terrain (A, B or C), with "C" designating easier hikes and "A" more challenging ones. We recommend that new hikers should first try a "C" or short "B" hike before undertaking a more difficult one; otherwise, you may not fully enjoy the hiking experience. If you have any doubts, please contact the hike leader in advance. 

Pace Ratings: 
     A = Fast - 2.5 mph or faster 
     B = Moderate - about 2 mph 
     C = Easy - 1.5 mph or less 

Distance: Noted in miles 

Terrain Ratings:
     A = Strenuous, long/steep climbs and descents, 
             possible rock scrambling
     B = Moderate climbs and descents
     C = Generally flat with little elevation change 

For example, a hike rated “B 7 A” is a moderately paced hike of approximately 7 miles with steep climbs and/or descents and possible rock scrambling. 

If you join us for a hike, please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness, including ensuring that the hike is appropriate for your level of fitness, that you wear the proper clothing, and bring the proper gear, food and water (see the ADK's recommended Hiking Essentials and guidelines, below).

Leaders have the right, responsibility and sole discretion to refuse any hiker he/she deems to be not properly attired, prepared, or otherwise fit to safely complete the hike. 

HIKERS' GUIDELINES:

  Risks:  As with all physical activities, hiking involves hazards. Persons participate at their own risk and will be asked to sign a statement acknowledging that fact before starting the hike. Prior to the hike please advise the leader of any medical condition or physical impairment that could affect you during the hike.

  Footwear and Clothing:  Wear clothing suited to the weather and carry extra garments for unexpected weather conditions. Dress in thin layers so that you can adjust the number of layers as required to maintain comfort. In winter carry a wool cap and wool or polypropylene gloves or mitts and a windproof shell. Be prepared for rain. Bring a rain jacket and rain pants, preferably of the type that permits venting body moisture. Wear comfortable, sturdy boots/shoes.  Do not wear cotton garments in winter.

  Drink and Food:  Adequate hydration is important year round. Drink frequently during the hike. Carry food to enjoy during the midday lunch stop.

  Other responsibilities:  Hikers with children under 16 and new hikers are required to contact the hike leader in advance to determine if the hike is suitable for them.  Minors under 16 are welcome on day hikes when accompanied by a parent or guardian.  No person under 18 shall participate in overnight outings unless accompanied by a parent or adult sponsor over 21.  The hike leader may refuse to allow a person to hike who is judged to be poorly equipped or unable to do the published hike.  Participants should get to the hike at least 10 minutes prior to the starting time.

  Maps:  The TC number indicates a NY-NJ Trail Conference map for the area of the hike. For example: TC-118 refers to the Southern Harriman Park map.

  Abbreviations:  NCA-No Calls After . . . , Pref.- Leader’s contact preference.

  Expense Sharing:  When car-pooling, passengers are expected to offer the driver funds sufficient to cover the cost of fuel, tolls and parking fees. A $3.00 minimum per person is recommended. Most hike trailhead meeting locations can be found on NY-NJ Trail Conference maps.

  Dog-Friendly Hikes:  Pets are not permitted on hikes unless the hike description clearly states that it is "dog friendly."  If it is, all hikers with dogs must abide by park leash regulations.

NO SHOW/LATE CANCELLATION POLICY:
Please be considerate of event hosts/organizers and others who may want to attend an event by not being a "NO SHOW" (failing to show up when you've RSVP'd "yes") or a "LATE CANCEL" (changing RSVP to a "no" within 24 hours of an event).  If you have a history of No Shows and/or Late Cancels, we may have to bump you to the waiting list for meetups with limited space, in favor of those with a positive attendance history.
results.name: Summer Hill Loop

results.description:
This loop hike descends the Palisades cliffs, follows a challenging, rocky path along the Hudson River, passes a scenic waterfall, and climbs to reach a panoramic viewpoint over the river.

Details

When: When: Sunday - April 3, 2016 Time: 10am-3pm (5 hours)

Difficulty: Strenuous

Length: 4.5 miles

Route Type: Circuit

Dogs: Allowed on leash

Features: Views, Waterfall, Historic feature, Cliffs

Weather: 45 degrees – This event is automatically cancelled if it rains RESCHEDULE DATE: SUN - APRIL 10, 2016

Location:

Park: Palisades Interstate Park -- NJ Section

Region: Palisades Region

County: Bergen

State: NJ/NY

Driving Directions

Take the Palisades Interstate Park north from the George Washington Bridge. Continue for 1.7 miles beyond Exit 2, and turn right at a sign for the State Line Lookout. Follow the access road for about half a mile until it ends at a large parking lot near the lookout. (If you are coming from the north on the Parkway, bear left just beyond Exit 3 and follow the signs for the lookout).

Click here for map: http://www.njpalisades.org/pdfs/brochureColor.pdf

Description

This hike explores the northern end of the New Jersey Section of the Palisades Interstate Park. It is, perhaps, the most rewarding loop hike in the park, as it incorporates a number of scenic features and, for nearly the entire distance; you are far away from the noise of the Parkway.

We’re going to meet up at the State Line Cafe which is not far from the parking lot. Then we walk towards women’s Federation Monument before we start our decent down to the river. After our decent down, we’re going to go through some big boulders along the river for some awesome Rock Scrambling. We will take a rest and have some snack midpoint of the scramble then head towards the water fall. After spending some time at this interesting and beautiful spot, follow the white-blazed Shore Trail as it turns left, away from the river, and climbs on wooden steps and switchbacks. It parallels the stream leading to the waterfall for a short distance and soon ends at a junction with the aqua-blazed Long Path. Turn left onto the Long Path, which you will follow all the way back to the State Line Lookout.

The Long Path crosses the stream on two wooden bridges. A short distance ahead, it turns sharply right and begins a steep climb on stone steps. At the top of the climb is High Gutter Point, a panoramic viewpoint up and down the river. To the north, you can see the Tappan Zee Bridge and Hook Mountain, the northernmost point on the Palisades along the Hudson. We’ll take another break here before heading back to the parking lot.

What to wear: You don't need to buy a new wardrobe before you hit the trail, but you'll need a few basics to stay safe and comfortable. While you don't need the most expensive gear, avoid cotton: it's a poor insulator when wet, making you feel colder and increasing your risk of hypothermia. Look for synthetic or wool materials instead.

1. Base layer - this usually means a synthetic t-shirt and shorts.

2. Warm, insulating layer – fleece jacket or wool sweater

Socks: Hiking-specific socks offer more cushioning and breathability than cotton tube socks and protect them from blisters (particularly important on long hikes). 4. Back Pack - basic bag needs to be big enough to carry your food, water, extra clothes

5. Gloves – You can get gardening gloves from home depot

What to bring:

1. At least 2L of water

2. Snack and Lunch

3. Hand sanitizer 4. Sunscreen and sunglasses

5. First aid kit

6. Headlamp – optional but I carry mine all the time

7. Friendly and a can do attitude! – This one is must important on Kelly’s list LOL!

What you may want: Trekking poles, particularly if you have joint problems, camera and binoculars for recording memories and viewing wildlife and water-proof cases for carrying them.

***Participation in activities is strictly voluntary and group members assume all risk in connection with activities; per meetup.com’s Terms of Service Agreements, The organizer/hike leaders are released from any and all forms of liability related to this event.***

Please contact me at Kelly Kate - [masked] for any questions, suggestions, comments, and concerns. TEXT ONLY PLEASE! :) THANK YOU!

P Go Green! Please consider the environment before printing this.

results.description:
Please join us for today's service led by special guest speaker, Dr. Sue Kenney. Dr. Kenney will address the difficult decision that some parents must make to leave their children behind in their country of origin, and the equally untenable flip side of this issue:  undocumented parents who face deportation, and must decide whether to leave their American citizen children behind in the U.S.  She will also discuss the 3.6 million unauthorized parents who are potentially eligible for DAPA (Deferred Action for Parental Accountability), the Obama Administration’s program to defer deportations of these parents for three years. Immigration is one of the issues that the UU Legislative Ministry addresses.

Dr. Sue Kenney’s Bio:

Dr. Sue Kenney became interested in immigrants’ rights work during her years as a restaurant owner in Hackensack, New Jersey.  She joined First Friends, an immigrants’ rights advocacy group in 2011, and has been visiting undocumented immigrants being held in detention ever since. Sue lives with her husband, Tom, in Washington Township, and teaches English at Immaculate Heart Academy.  Last year Sue earned her doctorate in interdisciplinary humanities from Drew University.
results.name: Unauthorized Immigrant Parents: Seeking A Compassionate Response

ProductionPro, is for anyone who is putting on a Show. Bissell Bridge Trail
Trail Highlights
This trail connects Windsor and South Windsor via a separate facility on the Bissel Bridge across the Connecticut River. It connects Windsor to the extensive system of multi-use trails located in Manchester and East Hartford, as well as the mall areas on their borders. This trail also acts as a rivercrossing for cross- state cyclists connecting the recommended cycling routes, Matianuck Avenue in Windsor and Chapel Road in South Windsor. This trail provides beautiful scenic views of the Connecticut River.
Parking and Accessibility
Parking is located on the Windsor side of the trail, near the Connecticut River.
From I-91 South: Take exit 35B and go left (east) onto Putnam Memorial Highway. Then turn right onto Windsor Avenue (Route 159) and then left onto East Barber Street. Parking is available at the end of East Barber Street.
From I-91 North: Take exit 35 to Putnam Memorial Highway and go right (east) on this highway. Then follow directions above!
