results.description:
We are holding a hands-on advanced algorithmic trading workshop on April 10th in NYC.

If you would like to attend the workshop, we are asking you to RSVP at: </a><a href="https://thequantopianadvancedworkshop.splashthat.com/">https://thequantopianadvancedworkshop.splashthat.com/.

Advanced Algorithmic Trading

This advanced level workshop will give you a strong foundation to develop and deploy your own factor-driven strategy. 

It will:

• Show how arbitrage pricing theory sets the stage for factor driven price models. 

• How to evaluate your model.


• How to write a strategy based on the pricing model.

• How to evaluate the strategy's performance.


The curriculum has been vetted and used to teach lectures by professors at top-tier universities, including: Harvard, Cornell, and Stanford.

Prerequisites to Attend

A strong working knowledge of the Quantopian platform, including the IDE and research environment. Understanding of Lectures 1, 2, 4, 5, 7, and 11 from the Quantopian Lecture series. College level math and statistics. A full glossary of useful statistics terms will be emailed out in advance of the workshop. And you will need to bring your laptop. 

Reserve your Spot

Tickets for The Workshop are: $675.00. Meals and snacks will be provided. Space is limited and spots will be on a first come, first serve basis. We are keeping The Quantopian Workshop intentionally small in order to give attendees the best hand-on learning experience. 

For more information and to RSVP, please RSVP here</a>.

The Lecturer

The workshop has been developed by Delaney Granizo-Mackenzie, engineer and academic lead at Quantopian, whose focus is on the intersection of computer science, statistics, and finance. His background includes seven years of bioinformatics research and delivering lectures at schools including Harvard and MIT. Have a question or a comment?

Reach out to Delaney at [masked]. He would love to hear from you! 

You can also visit us at: <a href="https://www.quantopian.com/workshops">https://www.quantopian.com/workshops.
results.name: Announcing The Advanced Quantopian Workshop in NYC

results.description:
Come join us and cook at the outdoor wood-fired oven at the Old Stone House!

Have children? Don't know how to cook or don't have time to prepare something? Join us for "Build Your Own Pizzas" at Noon!

We provide the dough and a variety of fresh toppings... you provide the fun!  Come and assemble your own personal pizza, and we'll help you bake it in a 900-degree wood-fired brick oven.

Then at 1pm, the oven will be open for everyone to cook their own dishes!

We'll meet at the stone oven next to the Old Stone House. Firing the oven will start around 9am, and we'll start baking at noon. For details of time and temperature, check out the FAQ.

We'll be outside the entire time, so be sure to dress warmly and wear multiple layers.

Open Baking Day, and Build Your Own Pizzas, are free and open to the public!

If you enjoy this event, please do consider donating $5 (or more if you can) to the Old Stone House to help pay for firewood. Or, contribute to the oven rebuilding project fundraiser on Indiegogo, and get some great perks!
results.name: Open Baking Day at the Old Stone House

Experience Central Park in a whole new way with our Central Park Scavenger Hunt!  It is a fun way to meet new people or hang out with familiar friends in NYC's Urban Oasis! If you don't have a team we will set you up on one as you set out to find fun and historical things that are already part of the park.  Following the hunt you can join members of the hunt for a bite to eat at a local pub or restaurant.How it works:

-Come alone or with friends to The Firehouse Tavern at 11am.  We will set up the teams (teams of 5 only)

-Each team will have 90 minutes to find as many clues at they can inside the park (clues will be in historical markers, wildlife, street performers, tourists, fountains, statues, bridges and hidden secrets)

-At the end of the 90 minutes each team will return to The Firehouse Tavern to see which group has uncovered the most clues to win prizes!

Can I come alone?  Yes, 95% of those attending will be coming on their own.  If you come alone we will put you on a team with other fun members.

Dress code:dress for the weather

Is this going to be hard or do I need experience?  No this is a fun hunt and designed to make the clues easy to find.

What if it rains? We will send updates before the event.

How do I pay?  Please bring exact change $10

results.description:
“Faith is taking the first step even when you don’t see the whole staircase.” -Martin Luther King, Jr.

Our April theme is faith: in what way are we, at the Society for Ethical Culture, people of faith?  In the Ethical movement, we’ve said we have faith in the human capacity for ethical growth.  In the 1876 founding address inspiring the first Ethical Society, Felix Adler said, “The time calls for action. Up, then, and let us do our part faithfully and well.”  To what and to whom are we faithful?

Sometimes, “faith” means to believe in something, to be committed to something.  In this vein, another Ethical Culture Leader, John Lovejoy Elliott, said, “I have known many good people who did not believe in God. But I have never known a human being who was good who did not believe in people.”

Leader Jone Johnson Lewis will talk about her sense of the term “faith” from her perspective as a humanist — someone who believes in people.

For more information, click here.
results.how_to_find_us: Visit www.rysec.org/directions
results.name: Sunday Platform: The Faith of a Humanist

results.description:
Lauren Wren will give a talk entitled: The Refugee Crisis on Long Island

As the MS-13 and other gangs in Central America grow larger, more powerful, and more brutal, Central American children have been targeted for recruitment, harm, and death in record numbers.  As they come under increasing threat, many of these children have fled to the United States.  As these children move through a complicated immigration court process, thousands of them have moved in with family members on Long Island, which has one of the largest Salvadoran populations in the country.  

Our country and our community here on Long Island have responded to the arrival of these children in a variety of ways.  Parts of our government have attempted to deprive them of their legal rights and deport them immediately.  Some districts on Long Island attempted to prevent the refugee children from registering in schools. Other groups have welcomed the children with open arms, seeking to provide assistance in difficult times.  What can and what should we be doing in response to this humanitarian crisis?
results.name: Sunday Meeting

group.name: Ethical Humanist Society of Long Island

venue.name: Ethical Culture Society of Bergen County

results.description:
Everyone is invited to our platform meetings. Our Sunday school meets at the same time.

The Sunday School at the Ethical Culture Society of Bergen County helps children aged 2-14 explore and develop their moral and critical thinking skills through fun and interactive lessons and field trips. We meet weekly at 11am on Sundays for 1.5 hours while the adults of the Ethical Culture Society are attending the platform meeting. Our wide ranging curriculum allows kids to examine themselves, their community and the world in general. We teach about different cultures, philosophies and religions. We encourage our students to ask questions, think for themselves and make up their own minds about the bigger questions in life. Our children develop strong values and ethical standpoints. The Sunday School Graduation Rite of Passage, completed by our 8th graders, allows them to present to the community how their Sunday School experience has informed their moral and ethical development.
results.name: Peter Galasso

group.name: The Ethical Culture Society of Bergen County

results.description:
REGISTER HERE

Join StoryForward NYC and the creators of Production Pro for a special hands-on workshop with their mobile technology designed for filmmakers, script writers, theater designers and event producers.


ProductionPro, is for anyone who is putting on a Show. It allows Show People – freelancers, amateurs and professionals –to visually assemble and share all ideas during the development of a Show within the structure of the complete production, story or event. Show People working in theatre, film, television and live events can now visualize their work and dramatically streamline the collaborative creative process.

The Production pro workshop will be lead by founder and CEO, Alex Libby.


Alex developed the concept for ProductionPro while working closely with director Stephen Daldry during production of Warner Bros.’ Extremely Loud & Incredibly Close. Other favorite credits include: Wicked, Billy Elliot The Musical, In The Heights, and The London Olympic Ceremonies.
Learn more at: http://production.pro/
results.name: Workshop: Streamlining Show Collaboration with ProductionPro

A SCHNITZELFEST is an “all you can eat” meal featuring Schnitzel….. All you can eat Pork Jägerschnitzel, Pork & Chicken Schnitzel, Spätzle, Mashed Potatoes, Red Cabbage, Vegetable, & served buffet style.
And apple strudel. Soda and alcoholic drinks are extra. They have a bar. I propose we meet by the front entrance at 11:30 am and will gather there until 12:15 PM. Promptly at 12:15 we will buy our tickets and go in as a group so we can all be seated at the same table. Look for the meetup sign where we will wait. Their procedure is to fill up tables and then start to fill a new one. If we don't go in together as a group, we wouldn't be seated together, so please be prompt.

215 Uncle Pete's Road, Trenton, New Jersey 08691 (Trenton is a mailing address. I think you would use Hamilton or Yardville as the town for a GPS) Location is not far from the Hamilton postal facility off route 130 near Klockner Rd.... http://www.trentondonauschwaben.com/Forms/DIRECTIONS.pdf

Entertainment by Willi Aust.

Bar opens 12 pm featuring special German Beers & Wines.

Take-out platters also available for $16.

Spring has sprung in Central Park! Our tours are specifically designed for people who live, work and play in the New York Area.  It is our goal to open your eyes to historical sites and info that you may walk past every day!  Our tours are fun ways to learn about the city while socializing with other fun people from our group. It is amazing that Manhattan, which was once known as the Island of Rolling Hills, has transformed into the Concrete Canyon it is today.  Along the way your professional guide will share historical facts and show you a photographic history that will amaze you.  Be a tourist in your own city and sign up today!

Your guide will share with you the history of the park from its heyday to decline and then rebirth. He will show you amazing pictures  from before the park was there to vintage shots from the late 18 and 1900's.  You will learn of it's construction, design, special secrets and more as the sun shines on a  spring day.

The tour lasts about 90 minutes and following the walk you can join us for an optional brunch at a local restaurant.

** Bring Exact Change to the Event**
results.name: NY Tours For New Yorkers: Spring In Central Park History Tour

He will show you amazing pictures  from before the park was there to vintage shots from the late 18 and 1900's.  You will learn of it's construction, design, special secrets and more as the sun shines on a  spring day.

The tour lasts about 90 minutes and following the walk you can join us for an optional brunch at a local restaurant.

** Bring Exact Change to the Event**

results.description:
Join us for a day of open source work in JavaScript! 

Did you know you can make meaningful contributions to JavaScript code powering thousands of websites, and running in millions of browsers? 


You can improve your JavaScript coding, technical writing and collaboration skills, and also expand your professional network, and help advance the art of software engineering all in one fun way: contribute to JavaScript open source! It looks good on your resume, teaches you how to be thorough and work within teams, and gives you inside access to some of the coolest projects being built. 


FORMAT

This is a workshop for people who are familiar with front-end development or JavaScript.  And it’s ok if you’ve never contributed to open source. We will try to have activities for every skill level, not to mention mentors to help you get unstuck.


EXAMPLE TASKS

• Improving documentation

• Writing tutorials/guides

• Collecting resources

• Adding features

• Adding tests

• Fixing bugs

• Helping other people do all of these things


PREREQUISITES

• Setup a GitHub account: https://github.com/join

• Learn how to submit a pull request: https://help.github.com/articles/creating-a-pull-request/


BRING

• Your laptop with charger


AGENDA (PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME!)


• 11:30-12:00 – arrive, coffee sponsored by Fullstack, meet the participants

• 12:00 - 12:15 - intro to OSS & share available projects & tickets


• 12:15 - 1:30 – break into teams & get started on learning & hacking

• 1:30 - 2:00 - lunch sponsored by Clutch Talent


• 2:00 - 3:45 - continue learning & hacking


• 3:45-4:00 – show and tell

Please let us know if you can mentor!


FAQs


Q: Is there any prep work that I need to do ahead of time?

A: Yes, please create a GitHub account and learn how to do a pull request.

Q: What if I get stuck?

You will be pairing up, and there will be awesome mentors around!

Q: Why should I spend my weekend coding?

Meet cool people. Learn from top devs. Maybe you can even earn a limited-edition tee from Hacktoberfest.

Interested in having people contribute to your open source project? Would you like to mentor? Want to ask a question? Have a suggestion for how we could make this workshop better? Drop us a line at [masked], and/or check out our planning document.

ABOUT THE HOST / SPONSOR

Fullstack Academy is providing space and coffee. Fullstack Academy is a 12-week bootcamp focused on creating world-class developers.  Using it's innovative JavaScript fullstack curriculum, Fullstack has trained over 400 developers who work at some of the world's top technology companies, including Google, Dropbox, Palantir and Facebook.

Clutch Talent is providing lunch. Clutch Talent is a boutique recruitment firm specializing in software engineering careers. We offer targeted introductions and interview support for top technologists with innovative, leading and emerging tech companies. We are with you throughout your career, advancing your professional growth and advocating for your success.

= = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = =

NY JavaScript expects all speakers and attendees to follow the JSConf Code of Conduct.

Due to limited seating, RSVPs for this event is $3. There are no refunds or transfers. Proceeds go to ScriptEd, a charity to increase code literacy among NYC youth at under-resourced schools.

If you would like to sponsor or speak at one of our events, please email us at [masked].
results.name: First-Time Open Source Contributor Workshop [JavaScript-Focused­]

results.description:
GALILEO (CONFLICT BETWEEN REASON / FAITH - NYC ATHEISTS BRUNCH / APRIL 10TH (SUNDAY) /12 NOON

==============================

SPEAKER: MATTHEW STANLEY - Ph.D 

ASSOCIATE PROFESSOR, NYU: GALLATIN SCHOOL OF INDIVIDUALIZED STUDY 

Matthew Stanley teaches and researches the history and philosophy of science. He holds degrees in astronomy, religion, physics, and the history of science and is interested in the connections between science and the wider culture. He is the author of Practical Mystic: Religion, Science, and A. S. Eddington (Chicago 2007), which examines how scientists reconcile their religious beliefs and professional lives, and Huxley’s Church and Maxwell’s Demon (Chicago 2014), which explores how science changed from its historical theistic foundations to its modern naturalistic ones. His current project is a history of scientific predictions of the end of the world. Professor Stanley is also part of a nationwide National Science Found. He has held fellowships at the Institute for Advanced Study, the British Academy, and the Max Planck Institute.  Professor Stanley was awarded a[masked] Gallatin Dean’s Award for Excellence in Teaching.

SUBJECT: GALILEO - THE FOUNDER OF MODERN SCIENCE AND THE CONFLICT BETWEEN REASON AND FAITH.


Galileo Galilei born 15 February 1564, was an <a>Italian </a><a>astronomer</a>, <a>physicist</a>, <a>engineer</a>, <a>philosopher</a>, and <a>mathematician</a> who played a major role in the <a>scientific revolution</a> during the <a>Renaissance</a>. Galileo has been called the "father of <a>observational astronomy</a>", the "father of modern <a>physics</a>", and the "father of <a>science</a>". His contributions to observational astronomy include the telescopic confirmation of the <a>phases of Venus</a>, the discovery of the four largest satellites of <a>Jupiter</a> (named the <a>Galilean moons</a> in his honour), and the observation and analysis of <a>sunspots</a>. Galileo also worked in applied science and technology, inventing an improved <a>military compass</a> and other instruments.

Galileo's championing of heliocentrism and <a>Copernicanism</a> was controversial within his lifetime, when most subscribed to either <a>geocentrism</a> or the <a>Tychonic system</a>. He met with opposition from astronomers, who doubted heliocentrism due to the absence of an observed <a>stellar parallax</a>. The matter was investigated by the <a>Roman Inquisition</a> in 1615, and they concluded that it could only be supported as a possibility, not as an established fact. Galileo later defended his views in <a>Dialogue Concerning the Two Chief World Systems</a>, which appeared to attack Pope <a>Urban VIII</a> and thus alienated him and the<a>Jesuits</a>. He was tried by the Inquisition, found "vehemently suspect of heresy", forced to recant, and spent the rest of his life under house arrest. It was while Galileo was under house arrest that he wrote one of his most well known works, <a>Two New Sciences</a>. Here he summarized the work he had done some forty years earlier, on the two sciences now called <a>kinematics</a> and <a>strength of materials</a>.

-------------------------


LOCATION: The Press Box Restaurant, 932 Second Avenue (bet. 49th & 50th Sts.) -2nd Floor.


 COST: BRUNCH is $20, which includes a selection of Buffet Entrees, salad, one soft drink, coffee, tax and tip.

===================================

results.description:
Once again (because it's my favorite walk), let's explore the forests and wetlands of Bronx's Pelham Bay Park, the City's largest, where I've seen turkeys, deer, and numerous large waterbirds. We'll stop for lunch in the lovely gardens of historic Bartow-Pell Mansion, then walk to picturesque City Island. We'll end the day with an optional dinner at a delicious fresh-seafood restaurant, where two people can comfortably share a huge entree costing about $11 apiece (excluding tax and tip).

DISTANCE: About 6 miles. But you can catch a bus back to the train station after about 4 miles, about 45 minutes after lunch. 

PACE: MODERATE (2 mph), not slow. If you want to stroll rather than walk moderately, this is not the hike for you.

ENDING TIME: You'll get back to the subway station (by bus from City Island) at around 5:30-6:00 PM if you skip dinner, 7:30-8 PM if you don't. You can leave earlier as well, by catching the bus to the subway around 3:30 to 4:00 PM.


INSTRUCTIONS: Bring lunch. And while the risk of ticks is much lower at this time of year, take precautions: Wear long, light-colored clothing if possible (no short pants or sleeves), and bring insect repellent (at least 20% deet) if you can; I'll bring some if you can't. Also, wear boots if possible, since some of the trails are a bit uneven.

COST: $2 (in part to cover meetup's organizer fee), plus the price of dinner.

WAITING LIST: Be patient. Many people ahead of you will cancel, especially at the last minute.


DRIVERS: Option 1: Park in the Middletown Rd. parking lot (see directions below). Walk out of the same entrance, turn right, then right again onto Middletown Rd, heading toward the Expressway. Turn right a third time onto the path running parallel to the expressway, and walk north (along the edge of the park). After passing two pedestrian bridges (one at Middletown Rd.) and one motor-vehicle bridge, you'll find us at the bottom of the third pedestrian bridge, across the expressway from the elevated subway station. (If you happen to get lost on foot, ask someone how to find the bridge to the subway.) It's roughly a 15-minute walk--but unlike street parking near the subway, it's guaranteed.

Option 2: The elevated train station and pedestrian bridge are located near the intersection of Westchester Ave. and Amendola Place; if you get near there and can't find it, ask anyone in the neighborhood; they should know. Try parking on the street nearby, then climb the stairs to the subway station (no fare required) and walk across the bridge. Leave extra time for this option; drivers have reported that parking isn't difficult, but of course there's no guarantee.

DRIVING DIRECTIONS TO PARKING LOT (OPTION 1, ABOVE). FOR OPTION 2, USE YOUR GPS TO WESTCHESTER AVENUE AND AMENDOLA PLACE.

From the New England Thruway (I-95) South
Take I-95 South to the Westchester Avenue exit.  Go straight along the service road for approximately 4 lights and make a left onto Jarvis Place to go over the I-95/Bruckner Expressway.  Make the next left and head north on the service road.  At the first light, make a right onto Middletown Road.  At the end of the street (Stadium Ave), make a left into the park and the first left into the parking lot. Then walk to the meeting spot, as described in option 1, above.

From the Bruckner Expressway
Take the Bruckner Expressway north and exit at the Lafayette Avenue exit.  Stay on the northbound service road and make a right onto Middletown Road.  At the end of the block (Stadium Ave), make a left into the park and another left turn into the parking lot. Then walk to the meeting spot, as described in option 1, above.

From the I-95 North
Take I-95 north and exit at the Country Club Road/Pelham Bay Park exit.  Stay on the northbound service road and make a right onto Middletown Road.  At the end of the block (Stadium Ave), make a left into the park and another left turn into the parking lot. Then walk to the meeting spot, as described in option 1, above.

From Pelham Parkway, eastbound
Take Pelham Parkway eastbound past Eastchester Road and get into the right lane.  Go through the next light and make a right turn onto the Pelham Parkway service road. (Be careful not to get onto the Hutchinson River Parkway.)  Follow the service road around to a stop sign and under the IRT No. 6 train and head south along the Bruckner Expressway service road.  Go straight along the service road for approximately 4 lights and make a left onto Jarvis Place to go over the I-95/Bruckner Expressway.  Make the next left and head north on the service road.  At the first light, make a right onto Middletown Road.  At the end of the street (Stadium Ave), make a left into the park and the first left into the parking lot. Then walk to the meeting spot, as described in option 1, above.
results.name: Pelham Bay woods, City Island, and optional fish dinner

results.description:
The late Republican period of ancient Rome is perhaps most often remembered as a time of great political and social unrest that could break out in murderous turmoil with dismal regularity. At the same time, however, Rome of the last century BC flowered into an incubator for the revival of Latin literature and Greco-Roman philosophy. The pioneer writers in this new movement were men of a philosophical bent who sought practical ways to deal with all that was wrong in life. Cicero and Lucretius argued with consummate and persuasive style, one for traditional Roman Stoicism, and one for a liberating Epicurean materialism. A new lyric strain also began to take shape in the deeply emotional poetry of Catullus and the urbane and philosophical odes, satires and epistles of Horace. Elegiac poetry reached highest development in the work of Virgil and Ovid. Epic literature rivaling Homer's Odyssey was created by the great Virgil, as a capstone to the promise of the Pax Romana imposed by Augustus. We will explore the roles of class, tradition, politics and power in the formation of a literature that became classical in its own time.

If RSVPs are closed, please indicate if you want a spot.
results.name: Roman Literature

results.description:
Join us for this three and half hour instructed figure drawing session. 

This session is for beginners and advanced beginners who are interested in figure drawing but feel they need to understand the basics to make real progress. 

• We will work from a live model for the entire session.

• All materials are provided for students.


Our goal is to give students clear instruction as well as focused goals they can achieve during the session. Additionally, we provide information they can use long after the class ends, in their own drawing. 

We will cover: 

1) Gesture Drawing - what is it, why do we do it, how does it benefit us. 

2) Understanding Basic Form - how simple drawing knowledge helps us to understand drawing the figure. (This is the largest section of the class with the most beneficial drawing techniques we can use well into the future.) 

3) Strategies for Long Poses - beginning to shade form and simplify shapes when it comes to the figure. 

The space we will work in (but of course from a figure.)

Instructor Simon Levenson is the founder of Drawing New York and teaches drawing at The National Art Club, The Morgan Library and Museum and The Museum of The City of New York. His oil paintings are represented by Cavalier Galleries Inc. 


If you have any questions please feel free to email simon(at)drawingnewyork.com

Thank you, 

Simon Levenson

Every week, we meet from 12:00 pm to 2:00 pm. Usually, we work through Julia Cameron's creativity building techniques (for example those in The Artist's Way and The Prosperous Heart). We start each session discussing the current week's activity (morning pages, artist's dates, synchronicities, creative endeavors, etc) and then participate in an agreed upon exercise/task (bring paper and pen please).

results.description:
Photographer & Model Photoshoot Society presents:

"Featured Model: Glamour & Implied Shoot w/Dara - April 10th"

Update[masked]: This shoot has been converted to a Featured Model shoot due to illness with our second model booked.

Happy Spring everyone! We're back at it this month! We have a newcomers to the group....Dara! We're sure she will become a member favorite! With the better weather, we're hoping to get back to some more outdoor shooting with this Meetup. (Weather permitting.)

About Featured Model Shoots:

With this type of shoot there will be one model. (Limited smaller group than our bigger shoots) It could be a traveling model, one of our member favorites or a new model with a unique concept. These shoots are designed to be more intricate as far as lighting scheme, concepts and free form. (The freedom to adjust lighting, use different sets and make the look your own with plenty of time to do so.) We will have a basic starting point for the look but you are encouraged to experiment. (I will be on hand to help where needed.)

About the Shoot:

We have three looks planned with a fourth look pending time. Weather permitting, we'll get to do some outdoor shooting. We'll keep it to glamour looks plus an implied look. (Swimwear, lingerie and sexy outerwear.) For outdoor shooting, feel free to bring your speed lights, reflectors and any modifiers to get shots in your preferred portable lighting setups. Indoors, we'll have our strobe and LED setups.

RSVP:

We have setup a deposit system to hold a spot for a shoot. So, please only sign up when you are sure of your attendance and ready to make the deposit to hold your spot. (This also lets anyone on a waitlist able to join the shoot if you are not sure of your attendance yet.) Your spot is not held till the deposit is received and I'll send you a confirmation message or confirm your spot on the Meetup page. All deposits need to be received immediately upon signup or within 5 days of the shoot or we will have to fill the unconfirmed spot/s ASAP if there is a waitlist or cancel the shoot (existing deposits returned) if the minimum RSVP is not met. (No, deposit is needed if you are on the waitlist but check back to see if your waitlist status has been updated to "Yes".)

Total Cost: $80

Deposit: $20 (PayPal)

(Don't mark the checkbox on the PayPal page as that adds the surcharge automatically. If we have to return a deposit for any reason, it will be less than originally deposited.)

Balance due at time of shoot: $60, Cash preferred, Credit Cards/Paypal ok with $5 added for surcharge.

Non-Commercial Release PDF will be emailed to you at the email address given on the sign in sheet.

Model: 

Dara: Instagram

(Photo Credits: NandoPro)

(Photos below sent by model for promotional purposes. All rights their respective owners.)

Policy and Disclaimers:

One-on-One: The model will be available for one half hour one on one shoot after the first two hours in the Meetup. If you want to pre-book time before the shoot, send me a message.

Shared One-on-Ones: We are also implementing a system that has been working for the past few Meetups. It's the sharing of a half hour one on one with a fellow photographer. It can be shared together for the whole half hour or 15 minutes each photographer. 

____________________________________________________________________

About the Studio:

The studios is a beautiful 3,000 sq. ft., climate controlled,  fully functional studio. (Professional in-house lights, props, various seamless backdrops, actual commercial photography sets, kitchen, waiting room, meeting/presentation room, the works!) It's conveniently located to major highways and a 20-30 minute public transportation ride to and from NY.

About The Meetup Format:

We will keep the group small although we have the space to accommodate a big group. This keeps things from feeling rushed and overwhelming. Each photographer will have a set amount of time per look. This will allow you to  shoot as you would in an actual client shoot and not have to worry about the number of shots you are taking. (This proved to be ideal in our previous shoots as far as being able to get "the shot" and enough time to do so. Think of it as a mini one-on-one time with the model.) During the shoot we may opt to give a theme a direction to shoot for. As it would be for an actual client. (Ex: If the setup calls for a "cover shot" then it will give you a direction to aim for and to consider what equipment to use or what mood to capture.) No worries, bring what lens or lenses you have, you'll learn to use what you have for best results. We strive to bring forth real world conditions and parameters so there is a methodology to a setup or theme.

Check-in Procedure and Disclaimers:

Check-in - When you arrive, there will be a quick check-in. This will mostly be so you can read and adhere to the studio/group shoot guidelines and make payment for the shoot before we start. This will also let us send you the release forms in PDF format if we don't have physical copies available.

Releases - We will have one non-commercial release signed by the model through the studio only. (No additional releases will be signed.) If you need a commercial release signed, you can make arrangements with the model directly. Additional compensation for this is between the model and photographer.

Right to Refuse - We have the right to refuse a member's RSVP to the Meetup. It's a small community and models keep detailed info on photographers also. If we feel there is justifiable reason to refuse a RSVP, we will exercise that right.

Signups - Please signup when you know you will attend. If the signup passes the point to book another model and then we get no shows it's not fair to your fellow photographers who would be on a waiting list. It also puts the organizers in a tough spot, financially after booking an additional model to compensate for a bigger group. In case of no show, we will have to remove you from the group. When emergencies come up, followup with an email and we can make exceptions on a case by case basis. 

Deposit - We have implemented a deposit system to insure that the minimum RSVP is met to hold the shoot. (Which varies from shoot to shoot.) This will ensure that the financials are or will be in place for the model/s beforehand. This deposit will be non-refundable, so make sure you sign up and pay the deposit when you are sure you will be able to attend. Signing up to the Meetup page does not ensure your spot until the deposit is made at the Paypal link provided on each event page. As the shoot date comes closer, if you have not paid the deposit, we will fill the unconfirmed spot immediately. You will receive a confirmation message or a confirmation comment on the Meetup page you are signing up for. Two days before the shoot, if the minimum RSVP has not been met then we will opt to cancel the shoot and refund any deposits already sent. This will give the model some time to book another gig if possible. But as usual, always check the Meetup page up to the date of the shoot for any updates.

Model Cancellation - If a model cancels/no show or a last minute model change occurs, you will have the option to cancel beforehand or not attend the Meetup on the day of, if it happens upon arrival to the Meetup. (Any refunds will be given or credit toward a future Meetup as per your request.)

Waitlist - When you are on a waitlist, please be mindful as this is also considered a RSVP of availability. So, if we add another model or someone cancels, your wait list status may upgrade to a "Yes" automatically. Please be on the lookout for updates on the Meetup page as Meetup sometimes takes longer to notify of a status change.

Updates - Updates will be made on this page up to the date of the Meetup or the night before. Emails will also be sent but Meetup emails are not always reliable to be sent to a receiver right away. (I've heard of emails arriving 3 hours later if at all.)

Postponements - Weather considerations will be made the night before a shoot or on the day of and the Meetup page will be updated as well as emails sent if a postponement occurs due to inclement weather or some other emergency. Lack of minimum RSVP to hold the event will also cause postponement of the shoot. The night before we would make the call wether to postpone so be on the look out for our email and Meetup page updates.

Any questions please email me at [masked]

results.description:
You are invited 

Tickets

A Brunch filled with good music, food, drinks and trendsetters. This event will feature one of the rising stars of African (Nigerian) KALINÉ.

KALINÉ BIO
She is hard to miss with that impressive, unapologetic Diana Ross-esque mane but more than just a head of hair, Kaliné’s voice is certainly one worth getting to know. The Nigerian-born singer/songwriter and pianist whose clever threading of words and percussive style of piano playing is a direct product of her African roots. With a soulful elegance and funky flutter, she spreads her wings across a landscape of jazz, R‘n’B, and Afrobeat to create an authentic, alternative sound.

A graduate of Berklee College of music with a BMus in Film Scoring, she has a unique set of composition and production skills. In 2014, she released her first single and video ‘Ololufemi’ which garnered a lot of attention in Africa. Her most recent release (February, 2015) ‘The Fires Of Red: Season One’ is a body of work featuring 14 original songs and drawings (released over a period of 14 days) that serves as a visual songbook detailing a modern fictional drama. Several of her songs have been licensed for TV and film including ‘Falling For You’ licensed for the internationally acclaimed Nollywood movie ‘Flower Girl’ and TV series b430.
Among several performance opportunities, Kaliné has opened for Bob James & Fourplay, Chaka Khan, Angélique Kidjo, Keziah Jones, Bez, Somi and Victor Olaiya.

TICKETS

A strong advocate for social change, she has written a number of songs that address various social issues. ‘Stand and Fight’ that addresses domestic violence, won her 1st place in Berklee’s ‘Songwriting for Social Change’ competition (2012). ‘Bring Them Home’ written in honor of the Chibok girls that were abducted in April, 2014 (including a music video) and ‘Every Woman, Every Child’ a theme song written for a UN- affiliated foundation of the same name (focusing on improving global women and children’s health) are all part of her efforts to use her talent to shine a light on sensitive issues that affect our global community.

Kaliné recently performed the Nigerian National Anthem at The nigerian Embassy, D.C upon the arrival of President Muhammad Buhari.

Visit her website for more information at www.kalineofficial.com

Social media: instagram: @kalineofficial Soundcloud.com/kalineofficial

Video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DeIC9n147Oc

results.description:
Updated March 5, 2016

WINTER (Dec-Feb)

As the city gets cold we play two times a week. We use Riverside Park with Morningside Park as a backup.

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd & West End) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd & West End)

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

Damien 

[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the C local (B on weekdays) to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball/softball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

results.description:
Are you looking for a complementary training to ENHANCE your overall well being on and off the track, to be more FLEXIBLE and RELEASE physical, mental and emotional tensions?


Are you looking for RELIEF from joint wear, tightness, pain, and/or discomfort?

$5 FOR FIRST CLASS TO CROSS TRAIN...

_________________________________________________

About Yin Yang Yoga...A typical Yoga class is ‘Yang’ in style and focuses on active heating and muscular contraction - by starting with ‘Yin’, a more passive, nourishing, and cooling practice, this uniquely designed class WILL enhance your alignment, performance, and overall sense of balance!


Why For Runners/Athletes? - Lengthening and releasing effect from repetitive movements on sheets of connective tissue can overtime shorten and tighten it in ingrained patterns around the muscles. This fascia restriction can make one more prone to having injuries, abnormal posture, and inefficiency, as well as asymmetrical weakening. By targeting rotated key areas in weekly Yin Yang Yoga For Runners class, one can experience tension release, fluid movement, and benefit from improved posture, circulation, injury prevention, as well as increased respiratory control and mental focus...

Each Yin Yang Yoga for Runners class begins with a series of held Yin/floor postures. While surrendering into the edge of each pose (for 2-5 minutes), students are guided to experience the discomforting stagnant energy and its release around the hips, thighs, and lower back, and be connected to the present moment. The Yang flow sequence designed to follow will allow students to integrate the newly released energy, joint spaces for greater circulation and achieve new level of flexibility and energy.  Guided Relaxation provided at the end will promise to be YUMMY!

__________________________________________________

Testimonies x3: "Jennifer is an awesome instructor. Her sessions are informative and her teaching style is patient, clear and inspires me to attain increased fitness. I look forward to attending her class. The very next day I was able to push through my usual 3-4 miles to complete a 6 mile run." Sandra

"I ran my best time running a 18 mile course the day after..." Lori

“ I started taking Jennifer's Yin/Yang Yoga for Runner's Class over the summer, and it was fantastic. I had never practiced yoga regularly before, and was pleasantly surprised at how it helped to improve my flexibility, running, and overall fitness. Jennifer is a great, hands-on teacher, and really knows how the body works. I highly recommend this class! ” Theresa

________________________________________________________

THIS PERFORMANCE ENHANCING WEEKLY 1.25 HOUR CLASS IS NOT OFFERED ANYWHERE ELSE IN NYC! COME CHECK IT OUT!

By Cash or Check

Did I Already Mention----FIRST CLASS FOR ONLY $ 5!! 

This Meet Up RSVP $15

Class Card $130/10-Class Card, or $13/class *****BEST DEAL!

Bring a Friend Get a Free Future Class Pass!

Please dress in layers (cool to start) and it's okay to eat prior.  Please message any questions and pass this invite to your friends. Thank you and see ya you on the mat!


Namaste, Jennifer, RYT-500hr

All ages welcome aboard, Kid Friendly event.

Join 7 in Heaven and the Riverhead Foundation for Marine Research and Preservation, for a 2 hour cruise see seals at play throughout the bay. We sail @ 1pm sharp aboard Captain Lou Fleet Naturalist will be on board to discuss biology and behavior of seals marine life we encounter

Portion of your ticket purchase, helps support the New York State Marine Mammal and Sea Turtle Rescue Program.


We will not go out into the ocean, big ship so its an easy ride. Heated cabin w/ refreshment available on board (or pack your own lunch). Hard to believe these critters are right here on Long Island! SEALS are only here during cold water season. Past 4 yrs we saw many seals! See Pics from 2015

*Optional after cruise, have lunch together at E.B. Elliot's in Freeport's Nautical mile -next to dock. 

Click Here to pay $28.00 pre-paid (Reserve Adult) 

CLICK HERE to pay $20.00 pre-paid (Reserve Child 12yrs or under)

Limited space subject to availability (Sold out last 4 yrs)

results.description:
Join us for a PRIVATE TOUR of the largest art museum in the country and among the most visited museums in the world - The MET! 

Our private tour guide will give us an hour tour providing a general overview of the Museum. Afterwards, we can explore the other great things the museum has to offer on our own. 

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (Must purchase ticket in advance here) -  

https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/themet/dates/Apr-10-2016_at_1230PM

The tour starts at 3pm, however we will have a pre-mingle starting at 12:45pm at a local bar/pub close to the museum (location sent to email used to pay for ticket week of event).  

At the pre-mingle we will introduce you to the other Meetup members and give you admission tickets to the museum. At 2:15pm we will head over to the museum together. 

Your ticket includes:

12:45pm-2:15pm - Pre-Mingle 

3pm - Private Group Tour

4pm - General admission to the Museum

Must purchase ticket at link below (no tickets sold at door) - 

https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/themet/dates/Apr-10-2016_at_1230PM

$49.75-$55.75 depending on how early you buy ticket. 

What if I'm a MET member? Sorry but they put a strict maximum as far as the number of people that can attend our private tour. We are charged per person for each tour guide. Only individuals who purchase through our ticket link can participate in the group tour and pre-mingle.  

Is this event age/ethnic specific? No. This event is open to all ages and is not meant to be age/gender/ethnic specific. Please attend if you have an interest in the museum and/or are looking to meet new people. 

How many will be attending? This is a multi-Meetup and we'll have up to 50 members from various groups attending. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. 

Can I get tickets at museum? No. You must purchase tickets in advance for our private tour which will include the pre-mingle. You will pick up the actual tour tickets at the pre-mingle location.

Prepay Here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/themet/dates/Apr-10-2016_at_1230PM

results.description:
Hike at Watchung Reservation!

Meet in the parking lot outside the Trailside Nature and Science Center. We're going to hike the Historic Trail at Watchung Reservation. The trail is 6.5 miles long and passes along the Cooper Mine Gorge, the Deserted Village of Feltville, Lake Surprise and more. The trail is denoted by a pink square painted onto trees along the path.

The terrain is a mixed bag, with some flat sections and some rocky sections. We're going to travel over some gorges and dried river beds, not to mention there are some depressions in the ground along the path. Be careful. Bring shoes that you don't mind getting dirty. 

The hike will take between 2 and 3 hours. If anyone wants to cut it short we can take another path back to the parking lot.

Remember, we are meeting at the Trailside Nature and Science Center. There are several parking lots at the Watchung Reservation. Make sure you reach the right one.

I recommend that everyone carpool so that we don't take up the entire parking lot (this place is popular with hikers).

I'm looking forward to seeing everyone there!

DISCLAIMER: If you join us for this event, please understand that you are responsible for your own (and your guest's) preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. Your attendance to this event signifies that you have read and accepted the terms of this liability waiver.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet in the parking lot.

results.description:
Note: Only RSVP if you are planning to show up.

First Timers, READ details before you RSVP. 

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY

When: We usually climb between 1:00pm and 4:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizer(s) tries their best to be there around 1:00pm. We will pair off around 1.15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: $24 Day­pass during the meetup. For monthly/yearly membership, the Initiation Fee (currently $99) is waived (no discount on monthly dues, for yearly membership please inquire with the Cliffs for discount). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is FREE for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101/Top-rope basic class is offered 50% Off. Must sign­up and pay in advance by calling the Cliffs at 718­729­76125.</a>

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late or can't find the group leave a message in the Comments section.  Food/drinks apres-climb at John Brown Smokehouse next door (or whichever resto the group decides). Even if you only want to have a beer with us, that is also acceptable :)

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them). This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day. Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC <a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/">http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;)

results.description:
Here's a video from our last performance, Funk! "Cissy Strut"

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ow7JjaVa3bU

This is a Blues Rock Jam Ensemble.

We will have charts and specific guitar parts as well as lots of room to jam and develop solo technique.

We'll play Cream, Zeppelin, B.B.King, Hendrix and more classics of rock and blues.

Acoustic, electric guitars and bass welcome. If electric bring a portable amp:)


Vocals welcome!

This ensemble welcomes ALL LEVELS, so pick your part and let's play! 

To join:

• RSVP before you attend the session.

• Choose your guitar part from TAB>MORE>FILES download/print and bring it to practice to follow. (check by 12/30)

• Bring acoustic guitar or electric with a portable amp. 

• Have an amazing time!

Practice days are:

Every Sunday 3-5pm starting January 10th til April 17th, a week before the performance, 15 practice sessions.

Season Pass

You can purchase the Season Pass (15 sessions at discount + $30 show fee) for $365  (you save $40 on practice sessions)

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=2VLVLRLATSNKU


Show Day is Sunday, May 1st at 3pm

The show will be at Arlene's Grocery in the East Village April 24th at 1pm(soundcheck) and doors at 2pm. Arlene's is an awesome show venue with professional stage, sound and lights, everyone will be miked or amplified. If you are coming to rehearsal with a portable amp you should also bring it to the venue.

We will have a drummer and a singer TBA.

There will be tickets for this show, they can be purchase before hand at $5 or at the door for $10.

There is a show fee of $30 for each ensemble member that will go toward venue, sound engineer and hired musicians costs.

Arlene's Grocery is strictly 21+ and no children will be allowed at the show even if they are accompanied by the parent, I'm sorry:( 

There are two bars on site and lots of food spots and great restaurants in the area for before or after the show.

Let's jam those tunes!

Check out our website at http://edelage.wix.com/edge
results.name: Blues Rock Jam Ensemble

results.description:
This is a weekly introductory improv class taught Sunday 1-3pm.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 

-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

This class is $10.  If money is an issue for you, let me know and we can work something out.  The cost goes to pay for the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  

Hope to see you there!


Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater. He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

results.description:
We had our first Meet Up March 19th I would like to thank everyone that attended. Judging by some of your comments I think it may have been a bit different, but still a successes. Our goal is to get everyone out sailing, this is the quickest way to learn and build confidence.

Our next Meet Up will be April 10th at 1pm At this meeting skippers will be available to discuss sailing dates for the coming season. We hope to have everyone on the water by the first week in June.

Later that same afternoon (5pm) you are invited to attend a Sailboat Racing Seminar, this class will be given by Paul Beaudin a member of the HYC race committee. Paul is an accomplished sailor and has raced both offshore and Club races, he also manages Doyle Sails on City Island.

We will be offering more free seminars in both sailing and power boating along with some cruising and safety courses starting in May. We are hoping to have a June Meet Up on the water in the form of a raft up!

This is going to a great season stay in touch.

Of course cocktails and appetizers will be served


Feel free to contact me or Dave Rietman with any questions.

Anthony Rosco

results.description:
FUTSAL ON SUNDAY AFTERNOONS

MUST RSVP ONLINE

Full refunds will be issued only when reservations are cancelled 24 hours before start time (Saturday 1pm) AT LATEST

You can RSVP for multiple players until slots are filled. 

Start time is 1pm and will run until 3:30pm. 


Gym floor, so wear flats. 1 flight upstairs from entrance door.

No goalies, so NO GOALKEEPING. The area marked with blue tape in front of each goal is called the "Box". Players cannot interfere with or touch the ball inside own Box while defending. Braking this rule results in a penalty shot without a goalie from either opposing corner. Players in pocession inside opponent's Box results in loss of possession. Team in possession can enter own box freely. All players are allowed to "reach" inside opposing Box to retrieve, re-direct, pass,  or score, provided that, in the process, no contact is made with the floor inside the Box. 


We will play 8-minute round-robin matches (winners stay on). There will be 3 teams of 5 players (4 and a sub). First team to score 3 goals wins the match. Winners must continue to win to stay on. Consecutive tied matches will be decided by coin flip. 

 Absolutely no Slide tackling is allowed. 


Please understand that in order to keep this meet-up active, we must enforce a No Fighting policy. Anyone fighting will be removed from the group.

So, let's do this! For any questions please contact me via Meet-up.

                       ~~~~@🔸☢🎱⚽️⚖⚽️🎱☢🔸@~~~~

                                  🔹🔶🔷🔵📛🔵🔷🔶🔹

FUTSAL DOMINGOS POR LA TARDE

HAY QUE RESERVAR EN LINEA

Re-enbolso de su pago se permitirá solo si se cancela 24 horas antes del evento (Sabado 1pm) AL MAS TARDAR.

Podras reservar para jugadores multiples hasta que se llenen los cupos.

Comenzamos a las 1pm y jugamos hasta las 3:30pm


Se juega sobre piso de gimnasio asi que usen zapatos de "indoor"

No hay porteros, asi que NO SE PUEDE PORTEREAR.  El area immediatamente en frente de cada arco y marcada con cinta azul se llama el "Cuadro".  Ningún jugador puede tocar o interferir con la trayectória del balón mientras éste se encuentre dentro de su Cuadro cuando se esté defendiendo. Violación de ésta regla resulta en penal sin portero desde cualquier esquina opuesta. Atacante ingresando al Cuadro opuesto equivale a pérdida de posesión.  Equipo en posesión puede ingresar a su Cuadro libremente. Cualquier jugador puede re-dirigir, pasar, sacar, o anotar el balón dentro del Cuadro opuesto siempre y cuando su pié no haga contacto con el piso dentro del Cuadro. 

Se jugaran partidos de 8 minutos (ganadores siguen vivos). Habran 3 equipos de 5 jugadores (4 mas 1 cambio). El primero en anotar 3 goles gana el partido. Ganadores deberan seguir ganando para continuar vivos. Empates consecutivos se definirán por moneda.

Barridas estan Absolutamente Prohibidas

Por favor entiendan que para mantener este grupo acivo deberemos prohibir cualquier tipo de pelea o altercado. Todo aquel o aquella que pelee sera excluido (a) del grupo permanentemente. 

Asi que Vamos a Jugar!   Para cualquier consulta, por favor contacteme atravez de meetup.com.

Hi Everyone,

It's Chris Lima here. I will be hosting a HealthRHYTHMS Session for you on Sunday, April 10th, 2016. HealthRHYTHMS is a research-based life enhancement tool and program. It is a group drumming protocol that has demonstrated positive results in one's overall well being. This Group Empowerment Drumming Program promotes:

1.) Communication
2.) Stress Reduction
3.) Clarity
4.) Personal Expression
5.) Creativity and Bonding Enhancement

I am your Remo HealthRhythms Facilitator for this event, and would like you to please join me. When we can express what's truly on our minds through meditative and music related exercises, we can then begin to live full and healthy lives. Let's take that step together with the support of everyone joining us for this session. Take the time to learn more about yourself and others. That's what it's about :) Price for this Meetup is: $15.00. Please Bring:

1.) A drum, and any extras (if you have)
2.) Any small instruments. (if you have)
If you do not have a drum or any small instruments I will be providing some for this event....Not to worry! :) Plenty of time too, we have the space for 2 Hours, and can probably get a nice few Jams in for the end. I'm really looking forward to this, and I hope you can all make it out...Hope to see you there! :)

-Chris Lima

results.description:
Have you always wanted to try art journaling?  

Or are you someone that has more paints, papers and sprays than you want to admit? 

Are you looking for a creative, artsy community? 

http://designmemorycraft.typepad.com/.a/6a0134896f7ad2970c01a51171a0cf970c-800wi

*We will meet to create together and learn from each other! Heidi will share techniques as we go along but this event is more for the social aspect of making art together. There are no "set" projects or techniques-work on what you want to. Heidi will be creating art, too! 

*You will have access to Heidi's stencils, paints, sprays, etc. ($10 fee)

Please bring these supplies each week: 

*art journal

*adhesive-Matte Medium/gluesticks

*gesso

*something for color-acrylic paints, watercolor crayons, collage papers, watercolors, spray inks

*permanent pens/markers

*paintbrushes

*pencils for drawing

*stencils 

Check out Heidi's ART on her blog at: Gotham City Stampers

Hello Artists! Do you have those packs of paper with tons of sheets that you will never use up? How about great napkins with 100 in the pack? Tons of collage that you can't possibly use up? 
I thought it would be fun to bring along things that you want to share with the others at our ART JOURNALING CLUB EVENTS. (You certainly don't have to!) New art journalers are trying to build up their stash of goodies. Those of us that have been doing it for a bit love getting our hands on new things! You could also bring those supplies that you don't use-see if they can find a new home with someone from our group. 
I recently picked up two awesome packs of napkins that I love to use as background layers on my pages. I can't possibly use them all so everyone will be getting some. 
Again, no pressure to bring something but I wanted to put it out there as something fun to add to our already great time together!

results.description:
WALK EDGE OF HUDSON RIVER FROM WEST 79 ST.TO BATTERY PARK ON RIVERSIDE PARK ROUTE-GREENWAY TRAIL (PATH).


OUR WALKS END AT STARBUCKS, 1 BATTERY PARK PLAZA, 24 STATE ST., NEW YORK. West-Side (Hudson River) Greenway Trail (Path)


We meet at Starbucks located at 2140 Broadway/Corner of 75 St. and then walk to BOAT BASIN,W 79th Street TO Battery Park.


We will meet at 1:45 PM inside or outside the Starbucks or at the entrance gate of Starbucks and wait for everyone until 2:00 PM and then start our walk.

During this time, we meet and greet each other make new friends. At 2:00 PM we will walk towards to 79 St. and than make a left towards to Riverside Drive and Henry Hudson Parkway and entered down to Boat Basin and start walk on Greenway Path towards to Battery Park. We will be walking along the side of Hudson River all the way to Battery Park. We will start at 79 St. at BOAT BASIN Restaurant to for REST ROOM before start walk, When we walk towards to Battery park, sunset started at 4:45 PM and able to see all beautiful lights cross the Hudson River of the New Jersey area and New York area. We will be able to enjoy walk towards in daylight and than able to walk in evening sunset and able to see sunset behind the Liberty statues with all beautiful orange bright light of sunset coming from Hudson River. We will enjoy watching Nature with all beautiful colorful cloud during sunset next to river. We able to get several subway train from Battery park to go our home. Subway 4,5,R,,1 and other several subway train around there. Here's a great way to see New York City without having to sit a top a goofy double-decker bus! The West-Side Greenway begins at Battery Park (the lower tip of Manhattan) and continues north to the George Washington Bridge and beyond. This trip focuses on the sites between Battery Park and the 79th Street Boat basin.


DO NOT FORGET TO SCROLL DOWN OF THIS PAGE AND READ HISTORY OF THIS AREA PUBLISHED BY NYC PARKS DEPT.:


SUBWAY ROUTE:


Take the 2 or 3 Express subway train or Local 1 train to 72 nd St. and walk towards to 75 St. on Broadway. Starbucks is on 2140 Broadway at the corner of 75 St.


STARBUCKS LOCATION: 2140 Broadway at the corner of 75 St.


INFORMATION AND HISTORY PUBLISHED BY NYC ABOUT THIS WALKING ROUTE:

Battery Park was named after a row of cannons that were originally located at Castle Clinton, a circular fort built here in 1811 to defend against British attacks. The fort was later used as an immigration depot (pre-Ellis Island) and now serves as the ticket and information center for Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island ferry rides. Take a look as you pass by. Just after Battery Park, you'll have to continue north a short distance on the sidewalk until you eventually reach an entrance to the Battery Park Promenade. From here, you can look out across the Hudson River and see not only New Jersey, but one of America's most beloved landmarks, the Statue of Liberty. Since 1886, “Lady Liberty” has stood proudly in New York Harbor, inviting the world to “Give me your tired, your poor, your huddled masses yearning to breathe free.” The Statue of Liberty was designed by French master sculptor Frederic-Auguste Bartholdi, whose original vision was for the statue to mark Egypt's Suez Canal. After history and politics got in the way, Bartholdi looked to the west and decided his statue would be the perfect gift to celebrate America's Centennial. The base of the statue is built over the former Fort Woods and was engineered by Alexandre Gustave Eiffel, of Eiffel Tower fame. Just to the north of the statue is Ellis Island, the point of entry for 16 million immigrants between 1892 and 1924. Ferry rides and tours to both the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island are available from this point of the promenade. Next, find your way back west onto the promenade at Battery Park City, where the real fun begins. Shortly after entering, you will come across a massive courtyard lined with outdoor restaurants. This area surrounds one of NYC’s most prestigious boat docks, where on any given day, you are likely to see some of the most luxurious and expensive private vessels in the world. Take a moment to gaze, then continue your journey north. At the end of the promenade, follow the path to the right, where you will soon connect to the completed portion of the actual greenway. Up until now, your ride will have been completely free of automobile traffic. The West Side Greenway is designed to enable bicyclists and roller bladers to interact safely with automobile traffic entering the various piers along the Hudson River. From here on, be sure to follow all traffic signs and lights on the path and to keep your eyes open at all times. This will help ensure a safe, enjoyable ride, even with children to keep an eye on! As part of the west side revitalization effort, New York City is gradually converting many of its defunct shipping piers into entertainment complexes and tourist attractions. While much of the property along the greenway is still under construction, there are a few attractions that are already booming. The first is a small amusement park complete with kiddie rides, a snack bar, and other fun things to do. Then there are boat rentals, if you dare brave the mighty Hudson. Next, at around 23rd Street, is the mega sports complex at Chelsea Pier, one of downtown Manhattan’s hottest new attractions. Pedestrian traffic gets a little heavier beginning here, so be careful. Continuing north along the path, at 34th Street, look to your right for a clear view of New York City’s most famous fixture - the Empire State Building. Having held the record as the world’s tallest skyscraper for 40 years - the symbol of this city was constructed in only two years - 1930 to 31. Today, as always, this 1,453 foot colossus is one of Manhattan’s premier tourist magnets. Shortly ahead, at Pier 83 on 42nd Street, is the west side location of the Circle Line, one of NY City’s most popular day cruise liners. Also docked here are the various ships belonging to World Yacht Cruises, which provides elegant catered affairs on New York’s waterways. But if you think these are big ships, pedal just a little farther! At 46th Street, you will come across a series of vessels that will make every mega-yacht you’ve seen up to now look miniscule in comparison. First is the USS Intrepid, a Naval carrier built in 1943 which played a major role in the largest naval engagement in history, served as a prime recovery vessel for NASA, and completed three tours of duty during the Vietnam Conflict. The USS Intrepid is a National Historic Landmark which was saved from the scrap yard and restored by Zachary Fisher, who spent $24 million of his own money to turn the carrier into a sea, air, and space museum. Today, the museum draws more than 600,000 visitors annually. By the time you reach the Intrepid, you’ll have walked approximately five easy, flat miles and you’ll have seen enough to talk about for a long time. If you’re up for more, continue at least to West 79th Street and consider having lunch or dinner at the 79th Street Boat Basin Café. You may even want to continue into the 100 streets and cross the George Washington Bridge into New Jersey. It’s all safe and it’s all an excellent way to see New York up close. http://www.nycgovpark... Today, visitors can follow the Hudson River Greenway on Manhattan’s west side for 11 miles, from Battery Park, at the southern tip of Manhattan, to the Little Red Lighthouse, underneath the George Washington Bridge. This route passes through Hudson River Park, Riverside Park South, Riverside Park, and Fort Washington Park. SUBWAY ROUTE:


Take the 2 or 3 Express subway train or Local 1 train to 72 nd St. and walk towards to 75 St. on Broadway. Starbucks is on 2140 Broadway at the corner of 75 St.


STARBUCKS LOCATION: 2140 Broadway at the corner of 75 St.


INFORMATION AND HISTORY PUBLISHED BY NYC ABOUT THIS WALKING ROUTE:


Battery Park was named after a row of cannons that were originally located at Castle Clinton, a circular fort built here in 1811 to defend against British attacks. The fort was later used as an immigration depot (pre-Ellis Island) and now serves as the ticket and information center for Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island ferry rides. Take a look as you pass by. Just after Battery Park, you'll have to continue north a short distance on the sidewalk until you eventually reach an entrance to the Battery Park Promenade. From here, you can look out across the Hudson River and see not only New Jersey, but one of America's most beloved landmarks, the Statue of Liberty. Since 1886, “Lady Liberty” has stood proudly in New York Harbor, inviting the world to “Give me your tired, your poor, your huddled masses yearning to breathe free.” The Statue of Liberty was designed by French master sculptor Frederic-Auguste Bartholdi, whose original vision was for the statue to mark Egypt's Suez Canal. After history and politics got in the way, Bartholdi looked to the west and decided his statue would be the perfect gift to celebrate America's Centennial. The base of the statue is built over the former Fort Woods and was engineered by Alexandre Gustave Eiffel, of Eiffel Tower fame. Just to the north of the statue is Ellis Island, the point of entry for 16 million immigrants between 1892 and 1924. Ferry rides and tours to both the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island are available from this point of the promenade. Next, find your way back west onto the promenade at Battery Park City, where the real fun begins. Shortly after entering, you will come across a massive courtyard lined with outdoor restaurants. This area surrounds one of NYC’s most prestigious boat docks, where on any given day, you are likely to see some of the most luxurious and expensive private vessels in the world. Take a moment to gaze, then continue your journey north. At the end of the promenade, follow the path to the right, where you will soon connect to the completed portion of the actual greenway. Up until now, your ride will have been completely free of automobile traffic. The West Side Greenway is designed to enable bicyclists and roller bladers to interact safely with automobile traffic entering the various piers along the Hudson River. From here on, be sure to follow all traffic signs and lights on the path and to keep your eyes open at all times. This will help ensure a safe, enjoyable ride, even with children to keep an eye on! As part of the west side revitalization effort, New York City is gradually converting many of its defunct shipping piers into entertainment complexes and tourist attractions. While much of the property along the greenway is still under construction, there are a few attractions that are already booming. The first is a small amusement park complete with kiddie rides, a snack bar, and other fun things to do. Then there are boat rentals, if you dare brave the mighty Hudson. Next, at around 23rd Street, is the mega sports complex at Chelsea Pier, one of downtown Manhattan’s hottest new attractions. Pedestrian traffic gets a little heavier beginning here, so be careful. Continuing north along the path, at 34th Street, look to your right for a clear view of New York City’s most famous fixture - the Empire State Building. Having held the record as the world’s tallest skyscraper for 40 years - the symbol of this city was constructed in only two years - 1930 to 31. Today, as always, this 1,453 foot colossus is one of Manhattan’s premier tourist magnets. Shortly ahead, at Pier 83 on 42nd Street, is the west side location of the Circle Line, one of NY City’s most popular day cruise liners. Also docked here are the various ships belonging to World Yacht Cruises, which provides elegant catered affairs on New York’s waterways. But if you think these are big ships, pedal just a little farther! At 46th Street, you will come across a series of vessels that will make every mega-yacht you’ve seen up to now look miniscule in comparison. First is the USS Intrepid, a Naval carrier built in 1943 which played a major role in the largest naval engagement in history, served as a prime recovery vessel for NASA, and completed three tours of duty during the Vietnam Conflict. The USS Intrepid is a National Historic Landmark which was saved from the scrap yard and restored by Zachary Fisher, who spent $24 million of his own money to turn the carrier into a sea, air, and space museum. Today, the museum draws more than 600,000 visitors annually. By the time you reach the Intrepid, you’ll have walked approximately five easy, flat miles and you’ll have seen enough to talk about for a long time. If you’re up for more, continue at least to West 79th Street and consider having lunch or dinner at the 79th Street Boat Basin Café. You may even want to continue into the 100 streets and cross the George Washington Bridge into New Jersey. It’s all safe and it’s all an excellent way to see New York up close. http://www.nycgovpark... Today, visitors can follow the Hudson River Greenway on Manhattan’s west side for 11 miles, from Battery Park, at the southern tip of Manhattan, to the Little Red Lighthouse, underneath the George Washington Bridge. This route passes through Hudson River Park, Riverside Park South, Riverside Park, and Fort Washington Park. In the past two years, Parks completed four vital links in the greenway –Riverside Park South, Cherry Walk, Riverbank Link, Fort Washington Link -- and is designing additional waterfront segments that will replace existing in-land detours. This Hudson River Greenway will serve as New York City’s port portion of the Hudson River Valley Greenway, a state initiative promoted by Governor Pataki.

You may even want to continue into the 100 streets and cross the George Washington Bridge into New Jersey. It’s all safe and it’s all an excellent way to see New York up close. http://www.nycgovpark... Today, visitors can follow the Hudson River Greenway on Manhattan’s west side for 11 miles, from Battery Park, at the southern tip of Manhattan, to the Little Red Lighthouse, underneath the George Washington Bridge. This route passes through Hudson River Park, Riverside Park South, Riverside Park, and Fort Washington Park. In the past two years, Parks completed four vital links in the greenway –Riverside Park South, Cherry Walk, Riverbank Link, Fort Washington Link -- and is designing additional waterfront segments that will replace existing in-land detours. This Hudson River Greenway will serve as New York City’s port portion of the Hudson River Valley Greenway, a state initiative promoted by Governor Pataki.


OUR NEXT WALK CAN BE FOR GEORGE WASHINGTON BRIDGE AND PASS INTO NEW JERSEY OBER THE BRIDGE.



You pay Cash when you arrived for the event.
results.name: WALK ALONG THE HUDSON RIVER FROM 79 ST TO BATTERY PARK ON GREENWAY PATH - 6 MILE

results.description:
The Stilt-Sands are destroyed, and a terrible leviathan has awoken to plague the Ten Isles once more. All that remains of hundreds of sails and thousands of sailors are two ships and three hundred souls. Precipice Port is a fortnight away, the only destination for hundreds of miles of ocean, and you must reach it. Not all is as it seems amongst the sailors and refugees, however. Someone or something has slipped aboard, and its intentions are surely murderous. Can you reveal the hidden evil before it is too late?

Fortnight of Fear is the fourth chapter for the WildPig Exclusive Campaign "Sailing Against the Wind" by Noah Anderson. New and returning players are welcome. Characters are 7th level, with a limit of 8 players per session. There will be time for character creation a half-hour before the first session. Seats are limited, so please register ahead of time.

Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 2.00pm and finishes at 2.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.
